restore: 指建筑物、工艺品恢复原状，也指健康、能力等的恢复。
reclaim: 主要指回收或利用废物。
recover: 普通用词，含义广，可泛指收回去的物质的或精神的东西，也指无意中找到失物。


vt. 恢复；修复；归还
 - replace, return, repair
vi. 恢复；还原
 - recover from, unsave
examples: [联想] re返回+store商店（回厂修理）v.恢复，归还，修复，重建
英 [rɪ'stɔː(r)] 美 [rɪ'stɔːr]
vt.恢复；归还；复原

(1) The military government promised to restore democracy within one year.(2) Drastic measures will have to be taken to restore order.(3) The police must try to restore order.(4) The new manager's job is to restore the company to profitability.(5) I feel quite restored to health after my holiday.(6) The stolen property must be restored to its owner.(7) It's easy to kill,but impossible to restore life.
(1) 军人政府答应在一年内重新建立民主体制。(2) 为恢复秩序必须采取严厉措施。(3) 警方必须努力恢复治安。(4) 新经理的工作是让这家公司能恢复盈利状况。(5) 假期过后，我觉得健康恢复得相当不错。(6) 赃物必须物归原主。(7) 杀生容易,回生难。
[sound:youdao-3bb6969b-9f865249-0c52e3a4-5cf1b495-4c3a446b.mp3]

translation:
vt. 抑制，压抑; 限定，限制; 制止; 监禁

时态：restrained, restraining, restrains
分布：抑制(88%)，阻止(9%)，束缚(2%)，剥夺(1%)


→re-,向后，往回，-strain,拉，词源同 constrain,constrict.即拉回，引申词义限制，约束。
抑制,限制(re回+strain[stirain,striet,string=tighten,表示"拉紧"]
v.(from)抑制,制止Strain brain on the train is restrained.在列车上过度用脑受到约束.
【记】源于：restrict（v 限制；限定）【反】impel（v 推动；激励）；release（vt 释放；解放）



verb transitive ■to control the actions or behaviour of someone by force, especially in order to stop them from doing something, or to limit the growth or force of something 阻止，制止；遏制
•When he started fighting, it took four police officers to restrain him.他要是出手打人，要四个员警才能把他制服。

•[R] She was so angry that she could hardly restrain her self.她气得几乎都控制不了自己了。

•You should try to restrain your ambitions and be more realistic.你应该尽量控制自己的野心，更现实一些。

•Growth in car ownership could be restrained by increasing taxes.或许可以透过提高税费来限制汽车保有量的增长。





bridle, check, refrain, curb, inhibit, restrain

这组词都有“阻止、抑制、制止”的意思，其区别是：
bridle: 指抑制住强烈的感情或欲望。
check: 多指阻止前进或继续发展。
refrain: 常指暂时对某种行动或冲动的抑制。
curb: 可指急剧或果断的制止，也可指用严格的方法加以控制。
inhibit: 主要指抑制愿望、情绪或念头，也指制止某物的蔓延。
restrain: 含义广，指用强力或权力去阻止或限制某人做某事。



limit, restrain, bind, confine

limit: （能力或数量上）有限的
restrain: 抑制的，遏制的，可指彻底阻止也可指将……纳入控制、约束之中，强迫意味，可表示自我抑制vt
bind: 有约束力的
confine: （空间上）受限的



constrain, refrain, restrain

constrain: v.强迫，力劝，是及物动词。
 • A law constrains the government from spending more money than it takes in.   法律限制政府开支大于收入。
refrain: v.抑制，禁止，强调抑制一种冲动，是正式用语，为不及物动词，后接介词from。
 • Students refrain from smoking in the classroom.   学生们克制住不在教师抽烟。
restrain: v.抑制，约束，指通过管束阻止某事发生，是及物动词，其习惯用法是restrain sb. (sth.) from doing。
 • She restrains her dog by walking him on a leash.   溜狗时，她牵着狗来限制它的活动。



grant, restrain, bind

grant: 由于慷慨、仁慈而给予某物，通常是应请求人或根据权力要求的人（通常指下级）以某一要求所给予的东西
restrain: 抑制的，遏制的，可指彻底阻止也可指将……纳入控制、约束之中，强迫意味，可表示自我抑制vt
bind: 有约束力的


vt. 抑制，控制；约束；制止
 - possess, regulate, contain, manage, bottle
examples: 英 [rɪ'streɪn] 美 [rɪ'streɪn]
vt.抑制；阻止；束缚；剥夺
(1) He couldn't restrain his curiosity.(2) She tried to restrain her sobs.(3) Shame may restrain what the law does not prohibit.(4) We must not restrain children of their liberty.
(1) 他抑制不住自己的好奇心。(2) 她设法抑制住自己的悲泣。(3) 羞耻或许能阻止法律所不能禁止之事。(4) 我们绝对不要限制孩子们的自由。
[sound:youdao-c3d4eafe-2742e40b-b0dcd05d-fcaf1bfb-4868a424.mp3]

translation:
n. 抑制，克制; 控制，限制; 拘束; 约束力

分布：克制(76%)，抑制(16%)，束缚(8%)


→来自 restrain,限制，约束，-t,过去分词格，此处形容词作名词。
抑制,限制[stirain,striet,string=tighten,表示"拉紧"]
n.抑制,制止She talked to me without restraint.她毫无拘束地跟我交谈.
【反】ebullience（n 沸腾；热情）；bridled（adj 顺从的）－without restraint（不受约束的）



noun uncountable ■calm and controlled behaviour 克制；平心静气；冷静
•He showed admirable restraint, and refused to be provoked.他表现出极大的克制，面对挑衅泰然处之。

•The security forces exercised (= used) great restraint by not responding to hostile attacks and threats.面对充满敌意的攻击和威胁，安全部队没有进行还击，表现出极大的克制。
countable or uncountable ■something which limits the freedom of someone or something, or which prevents something from growing or increasing 阻止；抑制，遏制
•government spending restraints对政府开支的限制

•Lack of space is the main restraint on the firm's expansion plans.建筑空间的缺乏是阻碍这间公司实施其扩建计划的主要原因。

•During the recession, the government opted for a policy of pay/wage restraint rather than a reduction in public investment.在经济衰退时期，政府选择的政策是限制工资增长，而不是削减公共投资。
keep/place sb under restraint ■to keep a violent person in a way that prevents them from moving freely 限制（某人）的人身自由；对（某人）进行管制
•The two prisoners were kept under restraint while they were transported between prisons.在转监途中，两名犯人受到了人身限制。





confinement, confinement, concentrate, restraint, focus, limitation

这组词都有“限制，局限”的意思，其区别是：
confinement: n.限制，囚禁(于某地或某种境地)。
 • The prisoner was sentenced to three months' solitary confinement.   那犯人被判处单独监禁三个月。
confinement: limitation, restraint
concentrate: v.集中，集中精力(后接on，宾语可以是具体或抽象的东西)；浓缩，压缩。
 • During exams, students concentrate hard on answering the questions.   考试期间，同学们集中精力回答问题。
restraint: n.克制，抑制；约束措施。
 • Even though the mother was very angry, she acted with restraint and didn't yell at her child.   即使母亲很生气，她仍克制自己没有向孩子大吼。
focus: v.集中(于某事物)；将(注意力等)集中于……(后接on，宾语一般不是具体的东西)。
 • Please focus your minds on the following problem.   请集中考虑以下问题。
limitation: n.限制，局限；(能力的)缺点，弱点。
 • That employee has limitations on what work he can do.   那个雇员能做的工作有限。


n. [电子]  [通信] 抑制，克制；约束
 - checking, control, suppression, inhibition, constraint
examples: 英 [rɪ'streɪnt] 美 [rɪ'streɪnt]
n.克制；抑制；束缚

(1) The police appealed to the crowd for restraint.(2) Nobody could count on his restraint or rationality.(3) There is still need for profit restraint.(4) I am under no restraint whatever.(5) He is a man always speaking with restraint.
(1) 警方呼吁群众保持克制。(2) 谁也不能指望他会克制或讲道理的态度。(3) 现在仍有必要限制利润。(4) 我不受任何束缚。(5) 他是个说话拘谨的人。
[sound:youdao-53083e87-abcbcb2b-369734b4-a5f5eec0-ee39d92d.mp3]

translation:
vt. 限制，限定; 约束，束缚

时态：restricted, restricting, restricts
分布：限制(93%)，约束(7%)


→来自 restrain,限制，约束，-ct,过去分词格，此处形容词作名词。
限制,限定(re回+strict→拉回来→限制)[stirain,striet,string=tighten,表示"拉紧"]
v.限制,约束The speed is restricted to 50 kilometers an hour here.在此地车速被限制为每小时五十公里.



verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to limit the movements or actions of someone, or to limit something and reduce its size or prevent it from increasing 限制；限定；妨碍
•measures to restrict the sale of alcohol限制酒类销售的措施

•The government has restricted freedom of movement into and out of the country.政府已经限制出入境自由了。

•Having small children really restricts your social life.家里有很小的孩子确实会妨碍你的社交生活。

[rɪ'strɪkt] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [R] restrict yourself to sth ■to limit yourself to one particular thing or activity 约束自己不越出…的范围；将自己限制在…限度内
•If I'm driving, I restrict myself to one glass of wine.我要开车的时候，只许自己喝一杯葡萄酒。





limit, restrict, confine

这组词都有“限制，限定”的意思，其区别是：
limit: 一般指事先确定空间、时间或数量的极限，一旦超越限度，就会造成不良结果。当然也可指不事先规定，而且自然的或固有的界限。
restrict: 指把某人或物限制在一定范围之内。
confine: 侧重施加不可逾越的限制，有时暗示束缚、囚禁。


vt. 限制；约束；限定
 - block, set a limit to
examples: 英 [rɪ'strɪkt] 美 [rɪ'strɪkt]
vt.限制；约束

(1) In a move to restrict imports, the government raised custom duties.(2) Recent laws have tended to restrict the freedom of the press.(3) I restrict myself to smoking two cigarettes a day.(4) Fog restricted visibility.(5) You are restricted to eight liters of duty-free wine.(6) Their policy was to restrict our growth.(7) Will realty restrict Chinese economy?
(1) 政府在限制进口的措施中提高了关税。(2) 新法例有限制新闻自由的趋势。(3) 我限定自己每天只抽两支烟。(4) 雾天能见度很低。(5) 携带的免税酒不得超过八升。(6) 他们的政策是限制我们的发展。(7) 房地产会制约中国经济吗?
[sound:youdao-199dbbd2-027bc9a2-183d8c0b-b6692a1f-6c5df18d.mp3]

translation:
n. 限制，限定; 拘束，束缚; 管制

分布：限制(86%)，约束(14%)


限制[stirain,striet,string=tighten,表示"拉紧"]



noun countable or uncountable  IMPROVER  ■an official limit on something 受（尤指官方）限制的，受约束的
•import/export/currency restrictions进口／出口／货币限制

•speed/parking restrictions速度／停车限制

•At the turn of the century, Congress imposed/placed a height restriction of 13 storeys on all buildings in Washington.在世纪之交，国会对华盛顿的建筑实行了不得超过13层的高度限制。

•The president urged other countries to lift the trade restrictions.总统敦促其他国家取消贸易限制。




n. 限制；约束；束缚
 - limitation, qualification, chain, constraint
examples: 英 [rɪ'strɪkʃn] 美 [rɪ'strɪkʃn]
n.限制；约束

(1) The swimming club is open to families in the neighborhood without restriction.(2) The sale of firearms is subject to many legal restrictions.(3) There are currency restrictions on the sums allowed for foreign travel.(4) Enforced isolation or restriction of free movement imposed to prevent the spread of contagious disease.(5) As far as I am concerned, corruption is avoidable with the restriction of law.
(1) 这个游泳俱乐部对邻近地区的家庭开放，不受限制。(2) 出售枪支受到许多法律限制。(3) 到国外旅行允许携带的款额有所限制。(4) 隔离为了防止传染疾病的传播，而强制施行的隔离或对自由活动的限制(5) 在我看来,腐败是可以通过法律的约束避免的。
[sound:youdao-fd8ff2d0-e09e58c0-4c3e64be-a41d7d7c-d1a927d2.mp3]

translation:
n. 结果; （尤指足球比赛的）胜利; [体]比分; 成功实现的事
vi. 发生，产生; 归结为，导致; 后果，终结; 由…而造成[产生]

时态：resulted, resulting, results
分布：结果(79%)，产生(11%)，成果(4%)，成绩(3%)，答案(2%)，致使(1%)


→re-,向后，往回，-sul,跳，词源同 salient,resilient.即跳回，引申词义结果，后果。
结果(re反问+sult→反回来的东西→结果)[sult=leap,表示"跳"]
n.结果,成绩v.结果,致使,导致,由...而造成The insult to the adult consulter results in multiplication of the faulty faucets.对成年咨询者的侮辱导致有缺陷水龙头成倍增加.



noun BECAUSE OF  因为   ESSENTIAL  countable or only singular ■something that happens or exists because of something else 结果；后果
•The road has been widened, but the result is just more traffic.道路被拓宽，但结果车流量却更大了。

•His broken leg is the direct result of his own carelessness.他自己的粗心大意直接导致他摔断了腿。

•I tried to repaint the kitchen walls with disastrous results.我试图重新粉刷一下厨房的墙，结果却弄得一塌糊涂。

•To ensure good/the best results, use Italian tomatoes and fresh basil.为了保证做好后口味好／最佳，要用义大利番茄和新鲜的罗勒。
as a result of sth  IMPROVER  ■because of something 因为…；由于…
•Profits have declined as a result of the recent drop in sales.由于最近销售量滑坡，利润下降了。
countable usually plural ■a good or pleasing effect 成效；成果
•We've spent a lot of money on advertising and we're beginning to see the results.我们已经花了很多钱来做广告，我们的付出现在开始见成效了。

•She's an excellent coach who knows how to get results.她是个优秀的教练，知道如何取得好的训练效果。

[rɪ'zʌlt] noun TEST  测试   IMPROVER  countable ■the information you get from something such as a scientific experiment or medical test （科学实验或医学检查的）结果
•The results of the opinion poll showed that most women supported this action.民意调查结果显示，大多数女性支援这一行动。
 IMPROVER  countable ■the mark you receive after you have taken an examination or test （考试或测试的）成绩
•I finished my exams yesterday, but I won't know/get the results until August.我昨天考完试，但是考试成绩要到八月份才能知道。

[rɪ'zʌlt] noun ANSWER  答案   ADVANCED  countable ■the answer to a calculation in mathematics （计算的）结果，答案
•We used different methods of calculation, but we both got the same result.我们俩用了不同的计算方法，但是得出的结果都一样。

[rɪ'zʌlt] noun COMPETITION  比赛   ADVANCED  countable ■the score or number of votes, showing the success or failure of the people involved, in a competitive activity such as a sports competition or an election （选举的）结果；（比赛的）成绩，比分
•the results of the local elections地方选举结果

•the football results足球比赛的比分

•We were expecting to win, so a draw was a disappointing result for us.我们期望赢得比赛，所以平局的结果令我们失望。
countable UK informal ■a win in a sports competition （体育比赛中）胜局，获胜
•The team needs a result to go through to the semi-finals.这支球队必须要赢得一场比赛才能打进半决赛。

[rɪ'zʌlt] verb intransitive ■to happen or exist because something else has happened （因为…）发生；（随…）产生
•Teachers were not fully prepared for the major changes in the exam system, and chaos resulted.老师们对考试制度的重大变化没有做好充分准备，因此出现了混乱的局面。

[rɪ'zʌlt] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   result from sth ■If a situation or problem results from a particular event or activity, it is caused by it 因…发生，由于…导致
•His difficulty in walking results from a childhood illness.童年时的一场疾病导致他行走困难。

[rɪ'zʌlt] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   result in sth  ESSENTIAL  ■to cause a particular situation to happen 导致；结果造成
•The fire resulted in damage to their property.他们的财产因火灾蒙受了损失。

•[+ -ing verb] Icy road conditions in Teesdale resulted in two roads being closed.蒂斯戴尔地区路面结冰，导致两条公路被封闭。





arise, result, originate

这组词都有“起源，源自”的意思，其区别是：
arise: 多与from连用，侧重指从无到有的产生，表一种因果关系。
result: 侧重变化的最终结果。
originate: 强调产生变化的起源。



result, effect, outcome, consequence

这组词都有“结果”的意思，其区别是：
result: 普通用词，含义广泛，侧重因某种原因所产生的最终结果，而不是眼前的结果。
effect: 指因某种原因直接产生的结果，着重持续稳定与其影响。
outcome: 普通用词，多指事物经过一系列发展变化所导致的最终结局，而不是某种原因的直接结果。常可与result通用。
consequence: 多指随某一事件引起的，必然或自然的不良结果，不强调直接的因果关系，而侧重事件发展的逻辑关系。


n. 结果；成绩；答案；比赛结果
 - outcome, product, event, consequence, grade
vi. 结果；导致；产生
 - set, account, breed
examples: 英 [rɪ'zʌlt] 美 [rɪ'zʌlt]
n.结果；成果；答案；成绩；(足球比赛)赢v.产生；致使

(1) These problems are the result of years of bad management.(2) The presumable result is an election defeat.(3) She looked with pride at the result of her work.(4) If you cube 10, the result is 1000.(5) He is indifferent to the result of the exam.(6) We desperately need a result from this match.(7) If this football team doesn't get a result tonight, they will be put down into a lower division.(8) If law and order break down, anarchy will result.(9) These toxic blooms result from changes in the ocean water.(10) The accident resulted in the death of two passengers.
(1) 这些问题是由于多年管理不善而造成的。(2) 推测结果是竞选可能会失败。(3) 她自豪地看着自己的工作成果.(4) 十自乘两次,结果为一千。(5) 他对考试结果漠不关心。(6) 这场比赛我们务必获胜。(7) 如果今晚这支足球队不能赢球，他们将会被降级。(8) 法治一垮，就会出现无政府状态。(9) 这些有毒的菌绒由于海水的变化而产生。(10) 这起事故导致两名乘客丧生。
[sound:youdao-f9f4866f-a0c4a21d-b23a7617-eee97b74-882a5762.mp3]

translation:
v. 重新开始; 继续; 恢复职位

时态：resumed, resuming, resumes
分布：简历(73%)，履历(15%)，重新开始(9%)，摘要(2%)，再继续(1%)


→re-,再，重新，-sum,承担，拿起，词源同 assume,consume.引申词义重新开始，继续，总结， 小结等，后用于指简历，履历。
拿回;恢复(自由等)(re回+sun+e→拿回去,也可解释为重新拿起,继续)[sum,sumpt=take表示"拿,取"]
n.个人简历v.再继续,重新开始;再用;恢复The perfume consumer presumably assumes that the volume is resumed.香水消费者假定地设想音量已恢复.



US [-'zu:m] formal verb  IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■If an activity resumes, or if you resume it, it starts again after a pause （中断后）继续，重新开始
•Normal services will be resumed in the spring.春天将恢复正常服务。

•[+ -ing verb] He stopped to take a sip of water and then resumed speaking.他停下来呷了一口水，然后继续发言。

•The talks are due to resume today.会谈预定今天继续进行。
⇒ See also resumptiontransitive ■If you resume a place or position which you have left for a period of time, you return to it 恢复；重新回到，重返（某地或某位置）
•to resume your post/job重返工作岗位

•Please resume your seats, as the performance will continue in two minutes.请大家回到自己的座位上去，两分钟后演出继续。





abstract, summary, resume, digest, outline

这组词都有“摘要、概要、概括”的意思，其区别是：
abstract: 指论文、书籍等正文前的内容摘要，尤指学术论文或法律文件的研究提要。
summary: 普通用词，指将书籍或文章等的内容，用寥寥数语作简明扼要的说明。
resume: 源于洁语，与summary极相近，通常可互换使用。
digest: 侧重对原文融汇贯通，重新谋篇布局，以简明扼要的语言，简短篇幅成文，展现原作精华。
outline: 指配以释议文字的提纲。



resume, succeed, continue, go on

这组词都有“继续”的意思，其区别是：
resume: 指中断后的继续。
succeed: 侧重指有规律地连续。
continue: 普通用词。或指持续而不停止，或有一段中断后又继续下去。
go on: 通俗用词，多用于口语中。go on+-ing表暂停后继续做原事，即后继续的内容与原来的内容相同。go on+不定式指做完某事后，接着做不同的另一件事。


n. [管理] 履历；个人简历；摘要
 - bio, abstract, brief, summary, record
vt. 重新开始；重新获得
 - recover, start over
examples: 英 [rɪ'zjuːm] 美 [rɪ'zuːm]
v.重新开始；再继续n.简历；履历；摘要

(1) We resumed our work after a rest.(2) I tried to persuade her to resume her job as secretary.(3) Two days later, they resumed their journey.(4) We'll stop now and resume at two o'clock.(5) I enclosed my resume in my letter.(6) Do you have a resume with you?(7) The professor asked Peter to write a resume about this book.
(1) 休息之后我们重新开始工作。(2) 我试图劝她重新干她的秘书工作。(3) 两天以後,他们继续旅行。(4) 我们现在停下来, 到两点再干。(5) 我在信里附上了我的简历。(6) 你带个人履历了吗?(7) 教授要求彼得写这本书的梗概。
[sound:youdao-e308ab30-9969eafa-3a45c05d-0a0f0846-0f8d42a9.mp3]

translation:
vt. 保持; 留在心中，记住; 雇用; 付定金保留

时态：retained, retaining, retains
分布：保留(57%)，保持(34%)，记住(8%)，聘请(1%)


→re-,向后，往回，-tain,保持，词源同 contain,tenure.
维持,保留(re回+tain→拿回来→保留)[tain,ten,tin=hold表示"拿住"]
v.保持,保留Having attained the entertaining center, the retained man was detained and sustained pain.到达娱乐中心后,聘请的男子遭到拘留并经受到痛苦.
【记】re反复，tain拿－反复拿住－保留【参】retention（n 保持力）；retentive（adj 保持的；有记忆力的）【反】discard（v 放弃）



verb transitive  IMPROVER  slightly formal ■to keep or continue to have something 保持；保留；保有
•She has lost her battle to retain control of the company.她被打败了，失去了继续掌管公司的权力。

•He managed to retain his dignity throughout the performance.在整个表演过程中，他设法保持了自己的尊严。

•She succeeded in retaining her lead in the second half of the race.在比赛的后半程中，她成功地保住了领先地位。

•I have a good memory and am able to retain (= remember) facts easily.我记忆力很好，记东西不费劲。
■slightly formal ■If a substance retains something, such as heat or water, it continues to hold or contain it 保存；留住；容纳
•The sea retains the sun's warmth longer than the land.海水储存太阳的热量的时间比陆地要长。
⇒ See also retentionlegal■to get the services of a lawyer by paying them before you need them 付定金聘请（律师）




conserve, reserve, retain, withhold, preserve, keep

这组词都有“保持，保存”的意思，其区别是：
conserve: 一般指保存自然资源，保全人的精力、力量等。
reserve: 正式用词，指为了将来的用途或其他用途而保存、保留。
retain: 指继续保持。
withhold: 指扣住不放，暗示有阻碍。
preserve: 主要指为防止损害、变质等而保存。
keep: 最常用词，指长时间牢固地保持或保存。


vt. 保持；雇；记住
 - keep up, to keep
examples: [联想] tain 保持拿好。 retain：保持 （不停回来拿）attain：达到 （强调一直拿好，就能达到）contain：含有 （全部一起拿）detain：拘留（拿不好的）蕊特，这朵花蕊特别漂亮，要保持好
英 [rɪ'teɪn] 美 [rɪ'teɪn]
vt.保持；保留；记住；聘请

(1) His speech could not retain the interest of his audience.(2) I will retain my right.(3) Does it retain the key elements of the original story?(4) She has a good memory and finds it easy to retain matters.(5) He retained the best lawyer in the state to defend his case.
(1) 他的讲话不能保持住听众的兴趣。(2) 我将保留我的权力。(3) 它是否保留了原作的关键要素?(4) 她记忆力好,很容易记住事情。(5) 他为他的案子聘了该州最好的律师。

translation:
vt. （以不同的方式或语言）复述，重述

时态：retold, retelling, retells
分布：复述(87%)，再讲(13%)


→re-,再，重新，tell,告诉。




vt. 复述；再讲；重述
 - read back, repeat back
examples: 英 [ˌriː'tel] 美 [ˌriː'tel]
v.复述；再讲
(1) The teacher asked the students to retell the story they just read.(2) After you have read these stories, retell them in your own words.
(1) 老师要求学生们复述他们刚读的故事。(2) 把这些故事看完之后，用你自己的话再讲一遍。
[sound:youdao-d7e73c8d-0175b9d9-4416cda1-dbe61700-dffecdf8.mp3]

translation:
vi. 退休; 撤退; 后退，退却
vt. 退休，退隐; 使撤退; 收回
n. 退休; 退隐; 退兵信号

时态：retired, retiring, retires
分布：退休(91%)，撤退(4%)，就寝(4%)，离去(1%)


→re-,向后，往回，-tir,拉，词源同 tirade,tier.即向后拉，引申词义撤退，撤离，后用于指退休。
退休;撤退(re回+tir+e→拉回去→退休)[tir=draw,表示"拉"]
v.退休,引退;退却,撤退;就寝A title is entitled to the retired worker who repaired the entire tire tirelessly.那个不倦地修理了整个轮胎的退休工人被授予了一个头衔.



US [-'taɪr] verb STOP WORKING  停止工作   ESSENTIAL  intransitive ■to leave your job or stop working because of old age or ill health 退休；退职；退役
•Since retiring from the company, she has done voluntary work for a charity.从公司退休后，她就一直在为一间慈善机构做志愿工作。

•He is due to retire as chief executive next year.明年他就该从总裁职位上退下来了。
intransitive ■to stop taking part in a race or competition because of illness or injury （因伤病）退出（比赛）
•She retired from the competition after pulling a leg muscle.她因腿部肌肉拉伤退出了比赛。
transitive often passive ■If an employer retires an employee, they make that person leave their job, usually at a time when they are near to the age at which they would normally stop working, or because they are ill （通常指在雇员接近退休年龄或生病时）使退职，辞退，使退休
•Following the merger, he was retired with a generous pension.在合并后，他拿了一笔丰厚的养老金后被辞退了。

UK [rɪ'taɪər] US [-'taɪr] verb LEAVE A PLACE  离开一个地方  intransitive formal ■to leave a room or group of people and go somewhere quiet or private 离开；退下；退出
•After dinner our host said, "Shall we retire to the drawing room?"晚餐过后主人说道，“我们到休息室去好不好？”
intransitive formal or old-fashioned ■to go to bed 就寝；上床睡觉
•It had been a long day, so I retired early.那天我工作了很长时间，所以早早便上床睡觉了。





retreat, withdraw, retire

这组词都有“退下、退却”的意思，其区别是：
retreat: 含消极意味，多指被迫采取退下或退却的行动。
withdraw: 侧重因某种原因而有意离开，常含礼貌、谦恭等理由。也指军队的撤退。
retire: 指从公开或公共场合退下到私下场所，也指被免除职务或自动辞职、退役等。


vi. 退休；撤退；退却
 - withdraw, beat a retreat
vt. 退休；离开；收回
 - leave, split, quit
n. 退休；退隐；退兵信号
 - superannuation, sequestration
examples: 英 [rɪ'taɪə(r)] 美 [rɪ'taɪər]
v.退休；撤退；离去；就寝；主动退出比赛；收回（货币）；赎回（票据）n.退休，退职

(1) My father retired at the age of 60.(2) The old worker decided to retire to the country.(3) Our forces retired to prepared positions.(4) After lunch he retired to his study.(5) I decided to retire early with a book.(6) She fell badly, spraining her ankle, and had to retire.(7) Companies may retire their bonds payable before maturity.
(1) 我父亲六十岁时退休了。(2) 那们老工人决定退休后搬到乡下去。(3) 我们的部队撤退到既设阵地上。(4) 他午饭后就到书房去了。(5) 我决定带本书早点就寝。(6) 她摔得很重，扭伤了脚踝，只好退出比赛。(7) 企业可以在债券到期之前赎回他们的应付债券。
[sound:youdao-c4fb6ef5-3606704f-9190baa6-fe55771d-c7f4db69.mp3]

translation:
vi. 撤退，后退; 撤销，作罢; （眼睛等）凹进; [航]向后倾斜
n. 撤回; 静居处; 引退期间; 静思，静修

时态：retreated, retreating, retreats
分布：撤退(81%)，退避(9%)，改变(6%)，隐居处(3%)，缩回象棋的棋子(1%)


→re-,向后，往回，treat,拉，处理，词源同 tract.即回拉，引申词义撤退，退离。
后退,撤退(re+treat拉→拉回来→撤退)[re-①表示"向后,相反,不"②表示"一再,重新"]
退却;隐退(re回+treat→处理回去→退回去→隐退)[treat=handle,表示"处理"]
v.撤退,退却In the theater I threatened to treat the treaty with retreat.在剧院里,我威胁要以退却来对待条约.
【记】re反，treat＝tract拉－拉回－撤退【反】incursion（n 袭击；侵入）



verb POSITION  位置   ADVANCED  intransitive often + adverb or preposition ■to go away from a place or person in order to escape from fighting or danger 退却；撤退；后退
•Attacks by enemy aircraft forced the tanks to retreat (from the city).敌机的轰炸迫使坦克（从这座城市）撤离。

•When she came towards me shouting, I retreated (behind my desk).她大叫着冲向我时，我就后退（到了桌子后面）。
intransitive ■to go to a quiet safe place in order to avoid a difficult situation 退却；躲避；隐退
•When he's done something wrong, he retreats to his bedroom.他要是做了甚么错事，就会躲到自己睡房里去。

[rɪ'tri:t] verb DECISION  决定  intransitive often + adverb or preposition ■to decide not to do something, or to stop believing something, because it causes too many problems 改变主意；退缩；放弃信仰
•The government is retreating from its promises.政府要收回其承诺。

[rɪ'tri:t] noun POSITION  位置  countable usually singular uncountable ■a move back by soldiers or an army, either because they have been defeated or in order to avoid fighting （士兵或军队的）撤退，退却，后退
•the retreat from Dunkirk敦刻尔克大撤退

•Enemy soldiers are now in (full) retreat.敌军正在（全面）撤退
countable ■a private and safe place 退隐处；静居处；僻静处
•a country/mountain/lakeside retreat乡间／山区／湖畔的幽静的住所
countable or uncountable ■a period of time used to pray and study quietly, or to think carefully, away from normal activities and duties 静修，静思（时间）
•We went on (a) retreat at/to a monastery in Wales.我们去威尔士的一间修道院静修。

[rɪ'tri:t] noun DECISION  决定  countable ■a change from previous beliefs or behaviour （信仰的）改变；退缩；放弃
•The professor's speech marked/signalled a retreat from his usual extreme views.教授的演讲标志着／表明他已经放弃了他一贯的极端观点。





retreat, withdraw, retire

这组词都有“退下、退却”的意思，其区别是：
retreat: 含消极意味，多指被迫采取退下或退却的行动。
withdraw: 侧重因某种原因而有意离开，常含礼貌、谦恭等理由。也指军队的撤退。
retire: 指从公开或公共场合退下到私下场所，也指被免除职务或自动辞职、退役等。


n. 撤退；休息寓所；撤退
 - withdrawal, pullback
vi. 撤退；退避；向后倾
 - withdraw, bug out
examples: 英 [rɪ'triːt] 美 [rɪ'triːt]
n.撤退；改变；隐居处v.撤退；改变；退避；缩回象棋的棋子

(1) The troop made good their retreat from the occupied city.(2) He immediately sounded a retreat.(3) The minister made an undignified retreat from his earlier position.(4) The Senator made an embarrassing retreat from his earlier position.(5) Mike used to go to his comfortable retreat by the lake alone.(6) After several reverses the enemy was forced to retreat.(7) The soldiers had to retreat when they were beaten in battle.(8) You can't retreat from the responsibility in this affair.(9) He retreats from the public eye.
(1) 部队从沦陷的城市安全撤出。(2) 他立刻下令撤退。(3) 那部长很不光彩地背离了他原先的立场。(4) 这位参议员很尴尬地改变了他早先的立场。(5) 麦克常常独自去位于湖边的舒适的隐居处。(6) 几经失败之后，敌军被迫后撤。(7) 士兵们在战斗中受挫，不得不撤退。(8) 你不能回避在这一事件中的责任。(9) 他避开公众的眼睛。
[sound:youdao-ac907da9-958ef310-b18a9432-21792e99-abee9601.mp3]

translation:
v. 回来; 退还; 重现; 回报
n. 回来; 归还; 恢复; 利润

时态：returned, returning, returns
分布：返回(59%)，回报(22%)，归还(13%)，申报(5%)，回应(1%)


→re-,向后，往回，turn,转。引申词义归来，返回。
v./n.返回,回来;归还,送还;回答They returned in turn to bury the luxuries burnt in the burst.他们依次返回来埋藏在爆炸中烧毁的奢侈品.



US [-'tɝ:n] verb GO BACK  回去   ESSENTIAL  intransitive ■to come or go back to a previous place 回；返回
•Odysseus returned home/returned to his home after many years of travelling.离家多年后奥德修斯返回了故土。

•She left South Africa at the age of 15 and has never returned.她15岁时离开了南非，再也没有回去过。

•[+ to infinitive] David returned (from work) to find his house had burned down.大卫（下班）回到家后发现房子已被烧毁了。
return to sth  IMPROVER  ■If people or things return to a previous condition, they go back to that condition 恢复至（原来的状态）
•Within a week, the situation had returned to normal.不到一个星期，局势就恢复正常了。
■If you return to an activity or subject, you start doing it or talking about it again 重新做；再次谈及
•Gandhi urged Indians to return to spinning their own yarn.甘地敦促印度人重新拿起纺车自己动手纺纱。

•Every five minutes, he returned to the same subject.每过五分钟他就会重提同一个话题。

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] verb EXCHANGE  交换   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to give, do or get something in exchange 回应；回报；报答
•to return an invitation/greeting回请／回应问候

•I returned his stare.我回瞪了他一眼。

•I gave her a ride when her car broke down and now she is returning the favour (= doing something to help me in exchange).那天她的车坏了，我顺便搭载了她一程，现在她在投桃报李。

•The terrorists started shooting and the police returned fire (= started shooting back).恐怖分子开了火，警方便开枪还击。
■to give a particular amount of profit in exchange for an investment 带来，产生（利润等）
•My investments return a high rate of interest.我的投资获得了很高的收益。

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] verb PUT BACK  放回   IMPROVER  transitive ■to send, take, give, put, etc. something back to where it came from 放回；归还；带回
•The new TV broke so they returned it to the shop.新电视机坏了，所以他们退还给商店了。

•He returned two books he had borrowed from me in 1963.他把1963年借我的两本书还给了我。

•She carefully returned the book to its place on the shelf.她小心翼翼地把书放回书架上。
transitive ■in sports such as tennis, to hit the ball back to your opponent （网球等运动中）击回（球）
UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] verb HAPPEN AGAIN  再发生   ADVANCED  intransitive ■to happen again 重新出现；再次发生
•You must go to the doctor if the pain returns.如果疼痛再次发作，你必须去看医生。

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] verb DECIDE  决定  return a verdict/sentence legal■to decide and say whether you think someone is guilty or not guilty, or what punishment the person will be given in a law court 宣判
•The jury returned a verdict of not guilty.陪审团作出了无罪判决。
transitive UK ■to elect someone to be a member of parliament, or to another political job 选举，选出
UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] noun GOING BACK  返回   ESSENTIAL  only singular ■when someone goes or comes back to a place where they were before 回；返回；回来
•The whole town came out to celebrate his return (from the war).整个镇上的人都涌上街头庆祝他（从战场上）归来。

•On her return, she went straight to the office.她一回来就直接去了办公室。
only singular ■when you start to do or have something again 重新开始；恢复
•Some environmentalists argue for a return to a pre-industrial society.一些环保主义者主张回归工业化以前的社会。

•Most people have welcomed her return to power/office.大多数人欢迎她重新掌权／复职。
countable UK (also return ticket) (US roundtrip ticket) ■a ticket for travel to a place and back again 往返票；来回票
•May I have a return to Birmingham, please?请给我一张去伯明罕的往返票好吗？

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] noun EXCHANGE  交换  in return  IMPROVER  ■in exchange 作为交换；作为回报
•America helped the rebels in return for their promise to support democracy.反叛分子承诺支援民主政治，作为回报，美国为他们提供援助。
countable or uncountable ■when something is given, done or received in exchange 回应；回报；报答
•Several soldiers were wounded in the return of fire.反击中，数名士兵受伤。
countable or uncountable ■the profit that you get from an investment 收益；利润；收入
•The return on the money we invested was very low.我们投资获得的收益很低。

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] noun HAPPENING AGAIN  再度发生   ADVANCED  only singular ■when something starts to happen or be used again 重新出现；再度发生；重新利用
•Will we ever see the return of /a return to comfortable fashion clothes?我们还会看到穿着舒适的时装再次流行吗？

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] noun COMPUTER  电脑  uncountable ■the key on a computer keyboard that you press in order to say that the words or numbers on the screen are correct, or that an instruction should be performed, or in order to move down a line on the screen 回车键
•Press return/the return key twice to leave a blank line.按两次回车键留出一行空行。

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] noun GIVING BACK  归还  only singular ■when something is given back, put back, or sent back 放回；归还；带回
•the return of the stolen goods归还被盗货物
countable ■when you hit the ball back to your opponent in sports such as tennis （网球等运动中的）回击，回击球returns [plural] ■goods that have been taken back to the shop where they were bought by customers because they are damaged or unsuitable 退回的商品；退货■US ■the votes that are returned, or the results of the voting, in an election 选举结果
•The election returns produced a confusing picture of gains and losses.选举结果显示参选各派各有得失，局势扑朔迷离。
by return (of post) UK (Australian also by return mail) ■in the first post collection that leaves after you receive a letter 收到后立即回信
•She answered my letter by return.她收到我的信后立即回了信。

UK [rɪ'tɜ:n] US [-'tɝ:n] adjective [before noun] ■describes the part of a journey in which you go back to the place where you started 回程，返程（旅程的一部分，返回某人出发的那个地方）
•The return journey took longer because the train was rerouted.回程花的时间长一些，因为火车改线了。





response, return, reply

response: 指对刺激的回应，也指对紧迫的或指定问题的回答
return: 回报
reply: 指对他人的陈述或问题给与回答，常与介词to搭配；



answer, reply, respond, retort, return

这些动词均有“回答”之意。
answer: 常用词，指用书面、口头或行动对他人的请求、询问、质问等作出回答或反应。
reply: 较正式用词，较少用于口语。侧重经过考虑的较正式答复。
respond: 正式用词，指即刻的，以口头或行动对外来的号召、请求或刺激等作出回答或响应。
retort: 指对不同意见、批评或控诉作出迅速、有力的回答，即“反驳”。
return: 正式用词，从本义“归来，回去”引申作“回答、答辨”讲时，含反驳或反唇相讥之意。


vt. [计] 返回；归还；报答
 - replace, restore
n. [计] 返回；归还；报答
 - payment, reward, restoration
vi. [计] 返回；归还；报答
 - head back to, come (or go) back
adj. [计] 返回的； [交] 回程的；报答的
 - rewarding
examples: 英 [rɪ'tɜːn] 美 [rɪ'tɜːrn]
v.返回；归还；回报；回应；申报n.归还；返回；（收益)回报；申报

(1) What time does your husband return from work?(2) Don't forget to return my keys.(3) Good education is an investment for your future and will return substantial rewards.(4) He neglected to return his income tax form.(5) I'm afraid I have to insist on the return of my books at once.(6) The hope of his safe return diminished as time passed by.(7) I gave him some books in return for his assistance.(8) He assist me with my income tax return.
(1) 你丈夫什么时候下班回家？(2) 别忘了还我钥匙。(3) 接受优质教育是对自己未来的投资并会获得高回报投资。(4) 他忽略了所得税表格的申报。(5) 对不起,我要求你立即归还我的书。(6) 随着时间的推移,他平安返回的希望越来越渺茫。(7) 我给了他一些书,作为对他所提供的帮助的回报。(8) 他帮助我填写所得税申报单。
[sound:youdao-2d2961f7-2be99872-42c7c780-1ea7cb4e-83f96a05.mp3]

translation:
vt. 显露; 揭露; 泄露; [神]启示
n. 揭示，展现; [建]门侧，窗侧

时态：revealed, revealing, reveals
分布：揭示(39%)，透露(35%)，显示(14%)，展现(9%)，门侧(3%)


→来自拉丁语 revelare,揭露，揭示，来自 re-,相反，velare,遮盖，来自 velum,面纱，词源同 veil,velar.
揭露,显示(re反+veal[=veil]→反盖上→不让盖上→揭露)[veil=cover,表示"盖上"]
v.展现,显示;揭示,揭露;告诉,泄露The healer reveals an appealing fact that health is great wealth to the commonwealth.医治者揭示一个吸引人的事实:健康是联邦的巨大财富.



verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret 揭露；泄露；透露
•He was jailed for revealing secrets to the Russians.他因为向俄国人泄密而被监禁。

•[+ that] Her biography revealed that she was not as rich as everyone thought.她的自传透露她并非像大家所想像的那样富有。

•[+ question word] He would not reveal wh ere he had hidden her chocolate eggs.他就是不说他把她的巧克力蛋藏在哪里了。
 ADVANCED  ■to allow something to be seen that, until then, had been hidden 使显露；展现；显示
•A gap in the clouds revealed the Atlantic far below.从云缝中可以看到远在下方的大西洋。





relieve, reveal, reject, release

relieve: 援助，接替
reveal: 透露，暴露
reject: 拒绝，抛弃
release: 释放，解除



reveal, expose, disclose, uncover

这组词都有“揭露、暴露”的意思，其区别是：
reveal: 多指揭露一直隐藏或隐秘的东西，或启示超乎常人领导能力的真理。
expose: 多指揭露丑闻、坏人坏事或各种阴谋。也可指某物暴露在外。
disclose: 侧重指揭露或泄露鲜为人知或保密的事。
uncover: 主要指移去遮盖物，让东西显露出来。也可指揭露阴谋、秘密等。


vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露
 - make clear, prove, disclose, expose
n. 揭露；暴露；门侧， [建] 窗侧
 - uncovery, exposure to sth
examples: 英 [rɪ'viːl] 美 [rɪ'viːl]
vt.显示；透露；揭示；展现n.(外墙与门或窗之间的)窗侧；门侧；(汽车的)窗框

(1) Several withered trees on the sides of the road reveal the desolation here.(2) His deed revealed him to be a kind man.(3) The journalist did not want to reveal the identity of his informant.(4) He would not reveal what decisions had been reached.(5) The facts quoted would reveal a sorry state of affairs in any community.(6) The door opened to reveal a cosy little room.
(1) 道路两旁的几棵枯木显示出这里的荒凉。(2) 他的行为显示他是个好心的人。(3) 那个新闻工作者不想透露消息提供人的身分。(4) 他不肯透露做出了什么决定。(5) 所提出的事实会揭示社区中普遍存在的一种可悲的情形。(6) 房门打开，一间温暖舒适的小屋展现在眼前。
[sound:youdao-018c0530-2e88f81d-ae0edbe3-8207c2ac-a2a733a0.mp3]

translation:
n. 报仇，报复
vt. 为…报仇，报…之仇

时态：revenged, revenging, revenges
分布：报复(69%)，报仇(28%)，报复心(2%)，雪耻机会(1%)


→re-,表强调，-veng,复仇，词源同 avenge,vengeance.
报仇(re反+venge→反惩罚→报仇)[venge=punish,表示"惩罚",引申为"报仇"]
n.报复,复仇v.替...报仇The ventilator inventor's adventure prevented him from venturing revenge.通风机发明家的奇遇阻止了他冒险复仇.
【记】re反，venge（v 为…报仇）－反报仇－报复re反，ven问，ge：反问你为什么这样对我？－报仇【参】avenge（v 报仇）



noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■harm done to someone as a punishment for harm that they have done to someone else 报复；报仇
•She took/got/exacted  (her) revenge  on him for leaving her by smashing up his car.他抛弃了她，她就砸烂了他的车来报复。

•He is believed to have been shot by a rival gang in  revenge  for the shootings last week.据信，敌对帮派为了报复上周的枪击事件将他枪杀。

[rɪ'vendʒ] noun uncountable Revenge is sweet. saying ■said when you feel satisfaction from harming someone who has harmed you 报仇雪恨，大快人心。
[rɪ'vendʒ] verb transitive ■to harm someone as a punishment for harm that they have done to you 报复；向…报仇
•to revenge a death/defeat/injustice为一个人的死报仇／雪失败之耻／伸张正义

•[R] The red team revenged them selves on the blue team by winning the semi-final.红队在半决赛中打败蓝队，报了一箭之仇。





revolt, revenge

revolt: 造反，反抗
revenge: 报复，复仇


n. 报复；复仇
 - vengeance, retaliation, revanche
vt. 报复；替…报仇；洗雪
 - get back on, get even with
vi. 报仇；雪耻
 - right a wrong
examples: 英 [rɪ'vendʒ] 美 [rɪ'vendʒ]
n.报仇；报复；报复心；雪耻机会vt.报复；报仇

(1) They vowed revenge on their enemies.(2) She said she would take her revenge on Tom.(3) Thoughts of revenge kept running through his mind.(4) I want revenge against her on more scores than one.(5) The murderer was actuated by revenge.(6) The Americans are seeking revenge for their defeat at the last year's championships.(7) They thirsted to revenge themselves upon the enemy.(8) The knight swore he would revenge his father's death.
(1) 他们发誓要向敌人报仇。(2) 她说她要向汤姆报仇。(3) 他脑海里时刻萦绕着复仇的念头。(4) 我有种种理由要向她报复。(5) 这个杀人犯被报复心驱使着。(6) 美国队正在寻找机会为去年的冠军赛失利雪耻。(7) 他们渴望向敌人报复。(8) 骑士发誓要为他父亲向敌人报仇。
[sound:youdao-dedcac3d-8bfa16cb-f95dc8f1-2dbd257f-68991c76.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. （使）反转; （使）颠倒; 掉换，交换; [法]撤消，推翻
vi. 倒退; [桥牌]逆叫
adj. 反面的; 颠倒的; 倒开的; [生]倒卷的
n. 倒转，反向; [机]回动; 倒退; 失败

时态：reversed, reversing, reverses
分布：逆转(32%)，相反(25%)，相反的(11%)，改变(9%)，倒退(7%)，背面(6%)，反面的(3%)，颠倒的(3%)，失败(2%)，倒档(1%)，互换(1%)


→来自 revert,回转，-s,过去分词格。引申诸相关词义，词性也由形容词兼做名词和动词使用。
反转的,颠倒的(re+verse转→反转的)[re-①表示"向后,相反,不"②表示"一再,重新"]
颠倒,逆转a.相反的(re反+verse→反着转→颠倒)[ver,ert=turn,表示"转"]
n.相反;背面a.相反的v.颠倒,倒转The cosmic verse on the reverse of the paper is very welcome in Universe University.纸张背面的宇宙韵文在宇宙大学很受欢迎.



US [-'vɝ:s] verb intransitive or transitive  IMPROVER  ■to (cause something to) go backwards, or to change the direction, order, position, result, etc. of something to its opposite （使）反向；（使）倒转；彻底改变；推翻
•She reversed the car into the parking space.她把车倒进停车位。

•The new manager hoped to reverse the decline in the company's fortunes.新经理希望能够扭转公司江河日下的状况。

•Now that you have a job and I don't, our situations are reversed.你找到了工作，我倒没有工作了，我们的情况正好相反。

•The Court of Appeal reversed the earlier judgment.上诉法院推翻了先前的判决。
reverse the charges (US also call collect) ■to make a telephone call that is paid for by the person receiving it 打对方付费电话；使受话方付款
UK [rɪ'vɜ:s] US [-'vɝ:s] noun the reverse  IMPROVER  ■the opposite of what has been suggested 相反的情况（或事物）；对立面
•The teachers say my son is slow, but I believe the reverse (is true).老师们说我儿子反应迟钝，但我觉得恰恰相反。
■the back of a coin, medal , etc （硬币、奖章等的）反面，背面
•The English £1 coin has a royal coat of arms on the reverse.一英镑硬币的背面有王室盾徽的图案。
in reverse (order) ■in the opposite order or way 向相反方向；倒；逆
•To stop the engine, you repeat the same procedures, but in reverse (order).要想关掉引擎，你得按相反顺序重复同样的步骤。
uncountable (also reverse gear) ■the method of controlling a vehicle that makes it go backwards 倒车档
•To go backwards, you must put the car in/into reverse (gear).要想倒车，你得挂倒车档。
countable formal ■a defeat or failure 失败；挫折
•They suffered a serious military/political reverse.他们遭受了一次重大的军事／政治失败。

UK [rɪ'vɜ:s] US [-'vɝ:s] noun go into reverse ■If a situation goes into reverse, it becomes the opposite of what it was before 出现逆转；向相反方向发展
•The trend towards home ownership has gone into reverse.个人拥有房屋的趋势已经发生了逆转。





reverse, opposite, converse, contrary, adverse

这组词都有“相反的，对立的”的意思，其区别是：
reverse: 指朝相反方向的或反面(背面)的。
opposite: 指位置、方向、行动或想法等完全相反。
converse: 指在方向、行动或意见上相反的。
contrary: 一般指与某种主张、看法或行为等正好相反，隐含否定一方并不意味着肯定另一方的意味。
adverse: 通常指违害利益的、无生命的势力或条件等，侧重分歧。


n. 相反；背面；倒退；失败
 - failure, loss, contrary, losing, defeat
vt. 颠倒；倒转
 - bottom up, head over heels
adj. 反面的；颠倒的
 - upside-down, perversive
vi. 倒退；逆叫
 - retrogress, step backward
examples: 英 [rɪ'vɜːs] 美 [rɪ'vɜːrs]
v.逆转；倒退；互换；改变adj.相反的；反面的；颠倒的n.相反；背面；失败；倒档

(1) The government has failed to reverse the economic decline.(2) He reversed the car into a tree.(3) Statistics showed a reverse trend to that recorded in other countries.(4) Count down in reverse order 10, 9, 8...(5) In hot weather, the reverse happens.(6) There's a picture of an eagle on the reverse of the coin.
(1) 政府未能扭转经济滑坡的趋势。(2) 他倒车撞到了树上。(3) 统计数字表明这种趋向与其他国家所示情况迥异。(4) 倒数--10、 9、 8...(5) 在热天,情况相反。(6) 这个硬币的背面是一只鹰的图案。

translation:
n. 复习; 回顾; （报刊的）评论; [法]复审
vt. 检验; 复查; 复习; 评论
vi. 复习功课; 写评论

时态：reviewed, reviewing, reviews
分布：回顾(28%)，复习(22%)，评论(14%)，检讨(11%)，评审(9%)，检阅(8%)，温习(6%)，写评论(2%)


→re-,向后，往回，view,看。引申诸相关词义。
v.回顾,复习n.回顾,复习;评论The interviewer reviewed the newspaper and renewed his viewpoint on the news.采访者再次查看了报纸并更新了他对该新闻的看法.



verb transitive THINK AGAIN  审核   IMPROVER  ■to consider something in order to make changes to it, give an opinion on it or study it 审查；仔细审核
•The committee is reviewing the current arrangement/situation.委员会正在审查目前的安排／研究当前的形势。

•Let's review (= talk about) what has happened so far.我们谈谈到目前为止发生的事情吧。

•He reviewed (= thought about) his options before making a final decision.他在最后作出决定之前，对各种选择进行了斟酌权衡。

[rɪ'vju:] verb transitive BOOK/FILM  书／电影   IMPROVER  ■If critics review a book, play, film, etc. they write their opinion of it 评论
•I only go to see films that are reviewed favourably.我只去看那些获得好评的电影。

[rɪ'vju:] verb transitive MILITARY  军事  ■When an important person reviews a large group of military forces, they formally visit and look at them 检阅（部队）
•The Queen reviewed the troops on her recent visit.在最近的访问中，女王检阅了部队。

[rɪ'vju:] verb transitive STUDY  学习  US for  revise (STUDY)  学习
[rɪ'vju:] noun THINK AGAIN  审查   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■when you consider something again in order to make changes to it, give an opinion of it or study it 审查；仔细审核
•an annual review of company performance对公司业绩每年一度的审核

•a review of the year's top news stories评审年度重大新闻事件

•Salary levels are under review at the moment.目前正对工资水准进行评审。

•Your licence will come up for review every July.你的执照每年七月要接受审核。

[rɪ'vju:] noun BOOK/FILM  书／电影   IMPROVER  countable ■a report in a newspaper, magazine, or programme that gives an opinion about a new book, film, etc 评论
•Derek writes film/theatre/book reviews for the newspapers.德里克为报纸写影／剧／书评。

•The play got excellent reviews when it was first seen.这部剧首演就获得了极高的评价。
countable usually singular ■a (part of a) newspaper or magazine that has articles on films, books, travel, famous people, etc 评论性报纸；评论杂志；（报刊的）评论栏目，评论版
•Could you pass me the review (section of the paper), please?把评论版部分递给我好吗？

[rɪ'vju:] noun MILITARY  军事  countable ■a formal military ceremony in which forces are reviewed by an important person 检阅；阅兵，阅兵式
•Many diplomats attended a naval review to mark the anniversary of the end of the war.很多外交官参加了在战争结束周年纪念上举行的海军阅兵式。

[rɪ'vju:] noun THEATRE  戏院  countable ■a revue 
[rɪ'vju:] noun STUDY  学习  countable US ■information or a practice exercise about a subject to be studied （一门课程的）材料，练习，习题
•Their teacher distributed a review for the exam.老师给他们发了一套考试复习题。





journal, magazine, press, periodical, review, newspaper, publication

这组词都有“出版物或定期刊物”的意思，其区别是：
journal: 本义为“日报”，现在可指定期发生的周刊、月刊、季刊等或指学术团体出版的刊物、杂志或学报。
magazine: 指刊登各种文章、小说、诗歌、评议的杂志。
press: 系报刊总称，也指报界或报业。
periodical: 通常指除日报以外的定期出版刊物。
review: 多指登载评论性文章或讨论重大事件的文章的刊物。
newspaper: 一般指每日出版的报纸。
publication: 指出版物，发行物。


n. 回顾；复习；评论；检讨；检阅
 - comment, retrospection
vt. 回顾；检查；复审
 - examine, inspect
vi. 回顾；复习功课；写评论
 - look back to, look back on
examples: 英 [rɪ'vjuː] 美 [rɪ'vjuː]
n.复习；回顾；检讨；评审vt.检阅；评论；温习；检讨vi.写评论

(1) Before the examination we have a review of the term's work.(2) A succinct review of this problem with an excellent bibliography has recently appeared.(3) Perhaps we need a quick review of what we've gone through so far.(4) Implementation of this phase is under review subject to the finalisation of the statutory plan.(5) This document defines an overall peer review process.(6) On the square, the commander reviewed the powerful and grandiose guard of honor.(7) The commander is sitting in front of the rostrum, waiting to review the troops.(8) He promised to review the film in one of the evening papers.(9) Even if you are one of the best students in the class, in order to maintain your grades you must review your lessons often.(10) They review their lessons night after night.(11) Sometimes he reviewed for the principal papers.

(1) 考试之前，我们复习一学期的功课。(2) 关于这个问题的一个简明的复习和一份极好的文献目录最近已发表。(3) 或许我们应很快地回顾一下我们前一段时间的工作。(4) 当局现正检讨这期工程的实施，检讨结果视乎拟定法定图则的工作而定。(5) 该文档定义了一个全面的同行评审过程。(6) 首长在广场上检阅了威武雄壮的仪仗队。(7) 指挥员坐在主席台前, 等待着检阅部队。(8) 他答应在一家晚报上评论这部电影。(9) 即使你是班上最好的学生之一,要保住成绩也得常常温习功课才行。(10) 他们每夜都温习功课。(11) 他有时为各大报写些评论文章。
[sound:youdao-3bc2f6ba-4cb87c40-08ddc9a4-8cf0de3f-65cfdddb.mp3]

translation:
vt. 修订; 改变; 修正; [主英国英语]复习
vt. & vi. 复习
vi. 修订，校订
n. 修订; 校订; [印刷]校样，清样; 修订版，修订本

时态：revised, revising, revises
分布：修正(68%)，校订(16%)，校正(13%)，再校稿(3%)


→re-,再，重新，-vis,看，词源同 visit,vision.引申词义改变，修改。
修正,改订(re再+vis+e→再看一遍→修正)[vis,vid=see表示"看"]
v.修订,校订;修正,修改The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise a device for getting rid of vice.代理顾问建议校订者想出一个根除恶习的计策.
【记】re反复，vis看，e：反复看－修改



verb CHANGE  更改   ADVANCED  transitive ■to look at or consider again an idea, piece of writing, etc. in order to correct or improve it 修订；修正；修改
•His helpfulness today has made me revise my original opinion /impression of him.他今天所表现出的乐于助人的品质使我改变了对他的最初看法／印象。

•His publishers made him revise his manuscript three times.出版公司让他把手稿修改了三次。

[rɪ'vaɪz] verb STUDY  学习  intransitive or transitive UK (US review) ■to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an examination 复习；温习
•We're revising (algebra) for the test tomorrow.我们正在为明天的（代数）考试进行复习。





remedy, correct, rectify, revise, amend

这组词都有“纠正，改正”的意思，其区别是：
remedy: 正式用词，通常指在局部范围内进行纠正，尤指对困难或棘手问题的解决。
correct: 指纠正或改正不正确、不真实或有缺点的东西。
rectify: 正式用词，意义较抽象，侧重指彻底改正偏离子正确标准或规则的东西。
revise: 指通过仔细阅读、反复思考后而进行改正、订正或修订，使趋于完善。
amend: 书面语用词。指进行更正或改变，使之更好，符合更高的要求。


vt. 修正；复习； [印刷] 校订
 - update, edit
vi. [图情] 修订； [印刷] 校订；复习功课
 - to amend
n. [图情] 修订； [印刷] 校订
 - recension, emendation
examples: 英 [rɪ'vaɪz] 美 [rɪ'vaɪz]
n.校订；修正；再校稿v.校订；修正；校正

(1) A method to revise the radius of switch probes is also put forward.(2) The market turmoil has spurred economists to revise their forecasts.(3) A method to revise the radius of switch probes is also put forward.(4) The market turmoil has spurred economists to revise their forecasts.
(1) 此外还提出了一种修正开关式球测头半径的计量学方法。(2) 当前的市场动荡已促使经济学家们重新修正自己的预测数据。(3) 此外还提出了一种修正开关式球测头半径的计量学方法。(4) 当前的市场动荡已促使经济学家们重新修正自己的预测数据。

translation:
vt. （使）厌恶
vi. 反叛，背叛; 厌恶，反感
n. 造反，起义

时态：revolted, revolting, revolts
分布：反抗(56%)，叛乱(33%)，反感(10%)，起反感(1%)


→来自 revolve,旋转，转动，-t,过去分词格。引申词义反抗，叛乱，起义等。
反叛(re+volt转→反过转→反叛)[re-①表示"向后,相反,不"②表示"一再,重新"]
叛变,起义(re反+volt转→转反了→叛变)[vol,volv,volt=roll,turn,表示"卷,转"]
v./n.反抗,起义The voluntary revolutionaries revolted like the outbreak of volcano.志愿革命者们象火山爆发一样起义了.
【记】re反，volt转一反转一叛乱【参】revolve（v 使旋转；循环出现）；revulsion（n 抽回；厌恶）



US [-'voʊlt] verb FIGHT  战斗  intransitive ■If a large number of people revolt, they refuse to be controlled or ruled, and take often violent action against authority 反抗；造反；反叛
•The people revolted against foreign rule and established their own government.人们奋起反抗外来统治，并成立了自己的政府。

UK [rɪ'vəʊlt/ UK [-'vɒlt] US [-'voʊlt] verb UNPLEASANT FEELING  厌恶  transitive ■to make someone feel unpleasantly shocked or disgusted 使厌恶；使惊骇；使反感
•We were revolted by the dirt and mess in her house.她家里又脏又乱，我们看着心里生厌。

•It revolts me to know that the world spends so much money on arms when millions are dying of hunger.这个世界有数以百万计的人因饥饿挣扎在死亡线上，但却有那么多的钱花在军备上，这真让我感到震惊。
⇒ See also revulsion
UK [rɪ'vəʊlt/ UK [-'vɒlt] US [-'voʊlt] noun countable or uncountable ■an attempt to get rid of a government by using violence 反抗；造反；反叛
•Troops were called in to crush/put down the revolt.军队被调来镇压叛乱。

•The army is in  revolt (against its commanders).军队叛乱（调转枪口指向了指挥官们）。
⇒ See also revolution




revolt, revenge

revolt: 造反，反抗
revenge: 报复，复仇



revolt, riot, rebellion

这组词都有“造反、叛乱、骚乱”的意思，其区别是：
revolt: 指规模相对较小的，持续时间较短，侧重对压迫或不能容忍的情况的反抗。
riot: 多指没有组织的一群人突然掀起的闹事。也可指暴乱或暴动。
rebellion: 通常指有组织、公开地大规模武断叛乱，着以失败而告终。



revolt, resist, rebel

revolt: 反叛，造反，反对，反抗；
resist: vt. 抵抗，反抗，一般为褒义；
rebel: 造反，反叛，贬义


vi. 反抗；反叛；反感，厌恶
 - strive against, come out against
vt. 使反感；使恶心
 - sicken
n. 反抗；叛乱；反感
 - resistance, hate, rebellion
examples: 英 [rɪ'vəʊlt] 美 [rɪ'voʊlt]
n.叛乱；反抗；反感v.叛乱；起反感

(1) The revolt was suppressed in a matter of hours.(2) All North Africa would flame into revolt.(3) The peasants revolted against their oppressors.(4) Autocracy often causes the people to revolt.(5) Teenagers often revolt against parental discipline.(6) They revolt at those who have great ambition but little ability.
(1) 叛乱在几小时之内就镇压下去了。(2) 整个北非将激起反抗。(3) 农民们起义反抗他们的压迫者。(4) 独裁统治常常引起人民的反抗。(5) 青少年常常不遵从父母的条条框框。(6) 他们很反感那些眼高手低、志大才疏的人。
[sound:youdao-aea0d018-5acefc46-ff2d0cd6-a663eabf-cf5f7a64.mp3]

translation:
n. 革命; 彻底改变; 旋转; 运行，公转

分布：革命(90%)，变革(5%)，旋转(4%)，重大改变(1%)


→来自 revolve,旋转，-ute,过去分词格，-ion,名词后缀。引申词义革命，大变革。
革命,变革(re翻+olut+ion→翻转→革命)[vol,volv,volt=roll,turn,表示"卷,转"]
n.革命;旋转,转数The revolution caused a radical reformation of the society.革命引起了社会的彻底改革.



noun POLITICS  政治   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a change in the way a country is governed, usually to a different political system and often using violence or war （通常指改变政治体制的）革命
•The French Revolution changed France from a monarchy to a republic.法国大革命使法国由君主政体变成共和政体。

•The country seems to be heading towards revolution.这个国家似乎正在走向革命。

[ˌrev.ə'lu:.ʃən] noun CHANGE  变化   ADVANCED  countable ■a very important change in the way that people do things 革命性剧变；大变革
•a technological revolution技术革命

•Penicillin produced a revolution in medicine.青霉素的发现引起了医学上的一次革命。

[ˌrev.ə'lu:.ʃən] noun CIRCULAR MOVEMENT  回圈运动  only singular ■a circular movement 旋转；绕转；回圈运动
•The revolution of the Earth around the sun was proposed by Copernicus.地球围绕太阳旋转这一观点是哥白尼提出的。
countable ■one complete circular movement of something, for example a wheel 一转
•Engine speed can be measured in revolutions per minute (abbreviationrpm).引擎的速度可以每分钟转数来测量。




n. 革命； [物] 旋转；运行；循环
 - circulation, rotation, rolling, turning, cycle
examples: 英 [ˌrevə'luːʃn] 美 [ˌrevə'luːʃn]
n.革命；变革；重大改变；旋转

(1) The industrial revolution had taken place in England first.(2) Those people go around preaching revolution.(3) The invention of aircraft caused a revolution in our ways of travelling.(4) Credit cards have brought about a revolution in people's spending habits.(5) The earth makes one revolution round the sun each year.(6) The earth completes one revolution each day.
(1) 工业革命首先在英国发生。(2) 那些人到处宣扬革命。(3) 飞机的发明引起了旅行方式的巨大改变。(4) 信用卡的使用给人们的消费习惯带来巨大改变.(5) 地球每年绕太阳旋转一周。(6) 地球每天完成一次自转。
[sound:youdao-00bba8c5-6488c7db-c15faa4c-6410ccdb-2220748e.mp3]

translation:
adj. 革命的; 革命性的，创新的; 旋转的
n. 革命者，革新者

分布：革命的(76%)，革命者(24%)


a.革命的,革新的n.革命者The voluntary revolutionaries revolted like the outbreak of volcano.志愿革命者们象火山爆发一样起义了.



US [-er-] adjective POLITICS  政治   ADVANCED  ■involved in or relating to a revolution 革命的，革命性的
•a revolutionary leader/movement革命领导人／运动

UK [ˌrev.ə'lu:.ʃən.ər.i] US [-er-] adjective NEW AND IMPORTANT  革命性的；大变革的；完全创新的  ■completely new and having a great effect 革命性的；大变革的；完全创新的
•Penicillin was a revolutionary drug.青霉素是具有革命性意义的药物。
■2. The twentieth century brought about revolutionary changes in our lifestyles.
UK [ˌrev.ə'lu:.ʃən.ər.i] US [-er-] noun countable ■someone who tries to cause or take part in a revolution 革命者



adj. 革命的；旋转的；大变革的
 - rotary, rolling
examples: 英 [ˌrevə'luːʃənəri] 美 [ˌrevə'luːʃəneri]
adj.革命的n.革命者

(1) His heart glows with revolutionary enthusiasm.(2) The revolutionary point remained primary.(3) He styles himself a revolutionary.(4) A revolutionary's life used to be beset with dangers and hardships.
(1) 他心中充满着革命的热情。(2) 革命的观点继续占上风。(3) 他自称为革命者。(4) 一个革命者的生活中往往充满危险和艰难。
[sound:youdao-d52292fa-4985ac17-c2b4e369-75d50ce0-b3ed5413.mp3]

translation:
n. 报酬; 报答; 赏金; 酬金
vt. 酬谢，奖赏; 报答，惩罚

时态：rewarded, rewarding, rewards
分布：奖赏(41%)，报酬(31%)，报答(19%)，赏金(8%)，给 ... 报酬(1%)


→re-,表强调，-ward,看，注视，词源同 award,guard,regard.字面意思即反复看，注视，留意， 关切，后来词义由抽象的给予引申为具体的奖励，报酬。比较 award.
n.(for)报酬,赏金v.(for)酬劳;酬谢The awfully awkward warship is warned not to be awarded war reward.那艘非常拙劣的军舰受到不给予战争报酬的警告.
【反】relinquish（v 放弃）



US [-'wɔ:rd] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■something given in exchange for good behaviour or good work, etc 报答；报偿；酬谢；奖赏
•There's a reward for whoever finishes first.无论谁先完成都会得到一份奖赏。

•The rewards of motherhood outweigh the anguish.做母亲得到的回报大于经受的痛苦。
 IMPROVER  ■an amount of money given to someone who helps the police or who helps to return stolen property to its owner 酬金；赏格；悬赏金
•The police offered a reward for any information about the robbery.警方悬赏征求有关劫案的任何线索。

UK [rɪ'wɔ:d] US [-'wɔ:rd] verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to give someone a reward 报答；报偿；奖赏
•The company rewarded him for his years of service with a grand farewell party and several presents.公司为了答谢他多年为公司所作的贡献，为他举行了一个隆重的欢送会，还赠送了他几件礼物。

•slightly formal All his hard work was rewarded (= was made worth it) when he saw his book in print.看到了自己的书付梓出版，他感到一切的艰辛都得到了回报。

•formal He rewarded their kindness with hostility and contempt.他们好心对他，他却报以敌意和轻蔑。





reward, award

这组词都有“难予奖励”的意思，其区别是：
reward: 指对品德高尚和勤劳的人所给予的奖励。也可指为某事付酬金。
award: 侧重指官方或经正式研究裁决后对有功者或竞赛优胜者所给予的奖励。


n. [劳经] 报酬；报答；酬谢
 - compensation, payment, consideration, return, remuneration
vt. [劳经] 奖励；奖赏
 - put a premium on
examples: 英 [rɪ'wɔːd] 美 [rɪ'wɔːrd]
n.报答；赏金；报酬vt.奖赏；给 ... 报酬
(1) An act of kindness deserves a reward.(2) By rights, half the reward should be mine.(3) You have received a just reward.(4) They rewarded the winners with gifts of fruits and flowers.
(1) 做好事,当然要有报答。(2) 按理说，有一半奖赏应该是我的。(3) 你已得到了应有的报酬。(4) 他们奖给优胜者一些水果和鲜花。
[sound:youdao-6ef01b87-ba843bc0-c9af6a33-a4267075-1096270e.mp3]

translation:
n. [诗]节奏，韵律; [医]节律，规律; [乐]节拍; [艺]调和

分布：节奏(81%)，节律(19%)


→来自拉丁语 rhythmus,来自希腊语 rhythmos,节奏，韵律，来自 rhein,流动，来自 sreu,*ser, 流动，词源同 serum,rheum.
n.节奏,韵律With rhythm, the arithmetic teacher put the artist's artificial articles on the vehicle.算术老师把艺术家的人造物品有节奏地放到运载工具里.



noun  ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■a strong pattern of sounds, words or musical notes which is used in music, poetry and dancing （音乐、诗歌和舞蹈的）节奏，韵律，节律
•He beat out a jazz rhythm on the drums.他击出爵士乐节奏的鼓点。

•I've got no sense of  rhythm, so I'm a terrible dancer.我根本没有节奏感，所以舞跳得很差劲。
countable or uncountable ■a regular movement or pattern of movements 规则的运动；（动作的）节奏；律动
•She was lulled to sleep by the gentle rhythm of the boat in the water.船在水中有节奏地轻轻摇动，使她昏昏入睡。

•She hit the ball so hard that her opponent had no chance to establish any rhythm in her game.她凌厉的击球让对手根本没有机会找到比赛的节奏。
countable ■a regular pattern of change, especially one which happens in nature （尤指自然界中的）规则变化，规律，节律
•the rhythm of the seasons四季的交替

•Breathing and sleeping are examples of biological rhythms in humans.呼吸和睡眠是人体生物节奏的例证。




n. 节奏；韵律
 - meter, cadence
examples: 英 ['rɪðəm] 美 ['rɪðəm]
n.节奏；节律；（事件或过程）有规律的反复出现

(1) The song has a syncopated rhythm in the jazz version.(2) Stress and rhythm are important in speaking English.(3) He is trying to play the same tune in a different rhythm.(4) The rhythm of her heart beating is normal.(5) It is said that the rhythm of tides is affected by the moon.
(1) 这首歌曲改编为爵士乐後采用了切分音节奏。(2) 说英语时，重音和节奏是很重要的。(3) 他正试图用不同节奏演奏同一个曲子。(4) 她的心跳节律是正常的。(5) 据说潮汐的涨落受月亮的影响。
[sound:youdao-1062cd36-0671e025-d64d6312-7fc9b48f-88baeaa8.mp3]

translation:
n. 肋骨; （船或屋顶等的）肋拱; 肋骨状的东西; （织物的）凸条花纹
vt. 嘲笑，逗弄，开（某人的）玩笑; 装肋于，给…装肋材

时态：ribbed, ribbing, ribs
分布：肋骨(91%)，装肋于(5%)，肋状物(3%)，用肋状物支撑(1%)


→来自古英语 ribb,肋骨，来自 Proto-Germanic*rebja,肋骨，来自 rebh,覆盖，屋顶，词源同 reef.引申词义排骨，棱纹等。
n.肋骨,肋状物He poked the child in the ribs.他戏谑地触了触小孩的肋骨.



noun BONE  骨头   ADVANCED  countable ■a bone that curves round from your back to your chest 肋骨
•My son broke a rib when he fell off a ladder.我儿子从梯子上摔了下来，摔断了一根肋骨。
countable or uncountable ■a piece of meat taken from this part of an animal 排骨（肉）；肋条（肉）
•He cooked rib of lamb for Sunday lunch.星期天午饭时他做了羊排。
⇒ See also spare ribscountable ■one of the curved pieces of metal or wood which support the structure of a boat or roof （船或建筑物的）肋拱，肋材
[rɪb] noun PATTERN  图案  uncountable ■a method of knitting that makes a pattern of raised parallel lines 凸条花纹织法；罗纹织法⇒ See also ribbed
[rɪb] noun poke/dig sb in the ribs ■to push your finger quickly into someone's chest, usually to make them notice something or to stop them from doing or saying something 用手指捅（某人）肋部（以引起某人注意或阻止其做事或说话）
[rɪb] verb transitive (-bb-) informal ■to joke and laugh at someone in a friendly way about something （善意地）取笑，逗弄，开…的玩笑
•His brothers ribbed him about his new girlfriend.兄弟们拿他新交的女朋友取笑他。
⇒ See also ribbing



n. [解剖] 肋骨；排骨；肋状物
 - costa, sparerib
vt. 戏弄；装肋于
 - fool with, kid
examples: 英 [rɪb] 美 [rɪb]
n.肋骨；肋状物vt.装肋于；用肋状物支撑

(1) How many ribs does a man have?(2) He broke a rib when he fell off his horse.(3) God used this rib to make a woman.(4) He has broken a rib and the doctor has strapped it up.(5) The rib is our most popular dish. The steak is good too.
(1) 一个人有几条肋骨？(2) 他从马上摔下来折断了一根肋骨。(3) 上帝用这根肋骨创造了女人。(4) 他断了一根肋骨，医生已包扎好了。(5) 肋排是我们这里最受欢迎的菜，牛排也很棒。
[sound:youdao-ff9483bc-bd231f0b-3971d4c4-8a03e972-bacbf8d6.mp3]

translation:
n. 带; （打印机的）色带; 绶带; 带状物
v. 把…撕成条带; 用缎带装饰; 形成带状

分布：缎带(56%)，色带(27%)，带状物(9%)，用丝带装饰(5%)，撕碎(3%)


→来自古法语 riban,丝带，来自 ruban 拼写变体，来自荷兰语 ringhband,项链，领结，可能来自 ring,环形，band,带子。引申诸相关词义。
n.缎带,丝带,带,带状物The ribbon of the rifle is fabricated with fibre.来复枪的带子是用纤维制作的.



noun  ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■a long narrow strip of material used to tie things together or as a decoration （捆扎或装饰用的）带子，丝带，缎带
•Sandra often wears a ribbon in her hair.桑德拉常在头发上扎条丝带。

•He tied up the present with ribbon.他用缎带将礼物包扎起来。
a ribbon of sth literary ■a long narrow piece of something 一缕；一条；一排
•A ribbon of road stretched ahead of us across the desert.沙漠中的一条路宛如一根细长的带子，一直向我们前方延伸。
countable ■a small piece of coloured material given to someone in the armed forces to show approval and admiration for their brave actions 勋带，绶带countable specialized■the narrow strip of material that contains the ink for a typewriter （打字机的）色带
•My typewriter needs a new ribbon.我的打字机得换色带了。

['rɪb.ən] noun cut/tear sth/sb to ribbons ■to destroy or badly damage something or someone by cutting or tearing them many times 将…割／撕成碎片
•Our new kitten has torn the living room curtains to ribbons.我们刚养的小猫把起居室的窗帘撕成了碎片。

•figurative The attacking soldiers were cut to ribbons (= killed) by machine-gun fire.进攻的士兵被机枪打得血肉横飞。

['rɪb.ən] noun in ribbons ■torn into narrow strips 粉碎；破烂；破碎成一条条
•Her coat was in ribbons.她的外套被撕成一条一条的。

•His shirt hung in tattered ribbons.他的衬衫破烂不堪，就像一堆碎布条挂在身上。




n. 带；缎带；（勋章等的）绶带；带状物；勋表
 - belt, band, strip
examples: 英 ['rɪbən] 美 ['rɪbən]
n.缎带；带状物；色带vt.用丝带装饰；撕碎

(1) She wears a ribbon belt round her waist.(2) She wore yellow ribbons in her hair.(3) Ribbon hung from the bride's bouquet was tied in a bow.(4) I had to change the typewriter ribbon.(5) We decorated our car lavishly,with ribbon.
(1) 她在腰部束了一条缎带。(2) 她头发上戴着黄色缎带。(3) 从新娘的花束上垂下来的丝带打成了一个结。(4) 我不得不换掉打字机的色带。(5) 我们花了一大笔钱用丝带装饰汽车。
[sound:youdao-20cf6121-66e14bd7-cd59f2f9-33f7e06d-d384dded.mp3]

translation:
n. 稻; 稻米， 大米
vt. 筛选

时态：riced, ricing, rices
分布：米(51%)，稻(33%)，米饭(16%)


→来自古法语 ris,来自意大利语 riso,来自拉丁语 oriza,来自希腊语 oryza,最终来自梵语 vrihi-s, 米饭，大米，词源同 risotto.
n.稻,米A nice price of the iced rice is offered to the officer.军官得到了冰冻米的好价钱.



noun uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the small seeds of a particular type of grass, which are cooked and eaten as food 大米，米；米饭
•boiled/steamed/fried rice煮米饭／蒸米饭／炒米饭

•long-grain rice长粒米

•Do you prefer brown rice or white rice?你喜欢吃糙米还是精米？
■a grass which produces these seeds and grows in warm wet places 稻子；水稻



n. [作物] 稻；米饭
 - nasi
examples: 英 [raɪs] 美 [raɪs]
n.米；米饭；稻
(1) Rice is our essential foodstuff in life.(2) His plate was piled high with rice.(3) He had some rice for supper.(4) Rice yields will be higher than last year.
(1) 大米是我们生活的基本食物。(2) 他的盘子里盛满了米饭。(3) 晚饭时他吃了一些米饭。(4) 稻产量将高于去年。
[sound:youdao-d8806a5f-41f3c02a-afbb0a9f-61465712-cb364bfe.mp3]

translation:
adj. 富有的; 肥沃的; 丰富多彩的; 油腻的

级别：richer, richest
分布：丰富的(68%)，富有的(27%)，富饶的(5%)


→来自中古英语 riche,有权的，有钱的，来自古英语 rice,有权的，来自 reg,统治，管理， 词源同 regal,regulate.引申诸相关比喻义。词义的演变体现了权钱的关系。
a.富的,有钱的;富饶的;(in)充足的,丰富的The whistler whispered, "Which is rich?"鸣笛者低语道:"哪一个富有?"



adjective MONEY  钱   ESSENTIAL  ■having a lot of money or valuable possessions 有钱的；富有的；富裕的
•He's the third richest man in Britain.他是英国的第三大富豪。

•They're one of the world's richest nations.他们国家是世界上最富的国家之一。

•He is determined to get rich quickly.他决心尽快致富。

[rɪtʃ] adjective HAVING A LOT OF STH  丰富的   IMPROVER  ■containing a large amount of a valuable natural substance such as coal, oil or wood （矿产）丰富的
•The region is rich in minerals and coal deposits.这一地区矿产和煤炭储量丰富。

•The country has vast oil reserves and rich deposits of other minerals.这个国家石油储量巨大，其他矿产资源也非常丰富。
rich in sth ■containing a lot of something good or useful 富含…的
•Pineapple juice is rich in vitamins A and B.凤梨汁富含维生素 A 和维生素 B

•The English language is rich in vocabulary.英语的辞汇很丰富。
■Rich land or soil contains a large amount of substances which help plants to grow 肥沃的；富饶的；丰产的
•the richest arable land in the country该国最肥沃的可耕地
■containing a lot of exciting events or experiences and therefore very interesting 丰富多彩的；阅历丰富的
•He has written a book about the island's rich history.他写了一本书介绍该岛屿的沧桑历史。

•She had a rich and varied life and met many famous and exciting people.她历经沧桑，见过很多著名的、具有传奇色彩的人物。
■If the style of something such as a piece of furniture or a building is rich, it contains a lot of decoration 富丽堂皇的；装饰华丽的
•The temple is noted for its rich carvings.这座庙因其精雕细琢、丰富多姿的雕刻而闻名。

[rɪtʃ] adjective ATTRACTIVE  吸引的   ADVANCED  ■A rich colour, sound, smell or taste is strong in a pleasing or attractive way （颜色）浓重的；（声音）浑厚的，圆润洪亮的；（味道）馥郁的
•This lipstick gives long-lasting rich colour.这种口红色泽鲜艳持久。

•She produced a rich, deep tone from her clarinet.她用单簧管吹奏出的曲调深沉饱满。

•The wine has a rich aromatic flavour.红葡萄酒味道馥郁浓醇。
■A rich material is very beautiful and valuable 华丽昂贵的
•She wore a velvet skirt and a rich brocade jacket.她穿着一条天鹅绒裙子，配一件华丽高档的锦缎上衣。

[rɪtʃ] adjective FOOD  食物  ■If food is rich, it contains a large amount of oil, butter, eggs or cream 油腻的
•This chocolate mousse is too rich for me.这种巧克力慕斯对我来说太油腻了。

[rɪtʃ] adjective CRITICISM  批评  [after verb] ■used to describe someone's opinions when that person has the same bad qualities that they are criticizing 荒谬的，可笑的
•The education minister's criticism of the new exam system seems rich, considering it was he who demanded the changes in the first place.教育部长对新考试制度的批评似乎有点荒唐可笑，因为当时正是他要求作出这些改革的。

•"He said I was looking rather fat." " That's a bit rich coming from him."“他说我看上去很胖。”“他这样说就有点太可笑了。”

[rɪtʃ] adjective get - rich - quick ■making it possible for you to make a lot of money in a short time 快速致富
•a get-rich-quick scheme一个快速致富计划

•She despised the get-rich-quick mentality of the 1980s.她鄙视八十年代的快速致富心态。

[rɪtʃ] plural noun the rich ■rich people considered together as a group 富人，有钱人
•The resort is frequented by the rich and famous.这个旅游胜地是富人名流经常光顾的地方。





rich, wealthy

这组词都有“富的，富裕的”的意思，其区别是：
rich: 普通用词，语气强烈，指拥有大量金钱及财产。
wealthy: 普通用词，语气不如rich强烈，多指经济上富裕、社会地位稳固，很有身份，即有钱有势。


adj. 富有的；肥沃的；昂贵的
 - expensive, dear, wealthy, costly
examples: 英 [rɪtʃ] 美 [rɪtʃ]
adj.富有的；富饶的；丰富的

(1) The rich man left his son nothing in the will.(2) Our country is a rich land.(3) He has gained rich experience in these years.(4) Her rich experience gave her an advantage over other applicants for the job.
(1) 那位富翁在遗嘱中什么都没给他儿子留下。(2) 我们是一个富饶的国家。(3) 这些年来，他取得了丰富的经验。(4) 她丰富的经验使她比其他求职者具有有利条件。
[sound:youdao-33bc53a1-d058cfd6-11373aed-11bb9fa1-d62c6b0a.mp3]

translation:
vt. 使摆脱，解除，免除

时态：rid, ridding, rids
分布：摆脱(81%)，除去(19%)


→来自古诺斯语 rhthja,清理土地，清理垃圾，来自 Proto-Germanic*reudijan,清理土地，来自 reudh,清理土地。后词义通用化，用以指摆脱，清除。
v.(of)使摆脱,使去掉The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise a device for getting rid of vice.代理顾问建议校订者想出一个根除恶习的计策.



adjective be rid of sth/sb  ESSENTIAL  ■to not now have an unwanted or unpleasant task, object or person 摆脱掉…；免去…的负担
•I didn't enjoy marking those papers and I was glad to be rid of them.我不喜欢批改那些卷子，所以我很高兴能免去这一麻烦。
get rid of sth  ESSENTIAL  ■to remove or throw away something unwanted 清除；除去；丢弃
•That cream got rid of my skin rash.那种药膏治好了我身上的皮疹。

•I used weedkiller to get rid of the weeds in the garden.我用了除草剂来除去花园里的杂草。
 ESSENTIAL  ■to sell an old or unwanted possession 处理掉；卖掉
•Have you managed to get rid of your old Volvo yet?你处理掉你的旧富豪车了吗？
get rid of sb ■to send away someone annoying or to persuade them to leave 赶走，打发走，摆脱（某人）
•We got rid of our unwelcome guests by saying we had to go to bed.我们说必须要上床睡觉了，这才把那一帮不受欢迎的客人打发走。

[rɪd] verb (ridding, rid or ridded, rid or ridded)  Phrasal Verbs   rid sb/sth of sth/sb ■to cause someone or something to be free of an unpleasant or harmful thing or person 使…摆脱；从…清除；使…去除
•Our aim is to rid this government of corruption.我们的目的就是要消除这届政府中的腐败现象。




vt. 使摆脱；使去掉
 - free from, debarrass
examples: 英 [rɪd] 美 [rɪd]
vt.摆脱；除去

(1) We will be glad to get rid of him.(2) You must rid yourself of this melancholy mood.(3) We must try every way to rid ourselves of these debts.(4) It is necessary to get rid of bureaucratic practices.(5) We have an extractor fan in the kitchen to get rid of the smell of cooking.
(1) 摆脱他，我们将很高兴。(2) 你一定要摆脱这种忧愁情绪。(3) 我们要想尽一切办法来摆脱这些债务。(4) 必须清除官僚习气。(5) 我们的厨房里有台排气扇，用来消除油烟。
[sound:youdao-d5cf0033-cc7d65da-22958da5-4a95df04-1ddd0113.mp3]

translation:
n. 粗筛; 谜语; 猜不透的难题，难解之谜
v. 用筛分选（卵石等），筛分; 用子弹把耙子打成蜂窝似的; 精查（证据）; 解（谜），猜

时态：riddled, riddling, riddles
分布：谜(74%)，谜语(21%)，解谜(2%)，出谜题(1%)，充满(1%)，筛选(1%)


→词源同 read,读，理解，猜测，-le,小词后缀。引申词义谜，谜语。
n.谜,谜语The odd man added an additional riddle to the middle of the saddle.那个怪人把一个额外的谜语添加到鞍座中间.



noun QUESTION  问题  countable ■a type of question which describes something in a difficult and confusing way, and which has a clever or funny answer, often asked as a game 谜；谜语countable usually singular ■something which is confusing, or a problem which is difficult to solve 奥秘；费解之事
•Scientists may have solved the riddle of Saturn's rings.科学家们或许已经揭开了土星环的奥秘。

['rɪd.l] noun talk/speak in riddles ■to say things in a confusing way 说话令人莫名其妙，说话像打哑谜
['rɪd.l] verb transitive ■to make a lot of holes in something 使布满洞孔
•The anti-aircraft guns riddled the plane's wings with bullets.高射炮炮弹把机翼打得千疮百孔。





puzzle, mystery, riddle, problem

这组词都有“谜、难题”的意思，其区别是：
puzzle: 语气较强，指复杂令人费解的情况或问题。
mystery: 指常人难以认识其起因或性质的奥秘，或指有意不让人理解的奥妙。
riddle: 指供人猜的谜语游戏，也可指终究会有解答的难题。
problem: 指有待探讨的疑难问题，也可指令人困惑的情况。


n. 谜语； [矿业] 粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
 - brainteaser, conundrum
examples: 英 ['rɪdl] 美 ['rɪdl]
n.谜；谜语vt.解谜；出谜题；充满；打洞；筛选vi.出谜题

(1) That painting is still a riddle to us.(2) He could not solve the riddle.(3) He got the answer to the riddle as quick as a flash.(4) The riddle was at last unriddled.(5) She loved to riddle out the solution to problems.(6) The door was riddled with shots.(7) Stay where you are,or I'll riddle you with bullet holes.(8) His daily work is to riddle coal cinders to get out the larger pieces.
(1) 那幅画对我们仍然是个谜。(2) 他猜不出这个谜。(3) 他一下子就猜中了谜底。(4) 这个谜语终于得到了解答。(5) 她喜欢解答问题。(6) 门被子弹打得尽是窟窿。(7) 不要乱动，不然我就把你打得满身是弹孔。(8) 他每天的工作是用粗筛筛煤渣，将大块的煤渣挑出来。

translation:
vt. & vi. 乘，骑，驾
n. （乘坐汽车等的）旅行; 乘骑; （乘车或骑车的）短途旅程; 供乘骑的游乐设施
vt. （骑马、自行车等）穿越; 搭乘; 飘浮

时态：rode, ridden, riding, rides
分布：骑(70%)，乘(23%)，乘车(4%)，搭便车(2%)，交通工具(1%)


→来自古英语 ridan,骑马，乘坐，来自 Proto-Germanic*ridan,骑行，来自 reidh,骑行，词源 同 road,raid.
v./n.骑,乘Do you mean to say you don't know how to ride a bicyle?难道说你自行车都不会骑吗?



verb (rode, ridden) ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to sit on a horse or a bicycle and travel along on it controlling its movements 骑（马或脚踏车）
•I learned to ride a bike when I was six.我六岁学会了骑脚踏车。

•I ride my bicycle to work.我骑脚踏车去上班。

•I ride to work on my bicycle.我骑脚踏车去上班。

•The hunters came riding by/past on their horses.猎人们骑马飞驰而过。

•He rides well/badly (= He can ride horses well/badly).他骑术很好／差。
 ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to travel in a vehicle, such as a car, bus or train 乘（车），坐（车）；乘搭
•mainly US We rode the train from Sydney to Perth.我们坐火车从雪梨到柏斯。

•He hasn't got a car so he rides to work on the bus.他没有私家车，所以就坐公车去上班。
transitive US ■to try to control someone and force them to work 驾驭，试图控制某人并强迫其工作
•Your boss is riding you much too hard at the moment.你的老板此时把你管得太严了。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)be riding for a fall ■to be behaving in a way that is likely to lead you into trouble 自讨苦吃；自找麻烦
•She spends far more than she earns and she's riding for a fall.她入不敷出，早晚会有麻烦。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)be riding high ■to be very successful 大获成功；一帆风顺
•riding high in the polls/charts在选举中大获成功／在流行音乐排行榜上名列前茅

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)let sth ride informal ■to not take any action to stop something wrong or unpleasant, thinking that action may not be necessary or is not yet necessary 听之任之；放任自流
•Don't panic about the low sales - let it ride for a while till we see if business picks up.销售额低迷也不必惊慌——先观望一阵子，看看生意能不能有起色。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)ride (on) a wave of sth ■If you ride (on) a wave of a feeling, you get an advantage from it 乘…之势；借…的东风
•The Prime Minister is riding (on) a wave of popularity.首相深得人心，大获其益。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)ride herd on sb/sth US ■to be responsible for controlling a group of people and their actions 看管，监督
•The new editor will ride herd on the staff, checking on the overall policy and tone of the paper.新编辑将要管理全体职员，检查该报的整体政策和风格。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)ride (out) the storm ■to manage not to be destroyed, harmed or permanently affected by the difficult situation you experience 渡过难关；走出困境
•The government seem confident that they'll ride out the storm.政府好像很有信心渡过难关。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)ride roughshod over sb/sth ■to do what you want without giving any attention to other people or their wishes 不管…而一意孤行
•They accused the government of riding roughshod over parliamentary procedure.他们指责政府藐视议会程式一意孤行。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)  Phrasal Verbs   ride on sth/sb ■When something important, such as your reputation or money, rides on a particular person or thing, it will be won or achieved if that person or thing is successful 依赖，依靠，指望
•The future of the company now rides on the new managing director.公司的未来现在就指望新任经理了。

•I have a lot of money riding on that horse (= I will win or lose a lot of money if that horse wins or loses the race).我在那匹赛马上押了很多钱。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] ride sth out ■to continue to exist during a difficult situation and until it ends, without serious harm 安然渡过（难关）
•Many companies did not manage to ride out the recession.经济衰退时期，许多公司没能渡过难关。
■If a ship rides out a period of bad weather, it continues to float during it, without serious damage （船）平安渡过（暴风雨）
•The ship managed to ride out the storm.这艘轮船平安渡过了风暴。

[raɪd] verb (rode, ridden)  Phrasal Verbs   ride up ■If a piece of clothing rides up, it moves up out of position （衣服）向上收，缩上去
•Your skirt has ridden up at the back.你的裙子后面缩上去了。

[raɪd] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a journey on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle （骑马、骑车或乘坐车辆的）旅行，行程
•It's a short bus ride to the airport.坐公共汽车去机场很近。

•I went for a (horse) ride last Saturday.上周六我（骑马）去兜了一圈。

•Do you want to come for a ride on my motorbike?你想坐我的摩托车去兜兜风吗？
 IMPROVER  ■a free journey in a car to a place where you want to go 乘便车；搭乘免费车
•He asked me for a ride into town.他请求搭我的便车进城。
■a machine in an amusement park which people travel in or are moved around by for entertainment （游乐园里）供人乘坐的游乐装置
•My favourite ride is the Ferris wheel.我最爱坐摩天轮。

[raɪd] noun countable a rough ride ■a difficult time 一段艰苦时期
•Government plans to cut sick pay had a rough ride in the House of Commons.政府削减病假工资的计划受到了下议院的阻挠。

•The construction industry is in for a rough ride this year.建筑业今年将面临一段艰苦时期。

[raɪd] noun countable take sb for a ride informal ■to deceive or cheat someone 欺骗（某人）；愚弄（某人）
•Be careful or he'll take you for a ride.小心点，不然他会骗你的。





ride, drive

这组词都有“乘、骑”的意思，其区别是：
ride: 通常指骑在车、马上行驶。
drive: 指乘坐在有轮子的交通工具之内，控制其行驶。


vi. 骑马；乘车；依靠；漂浮
 - horse, trust, swim
vt. 骑；乘；控制
 - possess, regulate, contain, manage, bottle
n. 骑；乘坐；交通工具；可供骑行的路
 - vehicle, embarkation
examples: 英 [raɪd] 美 [raɪd]
v.骑；乘n.交通工具；骑；乘车；搭便车

(1) She hasn't been out riding since the accident.(2) I can ride a bicycle, and I can drive a car, but I can not ride a horse.(3) You'll never learn to ride a bicycle if you don't practise.(4) It's a ten-minute ride on the bus.(5) This balloon ride is incredible.(6) A park and ride network will allow private vehicles to also act as feeders to the rail system.(7) I want to have a ride of that bike.(8) It's only a 5-minute bus-ride to the park.(9) The luxury model gives a smoother ride.(10) He hitched a ride to the station.
(1) 她自从出了事故以后，一直没有骑马外出过。(2) 我会骑自行车，而且我会开汽车。但我不会骑马。(3) 如果你不练习,就学不会骑自行车。(4) 乘公共汽车要用十分钟。(5) 这次乘气球旅行简直令人难以置信。(6) 泊车转乘网络将有助于私家车成为接驳铁路的交通工具。(7) 我想骑一骑那辆自行车。(8) 坐公共汽车去公园仅需5分钟。(9) 坐这种豪华型汽车感觉很平稳。(10) 他搭便车到车站去。
[sound:youdao-c358e885-a7664ce1-1b6d5e2e-4c69b5b6-fa144d8f.mp3]

translation:
n. 骑手，骑马的人，善于骑马的人，骑师; （精密天平上的）游（动砝）码; 附文，附加条附加条款款; 扶手

分布：骑士(76%)，扶手(13%)，附件(11%)


【记】ride骑，r：骑在法案上的东西－附加条款【参】ridge（n 背脊；山脊）



US [-dɚ] noun countable ON HORSE/BICYCLE  车或马上   IMPROVER  ■a person who travels along on a horse or bicycle 骑马者，骑师；骑车者
•One of the riders was thrown off his horse.其中一位骑师被甩下马背。

UK ['raɪ.dər] US [-dɚ] noun countable EXTRA STATEMENT  附加条文  formal ■a statement that is added to what has already been said or decided, or an addition to a government bill (= a written plan for a law) 附加意见；附文；议案的附加条款
•I should like to add a rider to the judgment of the court.我要在法庭判决上附加一条意见。




n. 骑手；附文；扶手
 - rail, caballero
examples: 英 ['raɪdə(r)] 美 ['raɪdər]
n.骑士；附件；扶手
(1) In the far distance I saw a rider approaching.(2) The rider forced his horse on through the storm.
(1) 在远处，我看见一位骑士渐渐靠近。(2) 骑士迫使他的马在暴风雨中前进。
[sound:youdao-88ef32ea-8d2c3001-b401209a-05207fbd-aad2029a.mp3]

translation:
n. 背脊，峰，隆起线; 山脊，山脉，海脊; 高压脊; 皱摺，田埂
vt. 使成脊状，使隆起
vi. 使成脊状

时态：ridged, ridging, ridges
分布：脊(72%)，山脊(21%)，山脉(6%)，隆起部(1%)


→来 自 古 英 语 hrycg, 人 的 背 部 ， 驮 畜 的 背 部 ， 来 自 Proto-Germanic*hrugjaz, 背 ， 来 自 skreuk,*sker,弯，转，词源同 ring,curve.后引申词义山脊，山脉。
n.岭,山脉;屋脊;鼻梁Riding on the ridge of the bridge, the proud bride shouts loudly to the cloud.骄傲的新娘骑在桥脊上对着云大声喊.



noun countable ■a long narrow raised part of a surface, especially a high edge along a mountain 脊；垄；尤指山脊
•We walked along the narrow mountain ridge.我们沿着狭窄的山脊行进。

•figurative A ridge (= narrow area) of high pressure will bring good weather this afternoon.今天下午高压脊将会带来好天气。
■the part of a roof where the sloping sides join at the top 屋脊
[rɪdʒ] noun countable have been around the ridges Australian ■If you have been around the ridges, you have a lot of experience. 有丰富的经验



n. [地理] 山脊；山脉； [建] 屋脊
 - mountain range, cordillera
examples: 英 [rɪdʒ] 美 [rɪdʒ]
n.脊；山脊；山脉；隆起部v.（使）成山脊

(1) Recurvature follows after it traverses the ridge axis.(2) Riding on the ridge of the bridge, the proud bride shouts loudly to the cloud.(3) He walked along the mountain ridge.(4) The evening before the battle, Wellington took up a defensive position along, and to the rear of, a long ridge.(5) A gentle breeze from the Blue Ridge Mountains carried the scent of honeysuckle.(6) Instead Meldrum's visit to a ridge in the Blue Mountains set him firmly on a quest he has been on since.(7) The floor of the Atlantic ridges in the middle from north to south.(8) The low land should be ridged before they are used.
(1) 预料尼伯特将于横过副高脊线后开始转向。(2) 骄傲的新娘骑在桥脊上对着云大声喊。(3) 他顺着山脊走。(4) 那场战斗的前夜，威灵顿沿一条长长的山脊背后占据了一个防守阵地。(5) 从蓝岭山脉吹过来的和风，带来了忍冬花的芬芳。(6) 麦德伦跑去蓝山山脉一探究竟，没想到就此加入追寻答案的行列。(7) 大西洋洋底在中部形成由北向南的海脊。(8) 低地在使用前应先整成交替的垄和沟。
