translation:
n. 罗马字体

分布：罗马人(28%)，罗马的(25%)，罗马天主教的(15%)，罗马帝国的(15%)，罗马字体(12%)，罗马天主教徒(5%)


→来自 Rome,罗马，-an,人。
罗马的n.罗马人[-an表名词和形容词"…地方,...人]



US ['roʊ-] adjective ■describes the ordinary style of printed writing in which the letters are vertical （印刷常用的）罗马体的，正体的
examples: 英 ['rəʊmən] 美 ['roʊmən]
adj.罗马的；罗马帝国的；罗马天主教的n.罗马人；罗马天主教徒；罗马字体

(1) Archaeologists have traced many Roman roads in Britain.(2) Here is a book about Roman history.(3) I am reading a book about the rise and fall of the Roman Empire.(4) Roman Catholic priests are not free to marry.(5) The Pope is the supreme leader of the Roman Catholic Church.(6) He wrote a storybook about ancient Romans.(7) My grandmother is a Roman Catholic and goes to mass every week.(8) Roman Catholics go to confession to be cleansed of their sins.(9) Most of this dictionary is in roman.
(1) 考古学家在英国发现了许多古罗马的道路。(2) 这是一本关于古罗马历史的书。(3) 我正在看一本关于罗马帝国兴衰的书。(4) 罗马天主教的教士不许随便结婚。(5) 教皇是罗马天主教的最高领袖。(6) 他写了一本关于古罗马人的故事集。(7) 我祖母是罗马天主教徒，每周都去做礼拜。(8) 罗马天主教徒怅悔是为了洗涤罪过。(9) 这本字典大部份是用罗马字体。

translation:
adj. 浪漫的，谈情说爱的，多情的，风流的，香艳的; 空想的，虚构的，怪诞的，想入非非的，不实际的，难实行的（计划等）; 传奇（式）的，小说般的，情节离奇的; 浪漫主义的
n. 富于浪漫气息的人; 浪漫主义作家[画家等]，浪漫派诗人[艺术家]; 浪漫思想[行为]

分布：浪漫的(90%)，浪漫的人(6%)，不切实际的(4%)


→来自 romance,浪漫，-itic,形容词后缀。
浪漫的(roman浪漫)[-tic表形容词,通常放在一个名词前,"与…相关的,...的"]
a.浪漫的,传奇式的;不切实际的,好幻想的He is very romantic.他充满着幻想.



US [roʊ'mæn.tˌɪk] adjective  IMPROVER  ■relating to love or a close loving relationship 爱情的，情爱的
•a romantic novel/comedy言情小说／爱情喜剧

•You used to be so romantic, but now you never tell me that you love me.你以前是那么多情，可现在你从来就不对我说你爱我。

•I suppose he is quite romantic - he sends me flowers on my birthday and tells me I'm looking beautiful and so on.我猜他是个很浪漫的人－－他在我的生日送花给我，又说我看起来很漂亮等等。
■exciting and mysterious and having a strong effect on your emotions 富于浪漫色彩的；充满传奇色彩的；惊险的
•We thought that Egypt was an incredibly romantic country.我们以前认为埃及是个充满传奇色彩的国家。
■slightly disapproving ■not practical and having a lot of ideas which are not related to real life 不切实际的；空想的；幻想的
•She has a romantic idea of what it's like to be a struggling young artist.她不切实际地想像着做一个挣扎求生的年轻艺术家是如何浪漫。

UK [rəʊ'mæn.tɪk] US [roʊ'mæn.tˌɪk] noun countable mainly disapproving ■someone who is not practical and has ideas which are not related to real life 耽于幻想的人；满脑子浪漫想法的人；浪漫主义者
•You're a hopeless/incurable romantic.你是个不可救药的幻想家。




adj. 浪漫的；多情的；空想的
 - fantastic, amorous
examples: 英 [rəʊ'mæntɪk] 美 [roʊ'mæntɪk]
adj.浪漫的；不切实际的n.浪漫的人

(1) I was told that Spain is a romantic nation.(2) It is said that Frenchmen are among the most romantic people in the world.(3) His head is stuffed with silly romantic ideas.(4) She has romantic notions about becoming a famous actress.(5) Romantic is the last thing I am.(6) You're fun to be with and a romantic at heart.
(1) 有人告诉我说，西班牙是个浪漫的国家。(2) 据说法国人是世界上最浪漫的民族之一。(3) 他满脑子天真的想法。(4) 她心里充满幻想，总希望有一天会成为著名演员。(5) 我是最不浪漫的人。(6) 和你相处很有趣,你实际上是个很罗曼蒂克的人。

translation:
n. 屋顶，房屋; 最高部，顶部; 最高限度; 口腔顶部
vt. 给…盖顶; 覆盖; 保护，庇护

时态：roofed, roofing, roofs
分布：顶(56%)，屋顶(42%)，覆盖(1%)，给 ... 覆以屋顶(1%)


→来自古英语 hrof,屋顶，天花板，天空。
n.屋顶,顶It's proved that the approver improved waterproof roof.经证实,赞同者改善了防水屋顶.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■the covering that forms the top of a building, vehicle, etc 屋顶；车顶；顶部；盖
•The house has a sloping/flat/tiled/thatched/etc. roof.这间房子是斜顶／平顶／瓦顶／茅草等屋顶。

•Put the luggage on the roof of the car.把行李放在车顶上。

•The roof (= upper surface) of the cave is 50 metres up.洞顶距地面有50米高。

•This cake is so dry that it sticks to the roof of  your  mouth (= upper surface of the mouth).这蛋糕很干，吃的时候会粘在上颚上。

[ru:f] noun countable go through the roof ■to rise to a very high level 飞涨；激增
•Prices have gone through the roof.物价飞涨。
 (also hit the roof) informal ■to get very angry 火冒三丈，暴跳如雷
•When I was expelled from school, my parents went through the roof.我被学校开除后，我父母气得暴跳如雷。

[ru:f] noun countable raise the roof ■to play/sing very loudly and enthusiastically 高声喧闹；纵声欢唱；闹翻天
•With their last, triumphant piece, the musicians raised the roof.在演奏最后一支欢快振奋的曲子时，音乐家们愈加奔放，激情四射。

[ru:f] noun countable a roof over your head ■a place to live 住处；栖身之处
•She gave him enough money to get a roof over his head.她给他的钱足够他找个住处了。

[ru:f] noun countable under the same roof ■in the same building 在同一屋檐下；在同一座房屋里
•I refuse to live under the same roof as that man.我拒绝和那个讨厌的男人住在同一屋檐下。

[ru:f] verb transitive often passive ■to put a roof on a building 给（建筑物）盖屋顶；给（建筑物）装屋顶
[ru:f] verb transitive often passive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] roof sth in/over ■to put a roof over a place or area 加顶于；给…装盖顶
•The council has decided to roof over the open-air swimming pool.政务委员会决定给露天游泳池装上顶盖。




n. [建] 屋顶；最高处，顶部；最高限度
 - top, housetop
vt. 给…盖屋顶，覆盖
 - invest, house, sheet, cap
examples: 英 [ruːf] 美 [ruːf]
n.屋顶；顶vt.覆盖；给 ... 覆以屋顶

(1) The wind was whispering in the roof.(2) Has your roof a sharp slant?(3) Snow sifted through the crack in the roof into the room.(4) The stone made a dent in the roof of my car.(5) We're going to roof in the yard to make a garage.(6) The shed was roofed over with tin.
(1) 屋顶上风声飒飒。(2) 你的屋顶是否有一个陡峭的斜面？(3) 雪从屋顶上的裂缝飘进屋里。(4) 我的汽车顶让石头砸了个坑。(5) 我们打算将院子加盖屋顶建成一个车库。(6) 那间小屋以马口铁为屋顶。
[sound:youdao-85837b7b-3facfa04-ad6a6c29-86f9d6af-fde1d426.mp3]

translation:
n. 房间; 空间; 余地; 房间里所有的人
vt. 租房，合住; 为…提供住处; 投宿，住宿; 留…住宿

时态：roomed, rooming, rooms
分布：房间(79%)，空间(16%)，机会(3%)，寄宿(1%)，给…提供留宿(1%)


→来自古英语 rum,空间，范围，来自 Proto-Germanic*ruma,空间大的，广阔的，来自 reue, 展开，宽广，词源同 rural,rustic.引申词义房间，室。
n.房间,室,空间,地方;余地The whole room laughed.屋子里的人哄堂大笑.



noun PLACE  地方   ESSENTIAL  countable ■a part of the inside of a building that is separated from other parts by walls, floor and ceiling 房间，室
•She's waiting for you in the conference room upstairs.她正在楼上会议室等你。

•She's upstairs in her room (= her private room, where she sleeps).她在楼上自己房间里。

•figurative The whole room (= All the people in the room) turned and looked at her.整个房间里的人都扭过头来看她。
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■Room is also used as a combining form （用于合成词中）房间，室，厅
•a bedroom睡房

•a bathroom浴室

•a dining-room餐厅

•living-room起居室

•a hotel room宾馆客房

•He booked a single/double room (= a room for one person/two people in a hotel).他预订了一间单人／双人客房。
rooms [plural] UK old-fashioned ■a set of rented rooms, especially in a college or university （尤指大学中租住的）一套房间，住所，寓所
[ru:m] [rʊm] noun SPACE  空间   ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■the amount of space that someone or something needs 空间，空地方
•That sofa would take up too much room in the flat.那个沙发放在公寓房中太占空间。

•James took the books off the little table to make room for the television.詹姆斯拿走了小桌上的书，腾出地来放电视。

•He's fainted! Don't crowd him - give him room.他昏倒了！别围在他旁边——给他让出点地方来。

•Is there (enough/any) room for me in the car?我还能坐进车里去吗／车里还有我坐的地方吗？

•[+ to infinitive] There's hardly room to move in here.这里面挤得几乎动都动不了。
uncountable ■opportunity for doing something 机会；余地
•I feel the company has little room for manoeuvre.我觉得公司几乎没有回旋的余地。

[ru:m] [rʊm] noun no room for sth ■If you say there is no room for a feeling or type of behaviour, you mean it is not acceptable 无法容忍，不能容许
•In a small company like this, there is no room for lazy staff.在这样的小公司中，懒惰的员工是没有容身之地的。

[ru:m] [rʊm] noun room for doubt ■a possibility of something being true 可疑之处，可置疑的地方
•There is little room for doubt about what happened.所发生的一切已毋庸置疑。

[ru:m] [rʊm] noun room for improvement ■a possibility or hope that someone or something will improve 改进的余地；进步的可能
•Her writing is better but there is still room for improvement.她写得比以前好多了，但是仍有改进的余地。

[ru:m] [rʊm] noun There's no/not enough room to swing a cat. saying ■said about a place or space that is very small 空间很狭仄；（地方）连转个身都困难
[ru:m] [rʊm] verb intransitive usually + adverb or preposition US ■to rent a room from someone, or share a rented room with someone 租住；（与某人）合租
•At college he rooms with this guy from Nebraska.在大学里他和这个来自内布拉斯加州的小伙是室友。




n. [建] 房间；空间；余地；机会
 - apartment, opportunity, scope, vacuum, chamber
vi. 居住；住宿
 - belong, harbor, live, quarter, dwell
examples: 英 [ruːm] 美 [ruːm]
n.房间；空间；机会v.寄宿；给…提供留宿

(1) I groped for the light switch in the dark room.(2) He bounced into the room with a springy step.(3) There is no more room in the computer file.(4) There is no room for innovation in standards.(5) He needs room to develop his skill as a painter.(6) She was going to have room for the energies.(7) He's rooming with my friend Alan.
(1) 我在黑暗的房间里摸索着找电灯开关。(2) 他以轻快的跑步跳进房间。(3) 计算机文件里没有空间了。(4) 在标准化的过程中没有革新的空间。(5) 他需要机会提高他作为画家的绘画技巧。(6) 她施展抱负的机会将要来临。(7) 他住在我的朋友艾伦家里。
[sound:youdao-d6168c10-21a99ce4-75fa8693-b0c364d8-8fcf07bc.mp3]

translation:
n. 根，根源; 原因，本质; 祖先; [乐]和弦基音
vt. 使生根; 使固定; 根源在于; 欢呼，喝彩
vi. 生根; 根除

时态：rooted, rooting, roots
分布：根(79%)，根源(7%)，根除(4%)，根本(4%)，生根(3%)，扎根(3%)


→来自古英语 rot,根，来自 Proto-Germanic*wrot,根，草根，植物，来自 wrad,根，小枝， 词源同 wort,radish.引申词义根部，根基等。
n.根,根部;根本,根源v.(使)生根,(使)扎根After a shot the foot began to root and shoot in the boot.打了一针后,脚开始在靴子里生根发芽.



noun countable PLANT PART  植物的一部分   ESSENTIAL  ■the part of a plant which grows down into the earth to get water and food and which holds the plant firm in the ground 根，根茎，根块
[ru:t] noun countable CAUSE/ORIGIN  原因／根源   ESSENTIAL  ■the cause or origin of something bad （坏事的）根源，根由，原因
•We must get to the  root of (= discover the cause of) this problem.我们一定要探本溯源，查出造成这个问题的原因。

•What is/lies at  the root  of the problem is their lack of interest.这一问题的根本原因是他们缺乏兴趣。

•The high crime rate has its roots in unemployment and poverty.高犯罪率的根源在于失业和贫穷。

•So what's the root cause of his anxiety?那么使他焦虑的根本原因是甚么呢？
roots [plural] ■origins 根，根源，起源
•The city of Tours can trace  its roots  back to Roman times.图尔城的历史可以追溯到古罗马时代。
⇒ See also grassroots
[ru:t] noun countable TOOTH/HAIR/NAIL  牙、毛发或指甲  ■the part of a hair, tooth, or nail that is under the skin （毛发、牙或指甲的）根部
[ru:t] noun countable WORD  词  specialized■The root of a word is its most basic form, to which other parts, such as affixes , can be added 词根
•The root of the word 'sitting' is 'sit'.sitting 这个词的词根是 sit。

[ru:t] noun countable MATHEMATICS  数学  specialized■a solution of some equations (= mathematical statements) 根；解■specialized ■A root of a particular number is another number which, when multiplied by itself one or more times, reaches that number 根；方根
•The square root of 64 is 8, and the cube root of 64 is 4.64的平方根是八，立方根是四。

[ru:t] noun countable put down roots ■If you put down roots in a place where you have moved to live, you make new friends and join in new activities there so that you feel it is your home. （在新的地方）定居开始新的生活
[ru:t] noun countable root and branch UK (US roots and all) ■completely 彻底；根本地
•Racism must be eliminated, root and branch.必须根除种族主义。

[ru:t] noun countable take root ■If an idea, belief or system takes root somewhere, it starts to be accepted there 深入人心；被牢固树立；生根
•Communism has never really taken root in England.共产主义从未真正在英格兰扎根。

[ru:t] verb LOOK  看  intransitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to look for something by turning things over 翻找，翻寻
•She rooted through/among the papers on her desk.她在桌上的文件中翻来翻去地找东西。

•The pigs rooted for acorns in the forest.猪在树林里翻拱找橡子吃。

[ru:t] verb PLANT  植物  intransitive ■to grow roots 生根；长出根来
•The trees failed to root and so died.这些树没能生根，所以都死了。

[ru:t] verb rooted to the spot ■to be unable to move 呆若木鸡，一动不动
•She was rooted to the spot with fear/amazement.她吓／惊呆了。

[ru:t] verb   Phrasal Verbs   root about/around (somewhere) informal ■to search for something, especially by looking through other things （尤指在其他物品中）翻找，翻寻
•She was rooting around in her drawer for a pencil.她在抽屉中翻找铅笔。

[ru:t] verb   Phrasal Verbs   root for sb informal ■to show support for someone who is in a competition or who is doing something difficult 给（某人）以支援，为（某人）助威，声援（某人）
•Most of the crowd were rooting for the home team.观众中的大多数人都在为主队加油。

•Good luck! We're all rooting for you.祝你好运！我们都支援你。

[ru:t] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] root sth/sb out SEARCH FOR  informal ■to search and find something or someone that is difficult to find （费力地）搜寻到，（经过搜寻）终于找到
•I've rooted out an old pair of shoes that might fit you.我终于翻出来一双旧鞋，你穿可能合脚。
GET RID OF  ■to find and remove a person or thing that is causing a problem 找到并根除，发现并杜绝
•Ms Campbell has been appointed to root out inefficiency in this company.坎贝尔女士已经受命来调查并解决这间公司效率低下的问题。

[ru:t] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] root sth out/up ■to remove a whole plant, including the roots, from the ground 连根挖掉，连根拔出
•I suggest you root out those weeds before they take hold.我建议你把这些杂草连根拔除，等它们扎牢了根就难以除掉了。





source, root, origin

这组词都有“起源，起因，根源”的意思，其区别是：
source: 本义指某地系河流或瀑布的源头，引申指某事的来源出处，但更多指抽象事物的根源或来源。
root: 通常指事物产生的原因或根源。
origin: 侧重指事物的起源或由来，也指人的出身。


n. [数]  [植] 根；根源；词根；祖先
 - parent, principle, father, radix
vi. 生根；根除
 - radicate
vt. 生根，固定；根源在于
 - fix on, hold in place
examples: 英 [ruːt] 美 [ruːt]
n.根；根源；根本v.生根；扎根；根除

(1) Ann caught her foot on a tree root and stumbled.(2) The dog is snuffling around the root of a tree.(3) Unhappiness is the root cause of his illness.(4) Money is thought to be the root cause of all evils.(5) I finally got to the root of the problem.(6) Roses will not root in such acid soil.(7) After a few months I felt I had really taken root here.(8) The pegged-down branches of the plant will take root.(9) It is vain to attempt to root out heresy by force.
(1) 安的一只脚被树根绊了一下跌倒了。(2) 那条狗在树根处嗅来嗅去。(3) 不开心是他生病的根源。(4) 金钱被认为是万恶之源。(5) 我们最终抓住了问题的实质(6) 玫瑰在这种酸性土壤中不会生根。(7) 几个月之后，我感到确实在这里扎根了。(8) 固定的植物的枝条将会扎根。(9) 试图用暴力消除异端邪说是徒劳的。
[sound:youdao-0604f718-d3cca26e-53be24e0-fdafefb5-29da094e.mp3]

translation:
n. 粗绳; 绳索; 一串; 学会决窍，知道决窍
vt. （用绳子）捆; 用绳子系牢; 捆紧; 用套索抓捕（动物）
vi. 成索状或绳状

时态：roped, roping, ropes
分布：绳索(71%)，一串(13%)，绞刑(9%)，捆绑(7%)


→来自古英语 rap,绳子，绳索，来自 Proto-Germanic*raipaz,绳子，绳索，可能来自 sker, 弯，转，编织，词源同 ring,cradle.
n.绳,索The rope is proper property to the prospering rope maker.绳子对成功的制绳者来说是真正的财产.



US [roʊp] noun  ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■(a piece of) strong, thick string made of long twisted threads 粗绳；缆绳；绳索
•A sailor threw a rope ashore and we tied the boat to a post.一个水手将一条缆绳扔到岸上，我们就把船拴到了一根柱子上。

•a coil of rope一卷绳子
countable ■several of one type of object connected together on a string （串在一起的）（一）串，（一）条
•a rope of garlic一辫大蒜

•a rope of pearls一串珍珠
the ropes [plural] ■thick rope which surrounds an area used for boxing (= sport in which two people hit each other) or wrestling 围绳（围绕拳击或摔跤场所的粗绳；拳击运动是两个人在场上对打的运动）
•The middleweight boxing champion had his opponent up against the ropes.那个中量级拳击冠军将对手逼到了拳击台的护栏上。

UK [rəʊp] US [roʊp] noun learn/know the ropes ■to learn/know how to do a job or activity 知道诀窍；懂行，在行
UK [rəʊp] US [roʊp] noun on the ropes informal ■doing badly and likely to fail 处于困境；即将失败，即将完蛋
•I think the business is finally on the ropes.我觉得这家企业最终还是要垮掉。

UK [rəʊp] US [roʊp] noun show/teach sb the ropes ■to show someone how to do a job or activity 给（某人）指点窍门；教（某人）如何工作
•Lynn spent an afternoon showing the new girl the ropes.林恩花了一下午的时间教那个新来的年轻女职员入门。

UK [rəʊp] US [roʊp] verb transitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to tie things together with rope （用绳索）捆，绑，系
•I'll rope my horse to your car and pull you out of the ditch.我把我的马套在你的汽车上把你从沟里拉出来。

•The climbers roped themselves together.登山者用绳索把他们自己都连在一起。

UK [rəʊp] US [roʊp] verb transitive usually + adverb or preposition   Phrasal Verbs   [M] rope sb in informal ■to persuade someone to do something for you 劝说（某人）帮忙；说服（某人）加入
•At the last minute, we roped in a couple of spectators to complete the team.在最后关头，我们说服几位观看的人加入，凑足了比赛人数。

UK [rəʊp] US [roʊp] verb transitive usually + adverb or preposition   Phrasal Verbs   [M] rope sth/somewhere off ■to surround an area or place with ropes in order to keep people out 用绳围起；用绳索圈起
•The police roped off the scene of the crime.员警用绳子将犯罪现场围了起来。





rope, wire, thread, string, line, cord

这组词都有“线”的意思，其区别是：
rope: 指用于捆绑大物件的粗壮而坚固的绳子，一般用绵、毛、麻、金属或其它材料制成。
wire: 专指用金属制成的线。
thread: 普通用词，指用棉、毛、丝或纤维等纹成的很细的线，通常用于缝纫、纺织等。
string: 普通用词，指捆绑小件物品的细绳或细带子。
line: 普通用词，含义广泛，指任何一种线，常作引申用。
cord: 指比string粗，比rope细，较牢固，通常用于捆扎较小物品的线或绳。用作引申当约束讲。


n. 绳，绳索
 - line, cord
vt. 捆，绑
 - bundle, colligate
examples: 捆绑：rope ，tie
英 [rəʊp] 美 [roʊp]
n.绳索；一串；绞刑v.捆绑；说服（口）

(1) The rope was not strong enough, so we used wire.(2) They tied their prisoner up with a piece of rope.(3) I bought a beautiful rope of pearls.(4) He roped his horse on a nearby tree.(5) We must try and rope in as many helpers as possible.(6) He tried to rope Ted in on that swindle.
(1) 这根绳子不够结实，所以我们用金属线。(2) 他们用绳索把犯人捆起来。(3) 我买了一串很好看的珠子。(4) 他把马拴到附近的一棵树上。(5) 我们必须想法说服尽可能多的人来帮忙。(6) 他想拉特德入伙参加那个骗局。
[sound:youdao-fbcda2f2-f0a10055-f128e6d8-aaac5a42-032c069c.mp3]

translation:
n. 玫瑰; 粉红色; 蔷薇（花）; 粉红色的葡萄酒
adj. 玫瑰花的; 玫瑰色的; 粉红色的; 带有玫瑰香味的
vt. 使成玫瑰色，使（面颊）发红; 使有玫瑰香味
v. 起义（ rise的过去式）; 升起; （数量）增加; 休会

分布：玫瑰(48%)，玫瑰色的(20%)，蔷薇(18%)，玫瑰的(10%)，动词rise的过去式.(4%)


→来自拉丁语 rosa,玫瑰花，来自希腊语 rhodon,玫瑰花，来自古波斯语*wrda,花，来自 wrdos, 蔷薇植物。
n.玫瑰,蔷薇A storm of applause rose from the audience.观众暴雨般地鼓掌.



US [roʊz] verb past simple of■rise 
UK [rəʊz] US [roʊz] noun countable PLANT  植物   IMPROVER  ■a garden plant with thorns on its stems and pleasant-smelling flowers, or a flower from this plant 玫瑰；蔷薇
•a rose bush蔷薇丛

•She sent him a bunch of red roses.她送了他一束红玫瑰。

UK [rəʊz] US [roʊz] noun countable FOR A WATER CONTAINER  盛水壶的  ■a circular object with small holes in it which is put on the end of a watering can (= a container used for pouring water on plants) （洒水壶上的）莲蓬式喷嘴
UK [rəʊz] US [roʊz] noun countable coming up roses ■If something is coming up roses, it is happening successfully. 进展顺利；蓬勃发展
UK [rəʊz] US [roʊz] noun countable not all roses (also not a bed of roses) ■If a situation is not all roses, there are unpleasant things to deal with as well as the pleasant ones 不尽如人意；并非尽善尽美
•Being in a relationship is not all roses, you know.你知道，谈恋爱可并非总是柔情蜜意，也有不如意的事。

UK [rəʊz] US [roʊz] noun countable put the roses (back) into sb's cheeks informal ■If something puts the roses back into your cheeks, it makes you look healthy, especially after an illness （尤指在病后）使（某人）的脸色恢复红润
•A brisk walk will put the roses back into your cheeks.快步行走会使你容光焕发。

UK [rəʊz] US [roʊz] adjective noun uncountable ■(having) a pink colour 粉红色（的）；玫瑰色（的）
•The houses were painted various shades of rose.房屋被粉刷成了色泽深浅不同的粉红色。

UK [rəʊz] US [roʊz] adjective noun uncountable look at/ see sth through rose - coloured / tinted glasses (UK also look at/see sth through rose-coloured/tinted spectacles) ■to see only the pleasant things about a situation and not notice the things that are unpleasant 只看到事物好的方面；过于乐观地看待问题
•She's always looked at life through rose-tinted glasses.她总是只看到生活顺心如意的一面。




n. [园艺] 玫瑰，蔷薇；玫瑰红
 - rugosa
v. 上升（rise的过去式）；增加；起立
 - advanced, improved
examples: 英 [rəʊz] 美 [roʊz]
n.玫瑰；蔷薇adj.玫瑰色的；玫瑰的动词rise的过去式.

(1) He plucked a rose for his lover.(2) Botanists refer this flower to the rose family.(3) The box of chocolate is wrapped in rose paper.(4) There was a tombstone made of rose granite, adorned by an American flag and a bouquet of plastic flowers.(5) The life of a rose is counted by hours.(6) It's a story of Flintlock and Blood Rose.
(1) 他为情人摘了一朵玫瑰花。(2) 植物学家将这花归入蔷薇科。(3) 这盒巧克力外面有一层玫瑰色的包装纸。(4) 一个由玫瑰色的花岗岩做成的墓碑，插着美国国旗和一束塑料花。(5) 玫瑰的生命以小时计算。(6) 这是关于燧发枪和染血的玫瑰的故事唯有爱。
[sound:youdao-18d9158c-35a8c4c9-c35a9c0b-b8b6801e-8df85b19.mp3]

translation:
n. 腐烂，腐朽
vt. & vi. （使）腐烂，（使）腐朽

时态：rotted, rotting, rots
分布：腐烂(89%)，消瘦(4%)，胡话(3%)，腐蚀(2%)，使 ... 枯朽(1%)，败坏(1%)


→来自古英语 rotian,腐烂，来自 Proto-Germanic*rutona,腐烂，可能进一步来自 red,撕，咬， 词源同 rodent,rat.
v.(使)腐烂,(使)腐败,腐朽The food rotted.食品腐烂了.



US [rɑ:t] verb intransitive or transitive (-tt-) ADVANCED  ■to (cause to) decay （使）腐败；（使）腐烂；（使）腐朽
•The fruit had been left to rot on the trees.水果无人采摘，就烂在树上。

•Rain has got in and rotted (away) the woodwork.雨水漏了进来，使屋中的木建部分都朽烂了。

•the smell of rotting fruit烂水果的味道

UK [rɒt] US [rɑ:t] verb intransitive or transitive (-tt-)rot in jail/prison, etc. ■to stay in prison/etc. for a very long time 长期坐牢，饱受牢狱之苦，在监牢中逐渐憔悴
•Ruben Carter was left to rot in jail for most of his life.鲁宾．卡特的大半生都是在牢狱中度过的。

UK [rɒt] US [rɑ:t] noun uncountable ■decay 腐败；腐烂；腐朽
•Rot has got into the furniture.家俱开始朽坏。
■old-fashioned informal ■nonsense 废话；愚蠢的话
•"Don't talk rot!"“别说废话！”

UK [rɒt] US [rɑ:t] noun uncountable the rot sets in informal ■(of a situation) to begin to go wrong （情况）开始恶化，变糟
•The rot set in when his parents divorced and he started taking drugs.他的父母离婚了，他又开始吸毒，自此后他的生活就开始变得一团糟。

UK [rɒt] US [rɑ:t] noun uncountable stop the rot ■to take action against something bad, before it spreads and becomes worse 制止事态的恶化
•We must try to stop the rot before the whole school is corrupted.我们一定要在整个学校都被毁掉之前采取行动。





rot, decompose, decay

这组词都有“烂、腐烂”的意思，其区别是：
rot: 指蔬菜水果或肉类的分解、腐烂。
decompose: 侧重指动物或植物类物体由于内部组织的分解而导致的腐烂过程。
decay: 通常指由良好或完美的状态自然而缓慢地变坏或完全变坏腐烂，或部分地毁坏。


n. [植保] 腐烂；腐败；腐坏
 - corruption, decomposition
vi. [植保] 腐烂；腐败；堕落
 - fall into decay, blet
vt. [植保] 使腐烂； [木] 使腐朽；使堕落
 - corrupt, eat out
int. （表示厌恶、蔑视、烦恼等）胡说；糟了
 - rats, fiddlesticks
examples: 英 [rɒt] 美 [rɑːt]
n.腐烂；腐蚀；败坏；胡话v.腐烂；使 ... 枯朽；消瘦

(1) Foot rot is an avoidable affiction.(2) Rot in the tree trunk caused the tree to fall.(3) The roof timbers were affected by rot and insect attack.(4) We should stop it the minute the rot sets in.(5) The rot set inwhen we lost that important customer in Japan.(6) They're bound to win.' Rot! They haven't a chance!'(7) He's talking rot when he says that the company is almost bankrupt.(8) This cheap wine will rot your stomach.(9) The meat will rot if it isn't kept cool.(10) Too much television rots your brain.(11) They didn't buy the house because it had dry rot.(12) The prisoner is left to rot in the jail.

(1) 烂蹄病是可以避免的。(2) 树干的腐烂导致树倒了。(3) 屋顶的木料已经腐朽并遭虫害。(4) 腐败一产生，我们就应立即制止住。(5) 我们失去了日本的那家重要客户後,情况越来越糟了。(6) ｀他们一定赢.(7) 他说这家公司快要破产了，简直是胡说八道。(8) 这种劣质葡萄喝了会伤胃。(9) 肉如果不冷藏就会腐败。(10) 多看电视会使你的头脑退化。(11) 他们没有买那座房子，因为房子的木料已经干朽了。(12) 这个囚徒被投入监狱任凭他渐渐消瘦下去。
[sound:youdao-2489850b-75328f60-a4c97c8d-8fe4a8ad-b789d234.mp3]

translation:
adj. 旋转的
n. 旋转式机器; 环行交叉路

分布：旋转的(87%)，旋转式机器(9%)，环形交叉路(4%)


→来自拉丁语 rota,轮子，来自 ret,旋转，转动，词源同 round,roll,rotate.
a.旋转的The rotary agitator irrigated him.旋转的鼓动者可灌溉的他.



US ['roʊ.tˌɚ-] adjective ■(of a machine) having a part that moves around in a circle （机器）有旋转部件的；旋转式的
•a rotary engine旋转式引擎




adj. [机] 旋转的，转动的；轮流的
 - rolling, revolutionary
examples: 英 ['rəʊtəri] 美 ['roʊtəri]
adj.旋转的n.旋转式机器；环形交叉路
(1) The central unit is a rotary drum.(2) The rotary agitator irrigated him.
(1) 核心设备是一个旋转的滚筒。(2) 旋转的鼓动者可灌溉的他。
[sound:youdao-3e84efa3-f0ad7eda-7d0897e2-986bef02-1597bb7d.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. （使某物）旋转; 使转动; 使轮流，轮换; 交替
adj. [植]辐状的; 有辐射部分的

时态：rotated, rotating, rotates
分布：轮流(87%)，车轮状的(13%)


→来自拉丁语 rotare,旋转 ，转动，来自 ret,旋转，转动，词源同 round,roll,rotary.
旋转(rot+ate)[Rot=wheel,表示"轮子,转"]
v.(使)旋转The earth rotates once a day.地球每天自转一次.



US ['roʊ.teɪt] verb intransitive or transitive ■to (cause to) turn in a circle, especially around a fixed point （尤指围绕一个固定点）（使）旋转，（使）转动
•Rotate the handle by 180° to open the door.要想打开门，将把手旋转180度。

•The wheel rotates around an axle.轮子绕轮轴旋转。

•The satellite slowly rotates as it circles the Earth.人造卫星围绕地球旋转的同时也在缓慢自转。
intransitive or transitive ■If a job rotates or if a group of people rotate their jobs, the jobs are done at different times by different people. 轮流做；（由…）轮值；轮换transitive ■When farmers rotate crops, they regularly change which crops they grow in a particular field. 轮作；换茬




whirl, turn, roll, rotate, revolve, spin, circle

这组词都有“转动、旋转”的意思，其区别是：
whirl: 指旋转或作圆周运动，侧重急速或力量。
turn: 普通用词，中性，含义不确切，可指作一个圆周运动或连续地作圆周运动，也可指仅是沿圆的弧形转动。
roll: 指某物在平面上滚动或翻滚。
rotate: 侧重指物体围绕自己的轴或中心旋转，即自转。
revolve: 强调指物体围绕本身以外的中心旋转，即公转。
spin: 指沿内轴迅速而连续旋转，或沿外部一个点作快速圆周运转。
circle: 指作圆周运动。


vi. 旋转；循环
 - wheel, circle, spin
vt. 使旋转；使转动；使轮流
 - turn, spin, swing
examples: 英 [rəʊ'teɪt] 美 ['roʊteɪt]
v.轮流；(使)旋转adj.车轮状的
(1) The post of chairman rotates among members of the committee.(2) Interns have to rotate for a few months.(3) He rotates the handle gently.(4) Does the earth rotate on an axis?
(1) 主席一职由委员会的成员轮流担任。(2) 实习医生轮流工作了几个月。(3) 他轻轻地转动手柄。(4) 地球是绕轴旋转的吗？
[sound:youdao-bffbc610-106c7a2d-e5be1cbb-ec0952d3-a02ff69f.mp3]

translation:
n. 旋转，转动; 轮流，循环; [农]轮作; [天]自转

分布：旋转(95%)，循环(5%)


【记】源于：rotate（v 使旋转）



US [roʊ-] noun uncountable ■when something moves in a circle around a fixed point （尤指围绕一个固定点）（使）旋转，（使）转动
•the speed of rotation转速
countable ■a complete circular movement around a fixed point 旋转
•The Earth completes 366 rotations about its axis in every leap year.在每一个闰年里，地球绕地轴自转366圈。
countable or uncountable ■when farmers regularly change which crops they grow in a field 轮作；轮耕（农民有规律地改变田里种植的农作物）
•crop rotation轮作；轮耕；轮植
uncountable ■when different people do the same job at different times 轮班（不同的人在不同的时间做相同的工作）
•the rotation of key positions such as that of chairman轮值（重要职务如主席等的轮流担任）

UK [rəʊ'teɪ.ʃən] US [roʊ-] noun in rotation ■one after the other, in a regular order 轮换，轮流，交替
•There are ten employees and they do the various jobs in rotation.有十名员工，他们轮流做各种工作。




n. 旋转；循环，轮流
 - revolution, rolling, circulation, turning, cycle
examples: 英 [rəʊ'teɪʃn] 美 [roʊ'teɪʃn]
n.旋转；循环

(1) Walling under the rotation radius of crane boom is prohibited.(2) The rotation of the dancer kept time with the music.(3) The seasons follow each other in rotation.(4) The rotation of crops keeps the soil healthy and fertile.(5) The chairmanship of the committee changes in rotation.
(1) 吊臂旋转半径下，禁止人行走。(2) 那个舞者跟随音乐的节拍旋转身体。(3) 四季循环交替。(4) 谷物轮种使土壤保持了肥力和高质。(5) 委员会主席一职是轮流担任的。
[sound:youdao-0c5331ea-5cf9b365-e314f034-d9daed93-b8861893.mp3]

translation:
adj. 腐烂的; 恶臭的; 堕落的; 极坏的
adv. 非常; 极其

分布：腐烂的(58%)，非常(17%)，腐朽的(17%)，讨厌的(8%)


→来自 rot 过去分词形式。比较 ridden.
a.腐烂的,腐朽的Lots of pilots plot to dot the rotten robot.大批领航员策划给腐烂的机器人打点.



US ['rɑ:.tən] adjective  ADVANCED  ■decayed 腐烂的；腐朽的；变质的
•The room smelled of rotten vegetables.房间里一股蔬菜腐烂的味道。
 ADVANCED  ■very bad 极差的，糟糕透顶的，恶劣的
•rotten weather糟糕透顶的天气

•old-fashioned It was rotten of you to leave without saying goodbye.你竟然不辞而别，也太不像话了。

UK ['rɒt.ən] US ['rɑ:.tən] adjective be rotten to the core ■If a person or organization is rotten to the core, it behaves in a way that is not honest or moral 腐败透顶（如果某人或组织腐败透顶，其行为不诚实或不道德）
•The whole legal system is rotten to the core.整个司法系统简直就是“头顶生疮脚底流脓”－－烂透了。




adj. [木] 腐烂的；堕落的； [环境] 恶臭的；虚弱的；极坏的
 - weak, fallen, rank
adv. 非常
 - extremely, badly, highly, greatly, too
examples: 英 ['rɒtn] 美 ['rɑːtn]
adj.腐烂的；腐朽的；极坏的；讨厌的adv.非常

(1) One smell of the rotten meat was enough!(2) This place has an odious smell; something must be rotten.(3) The wood was so rotten that you could put your finger through it.(4) He's a rotten apple.(5) The child is spoiled rotten.
(1) 这腐烂的肉闻一下就够受的了。(2) 这个地方有一股臭味，一定有东西腐烂了。(3) 这木料腐朽了,你可以用手指戳穿它。(4) 他是一个讨厌的家伙。(5) 这个小孩被宠坏了。

translation:
adj. 粗糙的，崎岖不平的; 粗鲁的; 狂暴的，汹涌的; 未经加工的
vt. 粗暴地对待; 使粗糙; 草拟
n. 粗糙的部分; 艰难，苦难; （高尔夫球场的）深草区
adv. 粗暴地
vi. 举止粗野

时态：roughed, roughing, roughs
分布：粗糙的(38%)，汹涌的(19%)，粗暴的(8%)，艰难的(8%)，粗暴地(7%)，草拟(5%)，粗糙地(5%)，使粗糙(4%)，暴徒(2%)，粗制品(2%)，殴打(2%)


→来自古英语 ruh,粗糙的，粗布的，多毛的，来自 Proto-Germanic*rukhaz,碎裂的，来自 reue, 粉碎，碎开，敲击，词源同 ruin,rag.引申诸相关词义。
a.粗糙的;粗略的,大致的;粗野的,粗暴的"Rough cough is tough enough," Bough said while touching the torch."剧烈咳嗽是够难以对付的,"大树枝在触摸手电筒时说道.



adjective NOT EVEN  不平坦的   ESSENTIAL  ■not even or smooth, often because of being in bad condition 高低不平的；崎岖的；难行的
•It was a rough mountain road, full of stones and huge holes.那是一条崎岖的山道，满是石头和巨大的坑洼。
 ESSENTIAL  ■If a surface such as paper or skin is rough, it does not feel smooth when you touch it （表面）粗糙的，毛糙的，不平滑的
•My hands get very rough in the cold.天一冷我的手就变得特别粗糙。
■Rough ground is ground that is not used for any particular purpose and is not even and full of wild plants. （土地）未开垦的，杂草丛生的，荒的
[rʌf] adjective NOT EXACT  不精确的   ADVANCED  [before noun] ■fairly correct but not exact or detailed; approximate 粗略的；大致的；近似的
•The builder did a rough sketch of how the new stairs would look.建筑工人画了张新楼梯草图。

•This is only a rough guess.这只是一个大致的推测。

•She made a rough estimate /calculation of the likely cost.她粗略估算／计算了一下可能的开销。

•The tests are a rough guide to students' progress.这些测试能够大致说明学生的进步情况。

[rʌf] adjective POOR QUALITY  劣质的  ■describes an alcoholic drink, especially wine, that tastes cheap and often strong （尤指酒类饮料）涩味的，辣嗓子的，劣质的■not made in a careful or expensive way 粗制滥造的；简陋的；粗糙的
•I made a rough table out of some old boxes.我用几个旧箱子造了一张简陋的餐桌。

[rʌf] adjective SOUND  声音  ■A rough voice or sound is hard and loud. 声音粗哑的，难听的■If a machine sounds rough, it is making a noise because it is in bad condition. （机器状况不佳而）发出刺耳声音的，发出杂音的
[rʌf] adjective VIOLENT  猛烈的  ■dangerous or violent; not calm or gentle 粗暴的，粗野的；猛烈的；充斥暴力的，危险的
•a rough area of town城内的危险区

•The other boys were rough, always looking for a fight.其他的男孩子们非常粗野，总是寻衅打架。

•I'm always sea-sick if the water/wind/sea/weather is rough (= stormy).在波涛汹涌时／狂风大作时／汹涌海浪中／暴风雨天气里我总会晕船。

[rʌf] adjective DIFFICULT  艰难的  ■difficult or unpleasant 艰难的；艰苦的；令人不快的
•He's had a rough time/month/year, what with the divorce and then his father dying.他刚离了婚，父亲又去世了，那一段时间／一个月／一年对他来说是太难熬了。

•It must be rough to have two kids and nowhere to live.带着两个孩子，又无处安身，日子肯定是很艰难。

[rʌf] adjective ILL  生病的  [after verb] UK ■ill 不舒服的，不适的，有病的
•You look a bit rough - how much did you have to drink last night?你看上去有点气色不好——你昨晚喝了多少酒啊？

[rʌf] adjective rough and ready ■produced quickly, with little preparation 草草制成的，粗制滥造的■simple but good enough 简单粗糙但尚可用的，简陋但可行的
•rough and ready accommodation简陋但还过得去的膳宿

[rʌf] adjective rough edges ■If a piece of work or a performance has rough edges, some parts of it are not of very good quality 瑕疵，美中不足之处
•He's a great footballer, but his game still has a few rough edges.他是一个优秀的足球运动员，但他的技艺仍有瑕疵。
■If a person has rough edges, they do not always behave well and politely 偶尔的无礼或不良行为
•I knew him before he was successful, and he had a lot of rough edges back then.在他还没有成功的时候我就认识他了，那时候他是一个粗野的人。

[rʌf] adjective rough justice/luck ■something that happens to you that is severe or unfair 不公平的遭遇／残酷的命运
•It seems like rough justice that he should lose his house as well as his wife.他老婆、房子都没了，这好像有点太残酷了。

[rʌf] verb rough it informal ■to live temporarily in basic and uncomfortable conditions （暂时）将就度日，因陋就简地生活
•While the house was being decorated we roughed it in a tent.在装修房子期间，我们将就着住在帐篷里。

[rʌf] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] rough sth in ■If you rough a drawing in, you you draw the basic lines, without the detail. 大致勾画出…的轮廓，勾勒
[rʌf] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] rough sth out ■If you rough out a drawing, idea or plan, you draw or write the main parts of it without giving its details. 勾勒，画出…的轮廓；拟出…的梗概，草拟
[rʌf] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] rough sb up informal ■to hit and kick someone, usually to frighten or threaten them （通常为恐吓或威胁而）揍（某人），殴打（某人），对（某人）动粗
[rʌf] noun DRAWING  画图  countable ■a first quick drawing of something 草图，略图in rough ■simple and without details 粗略地；大概地；大致上
•His first plans were drawn up in rough.他最初的计划是草草拟就的。

[rʌf] noun VIOLENT PERSON  暴徒  countable ■a violent person 粗人，莽汉，暴徒
•a gang of drunken young roughs一群醉酒撒野的年轻人

[rʌf] noun GOLF  高尔夫球  the rough ■in golf, an area of ground with long grass （高尔夫球场的）生有长草的起伏地面，深草区
•My ball landed in the rough.我把球打进了深草区。

[rʌf] noun rough and tumble ■fighting between children that is not serious 孩子间的小打斗
•It was just a bit of rough and tumble.那只不过是孩子间的小打小闹。
■a busy activity which people do in a very forceful way 激烈的竞争；混战
•She enjoys the rough and tumble of politics.她喜欢复杂的政治斗争。

[rʌf] noun take the rough with the smooth ■to accept the unpleasant parts of a situation as well as the pleasant parts 是好是歹一起承受，好事坏事都能接受，既能享乐也能吃苦
•That's relationships for you - you have to take the rough with the smooth.谈恋爱就是那样，你苦乐都要一起接受。

[rʌf] adverb VIOLENTLY  粗鲁地  ■forcefully or violently 粗野地；粗鲁地
•The Hull team had a bad reputation for playing rough.赫尔队打法粗野，臭名远扬。

[rʌf] adverb OUTSIDE  街头  live/sleep rough ■to live outside not in a house, and sleep on the ground 风餐露宿
•When we ran out of money, we slept rough for a week.我们的钱花没了，一个星期都露宿街头。





preliminary, rough

preliminary: 初步的，预备的
rough: 粗糙的，大致的



hoarse, rough, harsh

这组词都有“嘶哑的，沙哑的”的意思，其区别是：
hoarse: 指嘶哑刺耳的声音，通常因高声喊叫后嗓子失音所致。
rough: 指粗哑难听的声音。
harsh: 一般多指刺耳难听的声音。



rude, crude, harsh, rough, coarse

这组词都有“粗糙的”的意思，其区别是：
rude: 指加工粗糙、不精细。也指某人的言行举止粗鲁无礼，缺乏修养。
crude: 主要指未经加工处理尚处于自然状态的物质；也可指人的言行粗鲁。
harsh: 指外表、性质、声音的粗糙、刺耳、刺目，强调使人不愉快的粗糙感。
rough: 普通用词，指某物纹理不精细，或表面凹凸不平，不光滑。
coarse: 指某物质地粗糙低劣或编织、加工等不精细、精巧。也指人的言谈举止粗鲁，不文雅。


adj. [机] 粗糙的；粗略的；粗野的；艰苦的；未经加工的
 - crude, robust, tough, gross, coarse
vt. [机] 使粗糙；粗暴对待；草拟
 - harshen, draw up
n. 艰苦；高低不平的地面；未经加工的材料；粗糙的部分
 - arduousness
adv. [机] 粗糙地；粗略地；粗暴地
 - coarsely, crudely
examples: 英 [rʌf] 美 [rʌf]
adj.粗糙的；粗略的，大概的；粗暴的；艰难的；讨厌的；不适的；汹涌的adv.粗糙地；粗暴地n.粗制品；暴徒；高低不平的路面vt.使粗糙；殴打；草拟

(1) The rough road made the car vibrate.(2) You'd better give us a rough idea of your price.(3) It is only a rough guide to ideal weight.(4) They complained rough handling by the police.(5) I feel a bit rough--I'm going to bed.(6) He is now able to play rough and tumble with the other kids.(7) Write it in rough and then copy it.(8) We only saw the new painting in the rough.(9) Micro-exfoliators help slough away rough, dull, uneven skin for a more radiant complexion.(10) The gang decided to rough him up,as a warning to others.

(1) 崎岖不平的道路使车颠簸得很厉害。(2) 您最好给我们一个粗略的价格。(3) 这只是一个实现理想体重的粗略的办法。(4) 他们抱怨受到警察粗野的对待。(5) 我有点儿不舒服－－想去睡觉了。(6) 现在他可以粗暴地摔倒其他孩子了。(7) 先起草再誊写。(8) 我们只见过那幅新画未完成时的样子。(9) 细腻的磨砂颗粒帮助去除被溶解的角质，使粗糙晦暗不均匀的皮肤重现柔嫩和光泽。(10) 暴徒们决定揍他一顿，作为对别人的警告。

translation:
adv. 粗略地; 大体上; 大致上; 粗暴地

分布：粗略地(29%)，粗暴地(22%)，大约(18%)，粗鲁地(18%)，粗糙地(13%)


→rough,粗糙的，-ly,副词后缀。引申词义粗略，大致。



adverb NOT EXACTLY  不精确的   IMPROVER  ■approximately 大致地，近似地，粗略地
•There has been an increase of roughly 2.25 million.大概增长了225万。

•Roughly speaking , it's 2.25 million.大致来说，有225万。

•We have roughly similar tastes/roughly the same tastes.我们的口味大致相同。

['rʌf.li] adverb NOT EVENLY  粗糙地  ■without taking a lot of care to make something perfect 粗糙地；不精细地；简单地
•Roughly chop the tomatoes and add to the onions.把番茄简单切成几大块，加到洋葱里。

['rʌf.li] adverb VIOLENTLY  粗暴地  ■in a violent or angry way 粗暴地
•He pushed the children roughly to one side.他粗暴地将孩子们推到一边。

•"And what's going on here?" he said roughly.“这里怎么回事？”他粗鲁地问道。





almost, approximately, about, nearly, roughly, around

这组词都有“大约，差不多”的意思，其区别是：
almost: 指在程度上相差很小，差不多。
approximately: 多用于书面语，指精确度接近某个标准以致误差可忽略不计。
about: 常可分almost和nearly换用，但about用于表示时间、数量的“大约”时，实际数量可能多也可能少。
nearly: 与almost含义基本相同，侧重指数量、时间或空间上的接近。
roughly: 指按精略估计，常代替about。
around: 多用于非正式场合，常见于美国英语。


adv. 粗糙地；概略地
 - coarsely, crudely
examples: 英 ['rʌfli] 美 ['rʌfli]
adv.粗略地；大约；粗暴地；粗糙地；粗鲁地

(1) Roughly speaking, I would say that about100 people attended the exhibit.(2) They all left at roughly the same time.(3) The speaker was roughly handled by the mob.(4) The oven was made of a roughly built cube of fire-bricks.(5) He pushed her roughly out of the door.
(1) 粗略地说来，我想大约有100人参观了展览。(2) 他们都是大约同一时间离开的。(3) 演说者受到暴民的粗暴对待。(4) 烤箱是用做工粗糙的近似立方形的耐火砖做的。(5) 他粗鲁地把她推出门外。
[sound:youdao-2fc13b39-7b45d0d9-800914f7-5d408cdd-baf2028b.mp3]

translation:
adj. 圆形的; 弧形的; 丰满的，肥胖的; 整数的
adv. 到处; 在周围; 迂回地; 朝反方向
prep. 大约; 绕过，环绕; （表示位置）在…四周; 附近
n. 圆，圆形; 循环; 圆形物，球状物; （会议的）一回合
vt. & vi. 使成圆形; 绕行; 拐过，绕过; 把…四舍五入

时态：rounded, rounding, rounds
分布：圆的(48%)，围绕(11%)，圆形物(6%)，绕行(6%)，丰满的(6%)，球形的(5%)，巡视(5%)，四处(5%)，完整的(4%)，弄圆(2%)，大量的(2%)


→来自拉丁语 rotundus,圆的，词源同 rotund,rotate.引申诸相关词义。
a.圆的prep.围绕ad.在周围v.绕行n.(一)回合The boundary around the round ground separates us from the surroundings.围绕着圆形场地的边界将我们同四周隔开.



preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) AROUND  围绕   ESSENTIAL  ■in a circular direction or position; around 围绕；环绕；绕过
•The Moon goes round the Earth.月球围绕地球转。

•We ran round (the outside of the house) to the back, looking for the dog.我们跑到房子后面去找狗。

•The idea has been going round and round in my head all day (= I can't stop thinking about it).这个想法一整天都萦绕在我心头。

•When one engine stopped, we had to turn round (= turn to face the opposite direction) and fly home.飞机的一台引擎熄火了，我们不得不掉头飞回。
⇒ See also theatre in the round
[raʊnd] preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) IN ALL PARTS  到处   ESSENTIAL  ■in every part of a place, or in various parts of a place 在…各处；处处；到处
•The landlord showed me round (the house).房主带我（在房子里）四处看了看。

•I had to go all round town to find a hotel that was open.我不得不在城中四处寻找还在营业的宾馆。

•This virus has been going round (the school) (= many people have had it).这种病毒（在学校）四处传播。

[raʊnd] preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) SURROUNDING  围绕   IMPROVER  ■on all or some sides of something 在…周围；在…附近；方圆
•We sat round the fire.我们围着火炉坐着。

•The house has trees all round.这座房子四周都是树。

•The pyramid is 50 metres high and 100 metres round (the base).这座金字塔高50米，底部周长100米。

•Everyone for a mile round (= in the area) heard the explosion.方圆一英里之内的人都听到了爆炸声。

[raʊnd] preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) DIRECTION  方向   IMPROVER  ■in a particular direction 在（某处）；在（某个方位）
•The garden is round the back (of the house).花园在（房子）后面。

•I used to live round (= near) here when I was a child.我童年时就住在这一带。

•You must come round (to my house) sometime soon.你找个时间一定（到我家）来坐坐。

•UK not standard We're going round (= to) the pub for a quick drink.我们要去酒馆抓紧喝上一杯。

[raʊnd] preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) right/wrong way round ■facing the right/wrong way 方向正／相反地；朝向正面／反面
•He put the wheel on the right/wrong way round.他把车轮子上好／反了。

[raʊnd] preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) round about ■approximately 大约，大概，左右
•"We'll be at your house at round about 9 o'clock, okay?"“我们将在九点左右到你家，好不好？”

[raʊnd] preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) round the corner ■very near here 在附近；在近处
•There's a great restaurant just round the corner.在不远的地方就有一家特别好的饭店。

[raʊnd] preposition adverb mainly UK (US usually around) way round ■a way of dealing with or avoiding a problem （解决或避免问题的）出路，解决办法，余地
•There's no way round this problem.这个问题没法解决。

[raʊnd] adjective CIRCULAR  圆形的   ESSENTIAL  ■shaped like a ball or circle, or curved 球形的；圆形的；弧形的
•Tennis balls and oranges are round.网球和橘子是圆的。

•a round hole/stone/table/window圆孔／石／桌／窗

•a round face圆脸

•round eyes圆眼睛

[raʊnd] adjective COMPLETE  完整的  ■(of a number) whole or complete; given to the nearest 1, 10, 100, etc. and not as exact amounts 整数的；用整数表示的；用约整数表示的
•2.8 to the nearest round number is 3.与2.8最接近的整数是三。

•"I've got 95 bottles here for you." "Could you make it a round hundred, please?"“我这里有95瓶给你。”“能不能凑个整数，给100瓶怎么样？”

[raʊnd] noun countable GROUP  组   IMPROVER  ■a number of things or group of events 一连串的事情；一系列的事件；一系列活动
•Russia and America will hold another round of talks next month.俄罗斯和美国将在下个月举行另一轮会谈。

•When we were young life was just one long round of parties/pleasure.我们年轻时，生活的内容好像就是一个又一个聚会／一件又一件令人开心的事情。
■drinks that you buy for a group of people （一人给大家买的）每人一份（饮料），一巡（饮料）
•It's your turn to buy a round.该你请大家都喝上一杯了。
■UK ■a single slice of toast, or a sandwich （面包的）一片；整片三明治■UK (US route) ■a set of regular visits that you make to a number of places or people, especially in order to take products as part of your job （尤指作为送货工作的）例行拜访
•He has a milk/paper round.他挨家送奶／报纸。
■specialized ■a song for several singers, who begin singing one after the other at various points in the song 轮唱曲，轮唱歌
[raʊnd] noun countable COMPETITION PART  比赛部分  ■a part of a competition （比赛的）一轮，一场，一局
•She was knocked out of the championship in the third round.她在锦标赛的第三轮被淘汰。
■one of the periods of time during a boxing or wrestling match when the competitors are fighting （拳击、摔跤等比赛的）回合■a complete game in golf （高尔夫球比赛打完场中所有洞的）一场
[raʊnd] noun countable BULLET  子弹  ■a bullet or other single piece of ammunition （子弹的）一发
•The soldiers had only twenty rounds left.士兵们只剩下20发子弹了。

[raʊnd] noun countable the daily round UK old-fashioned ■the tasks you have to do every day 日常工作；每天的例行工作
•I get exhausted just by the daily round.每天的例行工作就已经让我筋疲力尽了。

[raʊnd] noun countable go the rounds UK ■to go from person to person or place to place 到各处去；到处转；到处传播
•That story has gone the rounds in our office.那件事已在我们办公室传遍了。

[raʊnd] noun countable make/do the rounds ■to talk to a lot of people 交谈一圈；四处访问
•I've made/done the rounds of all the agents, but nobody has any tickets left.我已经问过所有的代理点了，但是都没有票了。

[raʊnd] noun countable on your rounds ■to be out on a regular visit 巡行；巡视；巡诊
•The doctor's out on his rounds.大夫出去巡诊了。

[raʊnd] noun countable round of applause ■when people clap 一阵掌声
•The singer got a big round of applause.歌手的演唱赢得了一阵热烈的掌声。

[raʊnd] verb transitive ■to go around something 绕过；绕行；拐（弯）
•Colin rounded the corner at high speed.科林急速拐弯。

[raʊnd] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] round sth down ■to reduce a number to the nearest whole or simple number 把（数）下舍入，舍弃尾数把（数字）调低为整数
[raʊnd] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] round sth off SHAPE  ■to make something that is pointed or sharp into a smooth, curved shape by rubbing it 把…磨光修圆，打磨掉…的锋利边角
•He used a special machine to round off the corners of the old table.他用了一台特制的机器将这张旧桌子的角打磨成圆形。
COMPLETE  ■to complete an event or activity in a pleasant or satisfactory way 圆满完成，圆满结束
•To round off her education, her father sent her to a Swiss finishing school.为了让她圆满完成学业，父亲把她送进了瑞士的一所女子精修学校。

•We rounded the meal off with a chocolate and rum cake.最后我们又品尝了巧克力和糖蜜酒蛋糕，美美地吃完了这顿饭。

[raʊnd] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   round on sb/sth ■If you round on someone or something, you suddenly turn and attack them 突然回击；突然转身攻击；猛然反扑
•The fox rounded on its pursuers.那只狐狸突然转身向追猎它的人扑来。

•figurative The Prime Minister rounded on his critics with a very forceful speech.首相突然发表了措词强硬的讲话，回击批评他的人。

[raʊnd] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] round sth/sb up ■to find and bring together a group of animals or people 使…聚拢；驱拢；使…聚集
•The cowboys rounded the cattle up.牛仔们将牛赶到一起。

•I'll just go and round up Andrew and Patrick for the meeting.我去把安德鲁和派翠克找来一起开会。

[raʊnd] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] round sth up ■to increase a number to the nearest whole or simple number 把（数字）调高为整数




about, round, around

这组词都有“在周围、在附近”的意思，其区别是：
about: 既可表静态，也可表动态。
round: 主要用于英国，多半指动态。
around: 主要用于美国，静态或动态均可。


n. 圆；循环；一回合； [数] 圆形物
 - circulation, revolution, rotation, cycle
adj. 圆的；完全的；大概的；肥胖的
 - complete, absolute, full, total, broad
adv. 在周围；迂回地；朝反方向；挨个
 - indirectly, circuitously
vt. 完成；围捕； [水运] 绕行；弄圆
 - accomplish, carry out, achieve, perform, complete
vi. 进展；变圆； [公路] 环行；发胖
 - circuit, advance
prep. 附近；绕过；大约；在…周围
 - about, around
examples: 英 [raʊnd] 美 [raʊnd]
adj.圆的；球形的；丰满的；完整的；整数的；不确切的；大量的；坦率的；严厉粗暴的adv.环绕地；周长；调转方向；依次；到某处prep.围绕；在另一侧；四处n.一局(轮)；常规活动；巡视；圆形物；(由一人给大家买的)一巡饮料；一整片面包；一阵(掌声)；一发(子弹)v.绕行；弄圆；使成为整数

(1) He put the apples on a round plate.(2) The earth is round because of gravity.(3) Eustacia slowly drew up her sleeve and disclosed her round white arm.(4) In round figures, you have $2000 left in your bank account.(5) The plan calls for a round sum of money.(6) My father gave me a round thrashing.(7) He stood there looking all round.(8) His waist measures forty inches round.(9) He turned his car round and steered for home.(10) They've moved all the furniture round.(11) I'll be round in an hour.(12) We've invited the Smiths round this evening.(13) The earth travels round the sun.(14) He knotted the tie round his neck.(15) Our house is round the next band.(16) He walked round the corner into the next street.(17) He showed me round the hospital.(18) The next round of peace talks will be held in Rome.(19) Let's have a good round of applause for the next performer.(20) I met the doctor on his round of sick calls.(21) Cut the bread into small rounds and give me two.(22) I'll buy you all a round of drinks!(23) He wins a round of applause when he end his speech.(24) We only have three rounds of ammunition left.(25) We rounded the corner at high speed.(26) Over millennia ice and water have rounded the stones.(27) The bill should have been $29.54 so I round it up to$30.

(1) 他把苹果放在一个圆盘子里。(2) 地球是由于重力而成为球形的。(3) 游苔莎慢慢地把衣袖卷起，把她那只圆润丰满的白胳膊露出来了。(4) 以整数来计算,你银行里的存款还有2000美元。(5) 这个计划需要一笔很可观的钱。(6) 我父亲把我痛打了一顿。(7) 他站在那儿环顾四周。(8) 他腰围40英寸。(9) 他调转车头把车开回家去。(10) 他们把所有的家具搬动了一遍。(11) 我在一小时后就到。(12) 我们邀请了史密斯一家今晚来作客。(13) 地球围绕太阳运转。(14) 他把领带系在脖子上。(15) 前面一拐弯就是我们家了。(16) 他走过拐角，到了另一条街上。(17) 他领我到医院的各处看了看。(18) 新一轮的和平谈判在罗马举行。(19) 咱们为下一个表演者热烈鼓掌吧。(20) 我遇到了正在巡视病人的医生。(21) 把面包切成小片，然后给我两片。(22) 我要给你们每人买一份饮料！(23) 演讲结束时他博得一阵掌声。(24) 我们只剩下三发子弹了。(25) 我们以高速度绕过拐角。(26) 在数千年之间冰和水把石头侵蚀成圆形。(27) 账单本来应该是92.
[sound:youdao-87df25da-99c7f40d-c43996c7-ed27a52b-731704f7.mp3]

translation:
v. 叫醒，惊醒; 鼓励，鼓舞; 使发脾气; 使振奋
n. 觉醒; 奋起; [军]<英>起床号; 干杯
vi. 醒来; 奋起

时态：roused, rousing, rouses
分布：唤醒(49%)，激起(23%)，奋起(15%)，觉醒(13%)


→来自古法语 reuser,摇摆，晃动，原指猎鹰晃动羽毛，词源同 ruse,进一步词源不详。引申词 义唤醒。
vt./vi.唤醒,唤起;激励;激起I was roused by the telephone bell.我被电话铃声惊醒.
【参】arouse（v 唤醒；鼓励）【反】mollify（v 平息）；quell（v 镇压）



verb transitive ■to wake someone up or make someone more active or excited 唤醒；激励，使觉醒，使奋起
•He roused himself (from a pleasant daydream) and got back to work.他不再沉迷（于甜蜜的白日梦中），开始重新投入工作。

•The speaker attempted to rouse the crowd with a cry for action.演讲者高声呼吁大家行动起来，试图激发群众的热情。





waken, rouse, wake, arouse, awake

这组词都有“唤醒、醒来”的意思，其区别是：
waken: 书面用词，常用于被动态和引申意义。
rouse: 较正式用词，用主动语态时，强调弄醒别人的努力，用被动语态时，指轻而易举地醒过来。可用于引申意义。
wake: 普通常用词，指真正的醒来。即可作及物动词也可作不及物动词。
arouse: 除表示一般的唤醒外，多作引申用。
awake: 正式用词，常指觉醒、警惕的状态，也多用于比喻。


vt. 唤醒；激起，使振奋；惊起
 - arouse, wake sb. up
vi. 醒来；奋起
 - wake up, waken up
n. 觉醒；奋起
 - arousal, wakefulness
examples: 英 [raʊz] 美 [raʊz]
v.唤醒；激起n.觉醒；奋起

(1) These words seemed to rouse Uncle Vernon.(2) He's very hard to rouse in the morning.(3) I was roused by the sound of the bell this morning.(4) The speaker was trying to rouse the audience to enthusiasm.(5) This will rouse the initiative of the people.(6) At the same time,our senses remain responsive enough so that extreme external stimuli can rouse us to wakefulness.(7) Frantz Fanon devoted himself to his ideal, but the modern masterpiece has continued his work to rouse the politicians.
(1) 这句话似乎唤醒了弗农姨父。(2) 他早晨很难被唤醒。(3) 今天早晨，我被铃声唤醒。(4) 那位演讲者正设法激起听众的热情。(5) 这将激发群众的热情。(6) 同时，我们的感官能力，所以外界极其强烈的刺激能将我们唤醒进入觉醒状态。(7) 法农早已为理想牺牲，现代电影继续追击，就看政客们何时觉醒！
[sound:youdao-104ff16e-2b659720-9feb1406-a04190fc-8c963d1c.mp3]

translation:
n. 路; （公共汽车和列车等的）常规路线; 航线; 渠道，途径
vt. 按某路线发送; 给…规定路线[次序，程序]

时态：routed, routing, routes
分布：路线(76%)，途径(23%)，为 ... 安排路线(1%)


→来自古法语 rute,路，小径，来自拉丁语 rupta via,开拓的路，来自 rupta,分开的，词源同 rip,rob,via, 路，词源同 way,trivia.引申词义路线，线路，途径等。
n.路线,路程The scout with shoulder-straps shouted on the outermost route as a routine.戴肩章的侦察员照例在最外围的路线上叫喊.



US [ru:t/ UK [raʊt] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a particular way or direction between places 路线；路途；航线
•The route we had planned took us right across Greece.我们计划走的路线正好穿过希腊。

•I live on a bus route so I can easily get to work.我的住处有一条公共汽车路线，所以上班很方便。
■a method of achieving something 途径；管道；方法
•A college education is often the best route to a good job.大学教育常常是获得一份好工作的最佳途径。
■US (UK round) ■a set of regular visits that you make to a number of places or people, especially in order to take products as part of your job （尤指作为送货工作的）例行拜访，固定路线递送
UK [ru:t] US [ru:t/ UK [raʊt] verb transitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to send 发送；运送；寄发
•Deliveries are routed via/by way of London.货物经由伦敦运送。





motorway（free way，express way）, vessel, pavement（sidewalk）, highway, route, trail, street, way, road, channel, lane

motorway（free way，express way）: 高速公路；
vessel: 血管，管道，一般指细小管道；
pavement（sidewalk）: 街道两旁的人行道；
highway: 通常指市区外可以通行各种机动车辆的交通干线;
route: 路线，航线；path：乡间小路，公园小径；
trail: 指人或兽在森林、荒野或山中踩出的小径或崎岖小道
street: 尤指城市中的道路；
way: 可指各种路、道或通道，也可指抽象的道路、方法；
road: 广阔平坦的大道，多指公路；
channel: 海峡，渠道，管道；
lane: 指农村或城镇的小道或小径，也指小巷；



highway, route, avenue, trail, street, path, motorway, way, road, pavement, lane

这组词都有“路”的意思，其区别是：
highway: 通常指市区外可以通行各种机动车辆的交通干线。
route: 指从此处通往彼处的路线、路程等。
avenue: 在美国，指城市中一侧或两侧建筑物林立的大道或马路；而在英国则常指通住乡村大住宅、私人大庄园或两旁栽树的道路。
trail: 指人或兽在森林、荒野或山中踩出的小径或崎岖小道。
street: 尤指城市中的道路，往往一侧或两侧有高大建筑物；还可指城市小镇、近郊可供人、车、马行走的平坦道路。
path: 多指由人或动物在田间、小丘或树丛中经常走动而踩出的小路，也指公园或花园等供人走的小径。
motorway: 高速公路，新词，特指为车辆快速通行而修的专线，美语为freeway或expressway。
way: 普通用词，含义广泛，可指各种路、道或通道，也可指抽象的道路。
road: 指连接两地间供行人或车辆使用的广阔平坦的大道，多指公路，也可用于引申意义。
pavement: 在英国，多指街道两旁的人行道，而美国人常用sidewlk表示人行道。
lane: 指农村或城镇的小道或小径，也指小巷。


n. 路线； [航] 航线；通道
 - door, vector, exit, channel, thread
examples: 英 [ruːt] 美 [ruːt]
n.路线；(固定)线路；途径vt.为 ... 安排路线；(按路线)发送

(1) The route was once much travelled but has fallen into disuse.(2) The bus route goes so far as that, so you'll need to take a taxi.(3) The plane deviated from its usual route.(4) Professor Layard argues that higher income is a route to higher status.(5) The flight is routed to Chicago via New York.(6) Our travel agent routed us through Italy.(7) All train ferry traffic will be routed via Dover.
(1) 这条路线旅行的人以前常走，但是现在已不用了。(2) 汽车路线到此为止了，你得叫辆的士。(3) 飞机偏离了正常的航线。(4) 莱亚德教授提出,增加收入是提高地位的一个途径。(5) 这个航班被安排经纽约飞往芝加哥。(6) 我们的旅行社安排我们途经义大利。(7) 所有的火车轮渡交通都将经多佛中转。
[sound:youdao-4c118c0f-c53ee1ae-345ef993-a737350c-c6583c30.mp3]

translation:
n. 常规; 例行程序; 生活乏味; （演出中的）一套动作
adj. 例行的; 常规的; 日常的; 普通的

分布：常规(64%)，例行公事(12%)，常规的(10%)，例行的(10%)，乏味的(2%)，无聊(2%)


→来自 route,路线，-ine,形容词后缀。引申词义常规的，日常的。
常规(rout[=route常走的道路]+ine)[-ine 1.表形容词"…的"2.表名词"人或女人"3.表名词"状态,药物等"]
n.例行公事,常规a.常规的,例行的The scout with shoulder-straps shouted on the outermost route as a routine.戴肩章的侦察员照例在最外围的路线上叫喊.



noun  IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a usual or fixed way of doing things 惯例，常规；例行公事
•There's no set/fixed routine at work - every day is different.工作内容不固定——每天都不同。

•He checks under the car for bombs as a matter of routine.他只要开车就先习惯性地检查车下是否被安了炸弹。
 ADVANCED  countable ■a regular series of movements, jokes or similar things used in a performance （表演中）一套固定的动作，固定的一套噱头．固定的表演节目
•an exercise/dance routine一套固定的练习／舞蹈动作

•He went into his usual 'I'm the head of the family' routine (= usual way of speaking).他又故态复萌，重弹“我是一家之主”的老调子。
countable specialized ■a part of a computer program that does a particular operation （电脑的）例行程式
[ru:'ti:n] adjective ■done as part of what usually happens, and not for any special reason 常规的
•a routine inspection /medical checkup常规任务／检查／体检
■ordinary and not special or unusual 例行公事的；习惯性的
•a routine case of appendicitis普通盲肠炎病例

•He died during a routine operation which went wrong.他因一次例行性手术出错而死亡。
■disapproving ■ordinary and boring 平淡的；乏味的
•My job is so routine and boring - I hate it.我的工作一成不变，枯燥乏味——我厌烦透了。




n. [计] 程序；日常工作；例行公事
 - procedure, program
adj. 日常的；例行的
 - daily, everyday, household
examples: 英 [ruː'tiːn] 美 [ruː'tiːn]
n.例行公事；常规；无聊adj.常规的；例行的；乏味的

(1) We must introduce some system into our office routine.(2) They did it as a matter of routine.(3) This type of work rapidly becomes routine.(4) You just need to break out of that boring routine.(5) The film is a love story, with routine portraits of a conductor and a violinist.(6) It was a rather routine performance.
(1) 我们须在我们日常公务中建立一些制度。(2) 他们那样做只是例行公事。(3) 这种工作很快就变得乏味无聊。(4) 你只需改变一成不变的无聊生活。(5) 那部电影是一个爱情故事,对於乐队指挥和小提琴手之间的爱情描写都是老一套。(6) 那是很一般的演出。
[sound:youdao-fb0fe27f-e62dc2ac-201b791f-89fca0b8-04606580.mp3]

translation:
n. 行，排; 划船; 吵闹; 路，街
vt. 划船; 使…成排; 与…进行划船比赛; 〈口〉争吵，吵闹

时态：rowed, rowing, rows
分布：排(62%)，划船(24%)，吵闹(5%)，吵架(5%)，路(3%)，将...排成排(1%)

raw 生的
→1.来自古英语 raew,排，行，系列，词源不确定，可能最终来自 rei,刮，砍，劈，词源同 rift,river. 2.划船，来自古英语 rowan,划船，来自 Proto-Germanic*ro,划船，来自 ere,划船，词源同 rudder.
n.(一)排,(一)行;吵嚷v.划(船等),荡桨I threw a row of arrows, which narrowly passed the narrow-minded man's eyebrows.我掷了一排箭,箭紧擦心胸狭窄的人的眉毛而过.



US [roʊ] noun LINE  行   ESSENTIAL  countable ■a line of things, people, animals, etc. arranged next to each other 一排；一行；一列
•a row of houses/books/plants/people/horses一排房屋／一排书／一行植物／一队人／一队马
•We had seats in the front/back row of the theatre.我们坐在剧场前／后排。
countable ■Row is also used in the names of some roads （用于一些道路的名称中）路，街
•Prospect Row普罗斯派克特街
in a row ■one after another without a break 接连地；连续地
•She's been voted Best Actress three years in a row.她已经连续三年当选为最佳女演员。
  Common Learner Errors   rowWarning:  choose the correct preposition!To talk about where someone or something is, don't say 'at/on the back/front/first row', say in  the back/front/first row:✗ Unfortunately, we could only get seats on the back row.
UK [rəʊ] US [roʊ] noun MOVING THROUGH WATER  在水中移动  countable usually singular ■when someone makes a boat move through water using oars (= poles with flat ends) 划（船）
•They've gone for a row to the island.他们划船去那个岛了。

UK [rəʊ] US [roʊ] noun a hard / tough row to hoe US ■a difficult situation to deal with 难以应付的情况
•Teachers have a tough row to hoe in today's schools.老师现时在学校里处理的工作很棘手。

UK [rəʊ] US [roʊ] verb intransitive or transitive ■to cause a boat to move through water by pushing against the water with oars (= poles with flat ends) 划（船）
•The wind dropped, so we had to row (the boat) back home.风小了，我们只好划船回家。

[raʊ] noun ARGUMENT  争吵   IMPROVER  countable mainly UK ■a noisy argument or fight 争吵，吵架；打斗
•My parents often have rows, but my dad does most of the shouting.我父母经常吵架，但大部分时间都是我爸在那里扯着嗓子嚷嚷。
•What was a political row over government policy on Europe is fast becoming a diplomatic row between France and Britain.这本来是一场关于政府对欧洲政策的政治争论，却很快演变成法国和英国两国之间的外交摩擦。

[raʊ] noun NOISE  噪音  only singular mainly UK ■loud noise 大的噪音，响声，闹声
•I can't concentrate because of the row the builders are making.建筑工人弄出那么大噪声，我没法集中注意力。

[raʊ] verb intransitive mainly UK informal ■to argue, especially loudly （尤指大声地）争吵，吵闹
•My parents are always rowing (about/over money).我父母总是（为了钱的事情）吵个不休。




queue, rank, line, row

这组词都有“列、队、排”的意思，其区别是：
queue: 指人们为做某事而有顺序排成的队，在等的过程中不断向前移动。
rank: 和file常为军事用语，前者指肩并肩排列整齐的士兵横排，后者指纵队。
line: 指人或物排成的行列。
row: 指单独的一列，也可指平行的数行中的一行，而不论是横或纵。


n. 行，排；划船；街道；吵闹
 - hong, range, line, rank, sound
vi. 划船；争吵
 - boat, lock horns
examples: 英 [rəʊ] 美 [roʊ]
n.排；划船；路；吵闹v.划船；将...排成排；吵架

(1) Students stand hand in hand in a row.(2) He glanced towards the row of girls.(3) They asked me to go for a row with them.(4) He had a row with his neighbor.(5) I had a stand-up row with my boss today.(6) Can you row me up/across the river?(7) He likes to row and to play tennis.(8) They are rowing again.
(1) 学生们手牵手站成一排。(2) 他拿眼把那一排女孩子一溜。(3) 他们邀请我和他们一道去划船。(4) 他与邻居吵了一架。(5) 今天我跟上司大吵了一顿。(6) 你能划船将我送到河的上游/对岸吗?(7) 他喜欢划船也喜欢打网球。(8) 他们又吵起来了。
[sound:youdao-1618deff-3973c3c3-9c9a3673-b1ccfad2-52768ca0.mp3]

translation:
adj. 王国的，王室的; 高贵的，庄严的; 盛大的; 敕许的，敕定的
n. <口>王室成员; [航海]顶桅帆

分布：盛大的(25%)，高贵的(19%)，皇家的(19%)，堂皇的(17%)，顶桅帆(12%)，第一流的(8%)


→来自拉丁语 regalis,国王的，王室的，来自 rex,国王，国君，词源同 regal,rule.
a.王室的,皇家的;第一流的,高贵的The royal destroyer employs lots of loyal employees.皇家驱逐舰雇佣了很多忠心的雇员.



adjective  ESSENTIAL  (written abbreviation r) ■belonging or connected to a king or queen or a member of their family 国王的；女王的；王室的
•the royal family王室

•a royal visit国王（或女王）的访问
■good or excellent, as if intended for or typical of royalty 很好的；第一流的；似君王的
•The team was given a royal reception/welcome.球队受到了隆重的欢迎。
■mainly US ■big or great 极大的；极度的
•a royal pain/a royal mess剧痛／脏乱透顶

['rɔɪ.əl] noun countable usually plural informal ■a member of the royal family 王室成员
•The press follow the royals everywhere.王室成员们到哪里，新闻记者们就跟到哪里。




adj. 皇家的；盛大的；女王的；高贵的；第一流的
 - classical, distinguished
n. 王室；王室成员
 - house-hold
examples: 英 ['rɔɪəl] 美 ['rɔɪəl]
adj.盛大的；皇家的；高贵的；第一流的；堂皇的n.顶桅帆；王室成员，贵族；纸张规格（书写纸19×24寸/印刷纸20×25寸）

(1) Two men carried the standard in the royal parade.(2) The royal wedding was an occasion of great festivity.(3) Britain has always had a large navy, called the Royal Navy.(4) My life is like a tapestry of rich and royal hue.(5) There is no royal road to geometry.(6) Like Princess Grace of Monaco, Diana was a celebrity royal.
(1) 在盛大的游行队伍中, 两个男子打着旗子。(2) 皇室婚礼是喜庆的盛事。(3) 英国一直有一支强大的海军，称为皇家海军。(4) 我的生活就象那色彩高贵而又丰富的挂毯。(5) 没有为国王特设的通往几何学的道路。(6) 和摩纳哥的公主一样，黛安娜是一位著名的王室成员。
[sound:youdao-394c9009-ed0d8db1-e180a044-a2870b1e-02a9da48.mp3]

translation:
vt. 擦，摩擦; 用…擦; 触怒; （使）相互磨擦
vi. 接触，摩擦; 擦伤; 在困境中持续下去
n. 摩擦的动作; 表面不平; 阻碍，困难

时态：rubbed, rubbing, rubs
分布：擦(63%)，摩擦(23%)，搓(9%)，困难(3%)，障碍(1%)，惹恼(1%)


→词源不详。
v.擦,摩擦He rubbed his hands.他搓揉双手.



verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-) IMPROVER  ■to press or be pressed against something with a circular or up and down repeated movement 擦；摩擦；搓；揉搓
•She yawned and rubbed her eyes sleepily.她打着哈欠睡意蒙地揉着眼睛。

•He rubbed (at) the stain on his trousers and made it worse.他去擦裤子上的污渍，结果越擦越脏。

•We rubbed some polish into the surface of the wood.我们在木头表面刷了一些亮光漆。

•She gently rubbed the ointment in.她轻轻揉搓使药膏渗入。

•First rub the baking tray well with butter.先用奶油仔细涂擦烤盘。

•[+ obj + adj] Alice rubbed the blackboard clean for the teacher.爱丽斯替老师擦干净黑板。

•Your cat keeps on rubbing itself (up) against my leg.你的猫老是在我的腿上蹭来蹭去。

•She was rubbing her hands (together) at the thought of winning.想到会获胜，她高兴得直搓手。

•The branches rubbed against each other in the wind.树枝在风中相互摩挲。

•The chair legs have rubbed holes in the carpet.椅子腿把地毯都磨出了洞。

•My new shoes are rubbing (against/on my toe) and now I've got blisters.我的新鞋磨脚（趾），都起泡了。

•These marks will never rub off (= be cleaned off).这些痕迹永远都擦不掉了。

•Alice rubbed the sums off (= cleaned them off) the blackboard for the teacher.爱丽斯替老师把黑板上的算术题擦去。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)rub sb's nose in it ■to say or do things which make someone remember that they failed or got something wrong 揭（某人）的疮疤；不断提起（某人）以前的过失
•Sue failed her exam, so just to rub her nose in it, I put my certificate up on the wall.休考试没有及格，所以我把自己的证书贴在墙上，就是为了让她难堪。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)rub salt in/into the wound ■to make a difficult situation even worse for someone 伤口上撒盐，雪上加霜（使某一困难局势对某人来说变得更糟）
•Losing was bad enough, having to watch them receiving the trophy just rubbed salt into the wound.落败已经很糟糕了；还要看着他们接受那个奖杯，更是在伤口上撒盐。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)rub shoulders (with) (US also rub elbows (with)) informal ■to meet and spend time with （与某人）接触；（与某人）交往；（与某人）厮混
•She claims that she rubs shoulders with royalty all the time.她声称她一直和王室成员有交往。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)rub sb up the wrong way UK (US rub sb the wrong way) ■to annoy someone without intending to （无意间）触犯（某人），惹恼（某人）
•As soon as they met they started to rub each other up the wrong way.他们刚一见面就惹得彼此很不高兴。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)  Phrasal Verbs   rub along UK informal ■If two people rub along, they work or live together in a satisfactory way 和睦；相处得好；搭档默契
•My flat-mate and I rub along okay together.我的同屋和我相处得很好。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] rub sth down ■to rub something with a rough cloth, brush or paper until its surface is smooth, or clean and shiny 磨平；磨光；把…擦磨干净
•Rub the wood down with fine sandpaper till it is smooth.用细砂纸把木头磨光滑。

•We rubbed the walls down with soap and hot water.我们用肥皂和热水把墙面擦干净了。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] rub sth/sb down ■to use a cloth to dry an animal or person 将…擦干
•I used a towel to rub the dog down after his bath.我给狗洗完澡后用毛巾把它的毛擦干。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)  Phrasal Verbs   rub sth in ■to talk to someone about something which you know they want to forget because they feel bad about it 触及（某人）的痛处；提及令（某人）尴尬的事情
•OK, I made a mistake, - you don't have to rub it in.好了，我是犯了错误——可你也没有必要哪壶不开提哪壶。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)  Phrasal Verbs   rub off informal ■If a quality or characteristic that someone has rubs off, other people begin to have it because they have been with that person and learnt it from them （品质、性格等）感染，影响，传给
•His enthusiasm is starting to rub off on the rest of us.他的热情开始感染到我们所有人。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] rub sth out UK ■to remove writing or a mark from something by rubbing it with a piece of rubber or a cloth （用橡皮、布等）擦掉，抹掉（字迹、痕迹等）
•It's in pencil, so you can rub it out if you need to.这是用铅笔写的，这样如果你需要擦掉的话就会很容易。

[rʌb] verb intransitive or transitive (-bb-)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] rub sb out US slang ■to murder someone 杀掉（某人）；干掉（某人）；除掉（某人）
•He was rubbed out by the Mafia.他被黑手党干掉了。

[rʌb] noun countable ■when you rub something 擦；摩擦；搓；揉搓
•He gave her hair a good rub to dry it.他仔细地擦干了她的头发。

[rʌb] noun countable the rub formal ■the particular problem that makes a situation difficult or impossible 问题，困难，障碍
•You can't get a job unless you have experience, but there's the rub, you can't get experience unless you have a job.没有工作经验你就没法找到一份工作，但问题是，没有工作又没法获得经验。




vt. 擦；摩擦；惹怒
 - wipe, mop up
vi. 擦；摩擦；擦破
 - mop up, wipe
n. 摩擦；障碍；磨损处
 - friction, bar, obstacle, dam, let
examples: 英 [rʌb] 美 [rʌb]
v.擦；摩擦；搓；惹恼n.困难；障碍；擦

(1) I rubbed the window with a cloth.(2) We may have to rub polish on the floor.(3) He asked me to rub up the silver.(4) The wheel's rubbing on the mudguard.(5) It is an Eskimo custom to rub noses as a greeting.(6) He rubbed his hands to keep them warm.(7) We need money badly, but there's the rub: no one will lend us any.(8) There lies the rub.(9) Mum has given the spoons a good rub to make them clean.
(1) 我用一块布擦窗子。(2) 我们可能得在地板上涂上光剂了。(3) 他让我把银器擦一擦。(4) 车轮蹭著了挡泥板。(5) 相互摩擦鼻子以示问候是爱斯基摩人的习俗。(6) 他揉搓着双手来取暖。(7) 我们急需要钱,但困难的是:谁也不会借钱给我们。(8) 障碍就在这。(9) 妈妈已经把这些匙擦干净了。
[sound:youdao-f9bac146-234c3adb-80cfc48f-e058cf73-0d562b6c.mp3]

translation:
n. 橡胶; 橡皮; 决胜局; 避孕套
adj. 橡胶制成的
vt. 涂橡胶于; 用橡胶制造
vi. 扭转脖子看; 好奇地引颈而望

时态：rubbered, rubbering, rubbers
分布：橡胶(70%)，橡皮(25%)，橡胶的(3%)，橡胶制品(2%)


→来自 rub,刮，擦，-er,表物。
n.橡皮,橡胶;橡胶制品,胶鞋The bulk of the ruby rubbish on the pebble bubbles when stirred by bulbed rubber club.小卵石上的大部分红宝石废料在用有球状突起的橡胶短棍搅动是会起泡.
【记】源于：rub（v 擦；摩擦）ber：橡皮；橡胶



US [-ɚ] noun SUBSTANCE  物质   ADVANCED  uncountable ■an elastic substance (= that stretches) made either from the juice of particular tropical trees or artificially 橡胶；合成橡胶
•Tyres are almost always made of rubber.几乎所有轮胎都是用橡胶制成的。
 ADVANCED  countable UK * an eraser  countable US slang for * a condom  rubbers [plural] US old-fashioned for * overshoes 
UK ['rʌb.ər] US [-ɚ] noun GAME  比赛  countable ■a series of three or five games between two teams, especially in card games or cricket 多轮决胜负的比赛（尤指啤牌或板球三局两胜或五局三胜）
•We played a rubber of bridge.我们进行了一次三局两胜制的桥牌比赛。

UK ['rʌb.ər] US [-ɚ] noun a rubber check US humorous ■a cheque (= piece of paper from someone's bank that they sign and use for money) that is not worth anything because the person does not have enough money in the bank 空头支票（某人签署的、用于取钱的银行支票，但没有价值，因为这个人的银行帐户上没有足够的钱）



n. [橡胶] 橡胶；橡皮；合成橡胶；按摩师
 - India-rubber, gum
examples: 英 ['rʌbə(r)] 美 ['rʌbər]
n.橡胶；橡皮；橡胶制品adj.橡胶的

(1) Oil and grease will rot the rubber of your tyres.(2) My classmate borrowed my rubber and forgot to return it.(3) She used a rubber band to tie her hair.(4) Rubber boots are impervious to water.(5) Rubber is the country's principal export.
(1) 油污能腐蚀轮胎橡胶。(2) 我的同学借了我的橡皮忘了还。(3) 她用一根橡皮筋扎头发。(4) 橡胶鞋是防水的。(5) 橡胶制品是该国主要的出口产品。
[sound:youdao-bcdbb573-71912766-605a2ca6-f8507e13-6ef7b693.mp3]

translation:
n. 垃圾; 无意义的东西; 废话; 劣质的东西
vt. <英澳·非正>把…说得一钱不值，贬损…; 轻视，蔑视; 消灭，销毁

时态：rubbished, rubbishing, rubbishes
分布：垃圾(84%)，废物(8%)，废话(6%)，碎屑(1%)，贬损(1%)


→词源不详，可能来自 rub,刮，擦，磨，引申词义刮下来的垃圾。
n.垃圾,废物;废话The bulk of the ruby rubbish on the pebble bubbles when stirred by bulbed rubber club.小卵石上的大部分红宝石废料在用有球状突起的橡胶短棍搅动是会起泡.



noun uncountable  ADVANCED  mainly UK (US garbage) (also trash) ■waste material or things that are no longer wanted or needed 垃圾；废弃物
•I forgot to put the rubbish out for collection this morning.我今天早晨忘了把垃圾拿出来让人收走。

•Put the empty box in the rubbish bin.把空盒子放在垃圾桶里。

•Take the old furniture to the rubbish dump.把这件旧家俱扔到垃圾场去。
 ADVANCED  informal ■something that you think is very low quality or not true 粗制滥造的东西，劣质的东西；废话，瞎说
•The film was rubbish.这部电影纯属垃圾。

•His ideas are a load of (old) rubbish.他的想法真是一堆垃圾。

['rʌb.ɪʃ] verb transitive UK informal ■to criticize 批评；狠批；贬低
•Why does everyone rubbish my ideas?为甚么大家都把我的想法批得一文不值？

['rʌb.ɪʃ] adjective UK informal ■completely without skill at a particular activity 一窍不通的；蹩脚的
•I'm rubbish at arithmetic.我对算术一窍不通。





waste, debris, rubbish, litter, garbage, junk

这组词都有“废物，垃圾”的意思，其区别是：
waste: 普通用词，概念广泛，指任何被丢弃的东西。
debris: 着重指分解、分裂或破坏后剩下的碎片，也指零散的普通废品。
rubbish: 普通用词，指任何成堆的、破损的、用过的或无用的东西，尤指弃掉的垃圾堆。也可作引申用。
litter: 是四下乱丢物品的总称，尤指散落于地，有碍观瞻的废物。
garbage: 主要指有机废料，包括厨房的剩菜剩饭或不能再用的食物。也可作引申用。
junk: 指回收的旧汽车或大型机器，也指毫无实用价值，或破烂物体，但不指垃圾。



rubbish, nonsense

这组词都有“废话，胡说”的意思，其区别是：
rubbish: 从本义垃圾引申而指毫无价值的话或思想。
nonsense: 指因愚蠢或无知而出现的一切荒唐和无意义的言语。


n. [环境] 垃圾，废物；废话
 - refuse, garbage, waste, junk, trash
adj. 毫无价值的
 - poxy, jadish
examples: 英 ['rʌbɪʃ] 美 ['rʌbɪʃ]
n.垃圾；废物；废话；碎屑v.贬损

(1) The dustman comes once a week to collect the rubbish.(2) That new TV show is absolutely rubbish.(3) He was gulled into buying rubbish.(4) I thought he talked a lot of rubbish.(5) The film was rubbished by the critics.(6) The government's plan was rubbished by the opposition parties.
(1) 垃圾工每周来收一次垃圾。(2) 那个新的电视节目一点儿价值都没有。(3) 他被骗买了废物。(4) 我觉得他谈的都是些废话。(5) 影评家把这部影片贬得一无是处。(6) 政府的计划被反对党批得一钱不值。

translation:
n. 小块地毯; 〈英〉（围盖膝的）围毯，车毯; 〈美俚男子假发

分布：地毯(82%)，毯子(16%)，旅行毯(2%)


→来自古诺斯语 rogg,粗毛，粗布，来自 Proto-Germanic*rawwa,粗糙的，皱的，来自 reue, 击，打，撕开，词源同 rag,rough.
n.(小)地毯;围毯The ugly druggist gauged the huge plug in the refugee's rug.丑陋的药剂师测量了难民毛毯中的巨大插头.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a piece of thick heavy cloth smaller than a carpet, used for covering the floor or for decoration 小地毯；垫子
•My dog loves lying on the rug in front of the fire.我的狗喜欢趴在炉火前的小地毯上。
■a soft cover that keeps you warm or comfortable 厚毯子，毛毯slang for * toupée 




blanket, rug, carpet

这组词都有“毛毯，地毯”的意思，其区别是：
blanket: 指厚实的棉、毛织品，用于铺床或披在身上保暖的毛毯。
rug: 指小地毯或旅行用的小毛毯。
carpet: 指用来铺地板或楼梯的厚实的棉、毛地毯。


n. 小地毯；毛皮地毯；男子假发
 - peruke, toupee
examples: 英 [rʌɡ] 美 [rʌɡ]
n.地毯；毯子；旅行毯

(1) Look at the holes that have been worn in this rug.(2) I slid the rug in front of the fire.(3) Bind the edge of the rug so that it won't ravel.(4) The rug singed because it was too near the fire.(5) She put a rug over the sleeping child.(6) She wove a rug from the black sheep's wool.(7) You'd better take the travelling rug with you.
(1) 瞧瞧这块小地毯上磨出的洞。(2) 我挪了挪铺在炉前的地毯。(3) 给地毯镶个边以免开线。(4) 地毯太靠近壁炉已烤焦了。(5) 她给睡著的孩子盖上了毯子。(6) 她用黑绵羊的毛织了一个毯子。(7) 你最好随身携带旅行毯。

translation:
vt. 破坏，毁灭; 使破产; 使没落，使堕落; 变成废墟
n. 毁灭，灭亡; 废墟，遗迹; [灭亡]的原因，祸根; 损失
vi. 被毁灭; 破产; 堕落

时态：ruined, ruining, ruins
分布：毁灭(52%)，废墟(23%)，毁坏(16%)，崩溃(9%)


→来自拉丁语 ruina,倒塌，毁坏，来自 ruere,倒塌，崩塌，来自 reue,击，打，撕开，词源 同 rag,rough.字母 g 脱落，比较 regulate,rule.
v.毁灭;(使)破产n.毁灭,崩溃;(pl.)废墟It's evident that the evil devil inevitably goes to ruin.很明显,邪恶的魔鬼必然灭亡.



verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to spoil or destroy severely or completely （完全）毁掉，毁坏；破坏；糟踏
•Huge modern hotels have ruined this once unspoilt coastline.庞然大物般的现代旅馆已经完全毁掉了这片曾经如世外桃源般的海岸。

•Her injury ruined her  chances of winning the race.她受了伤，毁掉了赢得比赛的机会。
■to cause a person or company to lose all their money or their reputation 使破产；使身败名裂；毁灭
•Cheap imported goods are ruining many businesses.廉价的进口商品使众多公司正走向破产。

•If there's a scandal I'll be ruined!如果出了丑闻，我就会身败名裂！

['ru:.ɪn] noun uncountable ■when something is spoilt or destroyed 毁掉，毁坏，破坏
•The car accident meant the ruin of all her hopes.这场撞车事故使她的一切希望都彻底破灭了。

•They let the palace fall into ruin.他们听任那座宫殿沦为一片废墟。
uncountable ■when a person or company loses all their money or their reputation 破产；身败名裂；毁灭
•Many companies are on the edge/brink/verge of ruin.很多公司濒临破产。

•Alcohol was my ruin (= the thing that spoiled my life)酒毁掉了我的一生。
countable ■the broken parts that are left from an old building or town 废墟；残垣断壁；倒塌的建筑物
•We visited a Roman ruin.我们游览了一处古罗马遗址。

•the ruins of the ancient city of Carthage迦太基古城遗址
be/lie in ruins ■(of a building or city) to be extremely badly damaged so that most of it has fallen down （建筑物或城市）沦为一片废墟，成为一片残垣断壁
•The town lay in ruins after years of bombing.数年的轰炸已把这座城镇变成一片废墟。
■to be in an extremely bad state 完全毁坏；严重受损；垮掉
•The economy was in ruins after the war.战后经济完全陷于崩溃之中。





destroy, break, wreck, ruin, spoil, damage

这组词都有“破坏，损坏”的意思，其区别是：
destroy: 多指彻底地、毁灭性地破坏，含导致无用，不能或很难再修复的意味。
break: 普通用词，指某物因被打破或撕破而受到破坏，可指有形或无形的破坏。
wreck: 侧重指船只、车辆、房屋等受到严重破坏或完全毁坏，也可指计划、健康受到损害。
ruin: 多指因外部原因而受到严重破坏或毁灭，侧重破坏的彻底性，也可用于引申意义。
spoil: 强调不仅会削弱力量、精力或价值，而且会导致不可避免的毁灭。
damage: 多指对无生命物体的损害，造成降低价值、破坏功能等后果。



destroy, harm, ruin, damage

这组词都有“破坏”的意思，其区别是：
destroy: 指十分彻底的毁坏，破坏。如：The whole city was destroyed in the earthquake.( 地震中整个城市被毁了。)
harm: 多指带来悲痛，产生恶果的伤害，可以是肉体的也可是精神的。如：Doctors say smoking harms our health.(医生说吸烟对身体有害。)
ruin: 为正式用词，强调由于自然力或时间的作用而逐渐损坏，用于比喻时也指彻底毁坏名声，期望等。如：She poured water all over my painting and ruined it. (她把水倒在画上，把它毁了。)另外，ruin的复数形式ruins表“废墟”。
damage: 一般指部分性的破坏，含可修复使用。


n. 废墟；毁坏；灭亡
 - demolition, disruption
vt. 毁灭；使破产
 - devastate, go to the dogs
vi. 破产；堕落；被毁灭
 - fail, go bankrupt
examples: 英 ['ruːɪn] 美 ['ruːɪn]
vt.毁灭；毁坏；（使）破产；糟蹋，使（妇女）失去贞操n.毁灭；废墟；崩溃

(1) He ruined his prospcets by carelessness.(2) The politics of the company will ruin their image.(3) His enemies maliciously conspired to ruin him.(4) The rain ruined my painting.(5) Her nervousness threatens to ruin the whole idea.(6) Only great efforts can retrieve the firm from ruin.(7) These changes spell ruin for the company.(8) The minister's enemies engineered his ruin.(9) Tom visualized the house as a romantic ruin.(10) He is verging on ruin.
(1) 他因疏忽大意而断送了前途。(2) 公司的策略会毁掉他们的形象。(3) 他的敌人恶毒地密谋搞垮他。(4) 这场雨把我的画给毁了。(5) 她的惊慌失措可能会破坏整个计划。(6) 只有巨大的努力才能挽救这个濒于破产的公司。(7) 这些变化意味着该公司破产。(8) 部长的敌人密谋陷害他。(9) 汤姆把那所房子想像成有传奇色彩的废墟。(10) 他正濒临毁灭。
[sound:youdao-02fb0b24-dc30e7b8-cad0d054-9fd8360e-c3cda804.mp3]

translation:
n. 规则，规定; 统治，支配; 章程
vt. & vi. 控制，支配; 判定; 裁定，裁决; 价格稳定
vt. 统治; 规定; 管理; 裁决
vi. 统治; 管辖; 裁定

时态：ruled, ruling, rules
分布：规则(62%)，统治(25%)，习惯(5%)，支配(5%)，条例(1%)，直尺(1%)，画直线(1%)


→缩写自拉丁语 regula,直尺，规则，来自拉丁语 regere,拉直，管理，词源同 regulate.引申诸相 关词义。
v.统治;支配;裁定n.规章,条例;习惯;统治Comply with the compatible rule of complement when using compliments.使用问候语时遵守补语的相容规则.



noun INSTRUCTION  指导   ESSENTIAL  countable usually plural ■an accepted principle or instruction that states the way things are or should be done, and tells you what you are allowed or are not allowed to do 规则；法则；规章；条例
•A referee must know all the rules of the game.裁判一定要通晓比赛的所有规则。

•The first/most important rule in life is always to appear confident.人生的首要法则就是永远要表现得自信。

•Before you start your own business you should be familiar with the government's rules and regulations.在创立自己的公司之前，你应该了解政府的有关条例和规定。

•You must follow/obey/observe the rules.你一定要遵守规则。

•You must not break the rules.你千万不可违反规则。

•In special cases the manager will bend/stretch the rules (= allow the rules to be broken).在特殊情况下，经理会对这些规定进行变通。

•You can trust Ruth because she always plays (it) by/goes by/does things by the rules (= follows instructions, standards, or rules).你可以信任露丝，她做事一贯遵守规矩。

•[+ to infinitive] It's against the rules (of/in boxing) to hit below the belt.击打腰带以下的部位是违反（拳击比赛）规则的。

•[+ that] It's a club rule that new members must sing a song.新成员一定要唱一首歌，这是俱乐部的规定。

[ru:l] noun CONTROL  控制   ADVANCED  uncountable ■when a particular person or group is in control of a country 统治（期）；管辖（期）
•The period of Fascist rule is one people try to forget.那段法西斯统治的历史时期是人们想要努力忘却的。

•We don't want one-party rule - we want rule by the people.我们不想要一党专政－－我们想要的是民治。
⇒ See also misrule
[ru:l] noun as a (general) rule ■usually 通常；一般说来
•As a general rule, I only read detective novels.通常我只看侦探小说。

[ru:l] noun make it a rule ■to act according to a principle 按规矩；按照习惯，遵循常规
•I make it a rule not to eat fatty foods.我不吃油腻的食物，这是我的习惯。

[ru:l] noun the rule ■the usual situation 普遍情况；惯常的事，通常发生的事
•In England, it often seems that rain is the rule all the year round.在英格兰，人们常感觉好像一年到头总在下雨。

[ru:l] noun rule of thumb ■a practical and approximate way of doing or measuring something 实用的估测方法；经验之谈；经验法则
•A good rule of thumb is that a portion of rice is two and a half handfuls.做米饭时放多少米有个方便实用的估算方法，即两把半生米便是够一人吃的量。

[ru:l] noun Rules are made to be broken. saying ■used to say that it is good and acceptable to not obey a rule （用于表示违反一项规则合情合理）制定规则是为了被打破的。
[ru:l] verb CONTROL  控制   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to control, or to be the person in charge of a country 控制；统治；治理
•Most modern kings and queens rule (their countries) only in a formal way, without real power.现代的大多数国王或女王（对他们的国家）的统治都只是形式上的，并不握有实权。

•She rules her household with an iron hand/fist (= severely).她在家里攥着大权，持家很严。
intransitive or transitive ■to be the most important and controlling influence on someone 支配，操控，控制
•Love ruled supreme in her heart.她的心已被爱所俘虏。

•The desperate desire to go to Moscow ruled their lives.要去莫斯科的强烈愿望支配了他们的生活。

[ru:l] verb DECIDE  决定   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to decide officially 裁决，裁定；判定；决定
•Only the Appeal Court can rule on this point.只有上诉法院才可以就这一问题作出判决。

•The judge ruled for/in favour of/against the defendant.法官作出了有利于／不利于被告的判决。

•[+ that] The government has ruled that the refugees must be deported.政府已经作出决定，难民必须被驱逐出境。

•[+ obj + noun/adj] The courts have ruled his brave action illegal.法院裁决他的勇敢行为不合法。
⇒ See also overrule
[ru:l] verb DRAW  画  transitive ■to draw a straight line using something that has a straight edge （借助有直边的东西）画（线）
•She ruled two red lines under the title.她在标题下面画了两条红线。

[ru:l] verb be ruled by sb formal ■to take the advice of someone 听从（某人）的忠告；采纳（某人）的建议
•If you're wise you'll be ruled by your father.你要是明智的话，就该听从你父亲的建议。

[ru:l] verb rule OK UK slang ■is the best 是最棒的；必胜；无敌
•The graffiti on the wall said 'Liverpool rules OK'.满墙都是“利物浦队必胜”的涂鸦文字。

[ru:l] verb rule the roost ■to be the person who makes all the decisions in a group 当家作主；主宰；支配一切
•In that family it is the grandma who rules the roost.在那个家庭中是奶奶当家。

[ru:l] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] rule sth or sb out  IMPROVER  ■to decide or state that something is impossible or will not happen, or that something or someone is not suitable 把…排除在外；拒绝考虑
•The police haven't yet ruled out murder.员警尚未排除谋杀的可能性。

•I won't rule out a June election.我不排除六月份进行选举的可能性。

•The police have not ruled him out as a suspect.员警尚未排除他作案的嫌疑。

[ru:l] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] rule sth out ■to prevent something from happening 使…成为不可能，使…不可能发生；防止
•This recent wave of terrorism has ruled out any chance of peace talks.最近的这一波恐怖行动已经使得任何和谈的机会都化为泡影。





law, rule, regulation, code, act, constitution

这组词都有“法同，法规”的意思，其区别是：
law: 普通用词，泛指由最高当局所制订、立法机构所通过的任何成文或不成文的法规或条例。
rule: 通常指机关、团体的规章、条例或比赛规则；也指对人行为、方法等所作的规定，还可指习俗所承认的规定。
regulation: 普通用词，指用于管理、指导或控制某系统或组织的规则、规定或原则等。
code: 指某一阶层或社会所遵守的一整套法典、法规或法则；也可指与某一特殊活动或主题有关的规则。
act: 指经立法机构通过并由行政管理签署的法案。
constitution: 指治理国家或国家在处理内外政务时所遵循的基本法律和原则；也指规章规则的汇集。



direct, control, supervise, govern, administer, rule, manage

这组词都有“管理、支配”的意思，其区别是：
direct: 侧重行使领导或指导权。
control: 含义广泛的常用词，指对人或物施以约束或控制的力量。
supervise: 侧重指运用本身的或被授予的权力来管理、检查工作，含监督意味。
govern: 侧重指运用任何控制的权力来统治或管理一个国家、一个社会或一个部门，暗含能力和知识的运用。
administer: 指官方的或正式的对事务的管理。
rule: 强调用绝对或独裁的权力来管理或统治。
manage: 强调对具体事务机构进行管理，有时含受权管理或处理之意。



law, principle, rule, regulation

law: 指具体的法律，法规，法令
principle: 原理，原则，用作复数是指行为的准则，规范
rule: 规则，规章，惯常的做法，习惯
regulation: 通常用作复数，法规，条例


vi. 统治；管辖；裁定
 - king it over, reign over
n. 统治； [数] 规则
 - governance, regulation, order
vt. 统治；规定；管理；裁决；支配
 - define, regulate, manage, state, conduct
examples: 英 [ruːl] 美 [ruːl]
n.规则；条例；习惯；统治；直尺v.支配；统治；画直线

(1) Can you explain the thirty-second rule to me?(2) It's against the rule to pick up the ball.(3) Is this rule in operation yet?(4) I make it a rule to take a short walk after lunch.(5) Kenya was under (British) colonial rule for many years.(6) I am slowly but surely going to rule this land.(7) Charles ruled England for 11 years.(8) Rule a line at the end of every piece of work.
(1) 可以给我解释一下30秒规则吗?(2) 捡球是犯规的。(3) 这一条例生效了吗?(4) 我习惯在午饭后散散步。(5) 肯尼亚曾多年受(英国)殖民统治。(6) 我一定会慢慢地统一这片土地。(7) 查理一世统治英国11年。(8) 在每一篇作品的末尾画一条直线。

rumour has it ■people are saying 大家都说，据谣传说，有传言说

noun uncountable ■a reddish brown substance that forms on the surface of iron and steel as a result of decay caused by reacting with air and water 锈；铁锈
